docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x15)
  • Geography (x15)
  • Community (x2)
  • Education (x2)

docs.title: France country
docs.text:
• France A country in Europe. Capital is Paris.
  • Flag of France The flag of France has three vertical stripes: blue, white, and red. These colors represent liberty, equality, and fraternity!
  • Paris The capital city of France. Paris has a famous tall tower called the Eiffel Tower!

docs.title: Flags of Europe
docs.text:
• Europe Map A map showing all the countries in Europe. You can see where France, Poland, Germany, and other countries are located.
  • Flag of Germany The flag of Germany has three horizontal stripes: black, red, and yellow. Germany is famous for cars, castles, and fairy tales!
  • Flag of Italy The flag of Italy has three vertical stripes: green, white, and red. The colors look like basil, mozzarella, and tomatoes on pizza!
  • Flag of Luxembourg The flag of Luxembourg has red, white, and light blue horizontal stripes. Luxembourg is a very small country that speaks three languages!
  • Flag of Monaco The flag of Monaco has red and white horizontal stripes. Monaco is tiny but famous for fancy cars and royal palaces by the sea!
  • Flag of Belgium The flag of Belgium has three vertical stripes: black, yellow, and red. Belgium is famous for chocolate and waffles!
  • Flag of Spain The flag of Spain has red and yellow horizontal stripes. The colors are like the sun and peppers! Spain invented flamenco dancing.
  • Flag of Switzerland The flag of Switzerland is red with a white cross in the middle. It looks like a first aid kit! Switzerland is famous for mountains and cheese.
  • Flag of France The flag of France has three vertical stripes: blue, white, and red. These colors represent liberty, equality, and fraternity!
  • Flag of Czech Republic The flag has white and red stripes with a blue triangle. The Czech Republic is famous for beautiful Prague castle and crystal glass.
  • Flag of Slovakia A flag with white, blue, and red colors. It represents the country of Slovakia.
  • Flag of Ukraine A flag with blue and yellow colors like the sky and sun. It represents the country of Ukraine.

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x15)
  • Geography (x15)
  • Community (x2)
  • Education (x2)

docs.title: France country
docs.text:
• Francja Kraj w Europie. Stolicą jest Paryż.
  • Flaga Francji Flaga Francji ma trzy pionowe pasy: niebieski, biały i czerwony. Te kolory symbolizują wolność, równość i braterstwo!
  • Paryż Stolica Francji. Paryż ma słynną wysoką wieżę zwaną Wieżą Eiffla!

docs.title: Flags of Europe
docs.text:
• Mapa Europy Mapa przedstawiająca wszystkie kraje Europy. Możesz zobaczyć, gdzie znajdują się Francja, Polska, Niemcy i inne kraje.
  • Flaga Niemiec Flaga Niemiec ma trzy poziome pasy: czarny, czerwony i żółty. Niemcy słyną z samochodów, zamków i bajek!
  • Flaga Włoch Flaga Włoch ma trzy pionowe pasy: zielony, biały i czerwony. Kolory te przypominają bazylię, mozzarellę i pomidory na pizzy!
  • Flaga Luksemburga Flaga Luksemburga ma poziome pasy w kolorze czerwonym, białym i jasnoniebieskim. Luksemburg to bardzo mały kraj, w którym mówi się trzema językami!
  • Flaga Monako Flaga Monako ma poziome, czerwone i białe pasy. Monako jest malutkie, ale słynie z luksusowych samochodów i królewskich pałaców nad morzem!
  • Flaga Belgii Flaga Belgii ma trzy pionowe pasy: czarny, żółty i czerwony. Belgia słynie z czekolady i gofrów!
  • Flaga Hiszpanii Flaga Hiszpanii ma poziome, czerwone i żółte pasy. Kolory te przypominają słońce i paprykę! To Hiszpania wynalazła taniec flamenco.
  • Flaga Szwajcarii Flaga Szwajcarii jest czerwona z białym krzyżem pośrodku. Wygląda jak apteczka pierwszej pomocy! Szwajcaria słynie z gór i sera.
  • Flaga Francji Flaga Francji ma trzy pionowe pasy: niebieski, biały i czerwony. Te kolory symbolizują wolność, równość i braterstwo!
  • Flag of Czech Republic The flag has white and red stripes with a blue triangle. The Czech Republic is famous for beautiful Prague castle and crystal glass.
  • Flaga Słowacji Flaga w kolorach białym, niebieskim i czerwonym. Reprezentuje Słowację.
  • Flaga Ukrainy Flaga w kolorach niebieskim i żółtym, przypominającym niebo i słońce. Reprezentuje Ukrainę.

docs.title: quest_start
docs.text:
// fr_01 | Paris
// 
tags:
type: panel
color: red
---
<<set $TOTAL_COINS = 0>>
<<set $COLLECTED_ITEMS = 0>>
<<declare $QUEST_ITEMS = 0>>
<<declare $MET_GUIDE = false>>
<<declare $MET_MAJOR = false>>

Bienvenue à Paris ! #line:start 
Va parler au tuteur ! #line:start_2
<<target tutor>>

docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel_endgame
---
Super ! Je peux maintenant faire cuire la baguette. Et… #line:0017917 
FÉLICITATIONS ! Vous avez gagné ! Vous avez aimé ? #line:0d11596 
<<jump post_quest_activity>>

docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel
tags: proposal
---
Pourquoi ne dessines-tu pas la Tour Eiffel ? #line:002620f 
<<quest_end>>

docs.title: talk_tutor
docs.text:
actor: tutor
color: blue
---
J'ai vu Antura aller à la Tour Eiffel. #line:talk_tutor
<<camera_focus tour_eiffell>>
Suivez la lumière ou utilisez la carte ! #line:talk_tutor_2 
Allez-y maintenant ! #line:talk_tutor_3

docs.title: talk_eiffell_roof
docs.text:
group: toureiffel
tags: actor=GUIDE
---
<<asset toureiffell>>
La tour Eiffel mesure 300 mètres de haut. #line:08c1973 
<<asset mr_eiffel>>
Construit par Monsieur Eiffel en 1887. #line:09e5c3b 
<<asset iron>>
C'est fait de fer ! #line:0d59ade 
J'ai vu Antura se diriger vers Notre Dame. #line:04d1e52 
<<camera_focus notredame>>
Allez-y ! #line:083b3bf

docs.title: talk_eiffell_guide
docs.text:
group: toureiffel
actor: guide
---
<<if $TOTAL_COINS > 2>>
    Voici votre billet. #line:04e74ad 
    <<asset tour_eiffell_ticket>>
    <<set $TOTAL_COINS = $TOTAL_COINS-3>>
    <<action area_toureiffel>>
    <<asset tour_eiffell_map>>
    J'ai vu Antura monter au sommet de la tour. #line:089abda 
    Prenez l'ascenseur ! #line:0585a5e 
<<elseif $TOTAL_COINS > 0>> 
    Collectez toutes les pièces ! #line:04d966b 
<<else>>
    Le billet pour la Tour Eiffel coûte 3 pièces. #line:069cbb3 
<<endif>>

docs.text:

tags: actor=MAN_OLD, asset=notredame

Je suis le maire de Paris. #line:0cc11fa 
C'est la cathédrale Notre-Dame. #line:06f3fa2

C'est une célèbre église gothique, construite en 1182. #line:02edc0f 
<<action AREA_NOTREDAME_ROOF>>
Viens avec moi sur le toit de l'église ! #line:083dfcc 
<<set $MET_MAJOR = true>>

docs.text:

tags: actor=MAN_OLD

Il y a eu un gros incendie en 2019, mais nous avons pu le réparer. #line:09a0ead 
J'ai vu Antura courir dans le musée du Louvre. #line:02ba888 
C'est juste de l'autre côté de la Seine. #line:00d22e5

docs.text:

N'est-ce pas effrayant ? #line:0b5d057

femme : Tu veux entrer ? #line:0f74ff9
Oui #line:090114f 
    Bonne visite ! #line:056e051 
    <<action AREA_LOUVRE_ENTER >>
Non #line:077422a 
    D'accord. #line:0c28ea0 #do_not_translate
<<endif>>

    <<endif>>

docs.text:

---

Il a été construit dans les années 1980 pour accueillir davantage de visiteurs. #line:fr01_pyramid_2

Cette pierre possède de très anciennes lois de l'ancienne Mésopotamie. #line:fr01_hammurabi_1
Ils ont été écrits il y a près de 4 000 ans. #line:fr01_hammurabi_2

Ce grand tableau montre Napoléon devenant empereur. #line:fr01_coronation_1

docs.title: talk_cook
docs.text:
group: bakery
actor: CRAZY_MAN
---
<<if $COLLECTED_ITEMS >= 4>>

<<else>>

<<endif>>

docs.title: npc_french_guide
docs.text:
///////// NPCs SPAWNED IN THE SCENE //////////
// these npc are spawn automatically in the scene
// use these to add random facts. everythime you meet them
// they will say one of these lines randomly
tags: actor=WOMAN
color: purple
spawn_group: generic

---
Salut. Que veux-tu savoir ? #line:0070084 
Qu'est-ce que la Tour Eiffel ? #line:0d91dc0 
    La célèbre tour de fer, haute de 300 mètres. #line:0f17af0 
    Le symbole de Paris ! #line:07a113f 
Où sommes-nous? #line:09dd1da 
    Nous sommes à Paris, la ville de l'amour ! #line:02b627d 
Cet endroit est-il réel ? #line:08bede4 
    Bien sûr ! Pourquoi demandes-tu ça ? #line:08654e6 
    Eh bien... ça ressemble à un jeu vidéo, n'est-ce pas ? #line:0bc62a3 
Rien. Au revoir. #line:0fe0732

docs.title: spawned_eiffell_tourist
docs.text:
tags: actor=WOMAN
color: purple
spawn_group: eiffel_tower
---
J'aimerais monter sur la Tour Eiffel. #line:0aee9bb 
Il faut un ticket pour monter. #line:09be864 
Il y a eu une grande foire à Paris en 1889. #line:0a3f4e1 
    C'était pour célébrer le 100e anniversaire de la Révolution française. #line:01fa210 
    La Tour Eiffel a été construite pour cet événement. #line:0d6f3c4 
J'adore Paris ! #line:0bda18a

docs.title: spawned_man
docs.text:
tags: actor=MAN
color: purple
spawn_group: generic
---
Avez-vous des questions? #line:07b94e9 
Avez-vous vu Antura ? #line:0f18ad3 
    Oui ! Parlez à tout le monde et suivez les lumières ! #line:0cf9b4e 
    Non. Qui est Antura ? #line:0f9dd62 
Que fais-tu? #line:002796f 
    Je vais au travail ! #line:0fe4ff4 
    Je vais acheter du pain à la boulangerie. #line:05a38a8 
D'où viens-tu? #line:05eabcf 
    Je ne suis pas né dans ce pays. #line:0635a6a 
    De la planète Terre. #line:0749690 
Au revoir #line:0ee51fc

docs.title: spawned_kid_m
docs.text:
tags: actor=KID_M
color: purple
spawn_group: kids
---
Salut! #line:0c4d9e4 
Comment vas-tu? #line:032d401

docs.title: spawned_kid_f
docs.text:
tags: actor=KID_F
color: purple
spawn_group: kids
---
Bonjour! #line:041403d 
Ça va ? #line:04986a3

docs.title: npc_louvre_museum
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
spawn_group: louvre
---
Le Louvre est l’un des plus grands musées du monde. #line:fr01_louvre_rand_1
Vous pouvez marcher ici pendant des heures sans toujours tout voir. #line:fr01_louvre_rand_2
De nombreuses œuvres d’art ici sont plus anciennes que les grands-parents de vos grands-parents. #line:fr01_louvre_rand_3
La pyramide de verre laisse entrer la lumière dans les salles situées en dessous. #line:fr01_louvre_rand_4

docs.title: npc_notredame_base
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
spawn_group: notredame
---
Notre-Dame est une célèbre cathédrale gothique. #line:fr01_notredame_base_1
Les constructeurs ont commencé à construire ce bâtiment il y a plus de 800 ans. #line:fr01_notredame_base_2
Les grosses cloches sonnent dans toute la ville. #line:fr01_notredame_base_3

docs.title: npc_notredame_roof
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
spawn_group: notredame_roof
---
Depuis le toit, vous pouvez voir une grande partie de Paris. #line:fr01_notredame_roof_1
Des créatures de pierre appelées gargouilles sont assises ici. #line:fr01_notredame_roof_2
Les ouvriers restaurent encore certaines parties de la cathédrale. #line:fr01_notredame_roof_3

docs.title: npc_bakery
docs.text:
tags: actor=MAN_BIG
color: purple
spawn_group: bakery
---
L’odeur du pain frais rend les gens heureux. #line:fr01_bakery_1
Une baguette utilise de la farine, de l’eau, de la levure et du sel. #line:fr01_bakery_2
Les boulangers se lèvent très tôt pour commencer à faire la pâte. #line:fr01_bakery_3

Questa piramide di vetro è l'ingresso principale del museo. #line:fr01_pyramid_1
Fu costruito negli anni '80 per accogliere più visitatori. #line:fr01_pyramid_2

docs.title: npc_code_of_hammurabi
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
spawn_group: louvre
---
<<card code_of_hammurabi>>
Questa pietra ha leggi molto antiche, risalenti all'antica Mesopotamia. #line:fr01_hammurabi_1
Furono scritti quasi 4.000 anni fa. #line:fr01_hammurabi_2

docs.title: npc_coronation_of_napoleon_david
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
spawn_group: louvre
---
<<card coronation_of_napoleon_david>>
Questo grande dipinto raffigura Napoleone che diventa imperatore. #line:fr01_coronation_1
L'artista Jacques-Louis David dipinse molti dettagli. #line:fr01_coronation_2

docs.title: npc_oath_of_the_horatii_david
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
spawn_group: louvre
---
<<card oath_of_the_horatii_david>>
Questo dipinto raffigura due fratelli che fanno una promessa coraggiosa. #line:fr01_horatii_1
Insegna il dovere e il coraggio dell'antica Roma. #line:fr01_horatii_2

docs.title: npc_the_seated_scribe
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
spawn_group: louvre
---
<<card the_seated_scribe>>
Questa statua raffigura un uomo che scrive nell'antico Egitto. #line:fr01_scribe_1
I suoi occhi sembrano molto reali e luminosi. #line:fr01_scribe_2

docs.title: npc_winged_victory_of_samothrace
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
spawn_group: louvre
---
<<card winged_victory_of_samothrace>>
Questa statua raffigura una figura alata che atterra su una nave. #line:fr01_victory_1
Il vento modella i suoi vestiti e le sue ali. #line:fr01_victory_2

docs.title: talk_cook
docs.text:
group: bakery
actor: CRAZY_MAN
---
<<if $COLLECTED_ITEMS >= 4>>
    <<jump quest_end>>
<<else>>
    Aiutatemi! Antura ha fatto un pasticcio nella mia cucina! #line:07bbb10 
    Non riesco a trovare gli ingredienti per preparare la baguette. #line:09e867c 
    <<asset  baguette>>
    Il nostro pane francese speciale! #line:0874503 
    <<set $QUEST_ITEMS = 4>>
    Per favore portami 4 ingredienti: #line:07d64c7 
    farina, acqua, lievito e sale. #line:0c01530 
<<endif>>

docs.title: visit_louvre
docs.text:
group: louvre
tags: actor=WOMAN
---
<<asset louvre_inside>>
Si possono trovare numerose sculture e dipinti. #line:08dc97f 
<<jump find_monalisa>>

docs.title: find_monalisa
docs.text:
group: louvre
tags: actor=WOMAN
---

<<action monalisa>>
Vai a trovare la Monna Lisa! #line:0442392

docs.title: go_bakery
docs.text:
group: louvre
tags: actor=WOMAN_OLD
---

Ora cerca Antura! È andata in panetteria a prendere una baguette! #line:076ef0f 
Affrettarsi! #line:0e9c3e7

docs.title: baguette_salt
docs.text:
group: bakery
color: yellow
tags: actor=MAN_BIG
---
<<action COLLECT_1>>
<<card baguette_salt>>
Questo è sale. #line:00f1d2f

docs.title: baguette_flour
docs.text:
group: bakery
color: yellow
tags: actor=MAN_BIG
---
<<action COLLECT_2>>
<<card baguette_flour>>
Questa è farina. #line:06022b0

docs.title: baguette_water
docs.text:
group: bakery
color: yellow
tags: actor=MAN_BIG
---
<<action COLLECT_3>>
<<card baguette_water>>
Questa è acqua. #line:0c4d1f6

docs.title: baguette_yeast
docs.text:
group: bakery
color: yellow
tags: actor=MAN_BIG
---
<<action COLLECT_4>>
<<card baguette_yeast>>
Questo è lievito. #line:025865d

docs.title: npc_french_guide
docs.text:
///////// NPCs SPAWNED IN THE SCENE //////////
// these npc are spawn automatically in the scene
// use these to add random facts. everythime you meet them
// they will say one of these lines randomly
tags: actor=WOMAN
color: purple
spawn_group: generic

---
Ciao. Cosa vuoi sapere? #line:0070084 
Cos'è la Torre Eiffel? #line:0d91dc0 
    La famosa torre di ferro, alta 300 metri. #line:0f17af0 
    Il simbolo di Parigi! #line:07a113f 
Dove siamo? #line:09dd1da 
    Siamo a Parigi, la città dell'amore! #line:02b627d 
Questo posto è reale? #line:08bede4 
    Certo! Perché me lo chiedi? #line:08654e6 
    Beh... sembra un videogioco, non è vero? #line:0bc62a3 
Niente. Ciao. #line:0fe0732

docs.title: spawned_eiffell_tourist
docs.text:
tags: actor=WOMAN
color: purple
spawn_group: eiffel_tower
---
Vorrei salire sulla Torre Eiffel. #line:0aee9bb 
Per salire è necessario un biglietto. #line:09be864 
Nel 1889 ci fu una grande fiera a Parigi. #line:0a3f4e1 
    L'evento si è svolto per celebrare il centenario della Rivoluzione francese. #line:01fa210 
    Per quell'evento fu costruita la Torre Eiffel. #line:0d6f3c4 
Adoro Parigi! #line:0bda18a

docs.title: spawned_man
docs.text:
tags: actor=MAN
color: purple
spawn_group: generic
---
Hai qualche domanda? #line:07b94e9 
Hai visto Antura? #line:0f18ad3 
    Sì! Parla con tutti e segui le luci! #line:0cf9b4e 
    No. Chi è Antura? #line:0f9dd62 
Cosa fai? #line:002796f 
    Vado a lavorare! #line:0fe4ff4 
    Vado a comprare il pane al panificio. #line:05a38a8 
Da dove vieni? #line:05eabcf 
    Non sono nato in questo paese. #line:0635a6a 
    Dal pianeta Terra. #line:0749690 
Arrivederci #line:0ee51fc

docs.title: spawned_kid_m
docs.text:
tags: actor=KID_M
color: purple
spawn_group: kids
---
CIAO! #line:0c4d9e4 
Come stai? #line:032d401

docs.title: spawned_kid_f
docs.text:
tags: actor=KID_F
color: purple
spawn_group: kids
---
Buongiorno! #line:041403d 
Ca va? #line:04986a3

docs.title: npc_louvre_museum
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
spawn_group: louvre
---
Il Louvre è uno dei musei più grandi del mondo. #line:fr01_louvre_rand_1
Si può camminare qui per ore e non riuscire a vedere tutto. #line:fr01_louvre_rand_2
Molte delle opere d'arte qui esposte sono più vecchie dei nonni dei tuoi nonni. #line:fr01_louvre_rand_3
La piramide di vetro lascia entrare la luce nei corridoi sottostanti. #line:fr01_louvre_rand_4

docs.title: npc_notredame_base
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
spawn_group: notredame
---
Notre-Dame è una famosa cattedrale gotica. #line:fr01_notredame_base_1
I costruttori iniziarono a costruirlo più di 800 anni fa. #line:fr01_notredame_base_2
Le grandi campane risuonano in tutta la città. #line:fr01_notredame_base_3

docs.title: npc_notredame_roof
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
spawn_group: notredame_roof
---
Dal tetto si può ammirare gran parte di Parigi. #line:fr01_notredame_roof_1
Qui siedono delle creature di pietra chiamate gargoyle. #line:fr01_notredame_roof_2
Gli operai stanno ancora restaurando alcune parti della cattedrale. #line:fr01_notredame_roof_3

docs.title: npc_bakery
docs.text:
tags: actor=MAN_BIG
color: purple
spawn_group: bakery
---
Il profumo del pane fresco rende le persone felici. #line:fr01_bakery_1
Per preparare la baguette si usano farina, acqua, lievito e sale. #line:fr01_bakery_2
I fornai si svegliano molto presto per iniziare a preparare l'impasto. #line:fr01_bakery_3

docs.title: Paris! (fr_01) - Script
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

docs.title: quest_start
docs.text:
// fr_01 | Paris
// 
tags:
type: panel
color: red
---
<<set $TOTAL_COINS = 0>>
<<set $COLLECTED_ITEMS = 0>>
<<declare $QUEST_ITEMS = 0>>
<<declare $MET_GUIDE = false>>
<<declare $MET_MAJOR = false>>
<<declare $MET_MONALISA = false>>

Welcome to Paris! #line:start 
Go talk to the tutor! #line:start_2
<<target tutor>>

docs.title: quest_end
docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel_endgame
---
Great! I can bake the baguette now. #line:0017917 
Congratulations! You won the game! Did you like it? #line:0d11596 
<<jump post_quest_activity>>

docs.title: post_quest_activity
docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel
tags: proposal
---
Why don't you draw the Eiffel Tower? #line:002620f 
<<quest_end>>

docs.title: talk_tutor
docs.text:
actor: tutor
color: blue
---
I saw Antura go to the Eiffel Tower. #line:talk_tutor
<<camera_focus tour_eiffell>>
Follow the light or use the map! #line:talk_tutor_2 
Go there now! #line:talk_tutor_3

docs.title: talk_eiffell_roof
docs.text:
group: toureiffel
tags: actor=GUIDE
---
<<asset toureiffell>>
The Eiffel Tower is 300 meters tall. #line:08c1973 
<<asset mr_eiffel>>
Gustave Eiffel built it in 1887. #line:09e5c3b 
<<asset iron>>
It is made of iron! #line:0d59ade 
I saw Antura go to Notre Dame. #line:04d1e52 
<<camera_focus notredame>>
Go there! #line:083b3bf

docs.title: talk_eiffell_guide
docs.text:
group: toureiffel
actor: guide
---
<<if $TOTAL_COINS > 2>>
    Here is your ticket. #line:04e74ad 
    <<asset tour_eiffell_ticket>>
    <<set $TOTAL_COINS = $TOTAL_COINS-3>>
    <<action area_toureiffel>>
    <<asset tour_eiffell_map>>
    I saw Antura going up to the top of the tower. #line:089abda 
    Take the elevator! #line:0585a5e 
<<elseif $TOTAL_COINS > 0>> 
    Collect all the coins! #line:04d966b 
<<else>>
    The ticket costs 3 coins. #line:069cbb3 
<<endif>>

docs.title: talk_notre_dame
docs.text:
group: notredame
tags: actor=MAN_OLD, asset=notredame
---
I am the mayor of Paris. #line:0cc11fa 
This is Notre-Dame Cathedral. #line:06f3fa2 
<<card notredame zoom>>
It is a famous Gothic church. Built in 1182. #line:02edc0f 
<<action AREA_NOTREDAME_ROOF>>
Come with me to the roof! #line:083dfcc 
<<set $MET_MAJOR = true>>

docs.title: talk_notre_dame_roof
docs.text:
group: notredame
tags: actor=MAN_OLD
---
<<asset notredame_fire>>
There was a big fire in 2019, but we repaired it. #line:09a0ead 
I saw Antura run into the Louvre. #line:02ba888 
It is across the River Seine. #line:00d22e5

docs.title: gargoyle
docs.text:
group: notredame
---
Look at that statue! #line:0f7f9d8 
<<card gargoyle zoom>>
Isn't it scary? #line:0b5d057

docs.title: talk_louvre_external
docs.text:
group: louvre
actor: OLD_WOMAN
---
<<if $MET_MONALISA>>
    <<card go_bakery>>
<<else>>
<<asset louvre>>
This is the entrance to the Louvre, our national art museum. #line:0cf1cc8 
Do you want to go in? #line:0f74ff9
Yes #line:090114f 
    Enjoy your visit! #line:056e051 
    <<action AREA_LOUVRE_ENTER >>
No #line:077422a 
    Ok. Au revoir. #line:0c28ea0 #do_not_translate
<<endif>>

docs.title: talk_louvre_guide
docs.text:
group: louvre
tags: actor=WOMAN
color: blue
---
Welcome to the Louvre. What do you want to do? #line:0e6d2a5 
Tell me about the Louvre #line:0a5fc63 
    <<jump visit_louvre>>
Exit #line:0efc18f 
    <<if $MET_MONALISA>>
        <<action AREA_LOUVRE_EXIT>>
        Come back! #line:07dd921 
    <<else>>
        <<jump find_monalisa>>
    <<endif>>

docs.title: louvre_monalisa
docs.text:
group: louvre
color: yellow
tags: actor=WOMAN
---
<<asset monalisa>>
This is the famous Mona Lisa. #line:louvre_monalisa_1
<<set $MET_MONALISA = true>>
<<asset leaonardodavinci>>
Leonardo painted it around 1500. #line:louvre_monalisa_2
by the artist Leonardo da Vinci. #line:louvre_monalisa_3

docs.title: louvre_liberty
docs.text:
group: louvre
color: yellow
tags: actor=WOMAN
---
<<asset liberty_leading>>
This painting represents freedom. #line:louvre_liberty_1
It is called Liberty Leading the People. #line:louvre_liberty_2
by the French artist Eugène Delacroix. #line:louvre_liberty_3

docs.title: louvre_venus
docs.text:
group: louvre
color: yellow
tags: actor=WOMAN, 
---
<<asset venusmilo>>
This is the Venus de Milo, an ancient Greek statue. #line:053d4fe

docs.title: npc_louvre_pyramid
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
spawn_group: louvre
---
<<card louvre_pyramid>>
This glass pyramid is the main entrance of the museum. #line:fr01_pyramid_1
It was built in the 1980s to welcome more visitors. #line:fr01_pyramid_2

docs.title: npc_code_of_hammurabi
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
spawn_group: louvre
---
<<card code_of_hammurabi>>
This stone has very old laws from ancient Mesopotamia. #line:fr01_hammurabi_1
They were written almost 4,000 years ago. #line:fr01_hammurabi_2

docs.title: npc_coronation_of_napoleon_david
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
spawn_group: louvre
---
<<card coronation_of_napoleon_david>>
This big painting shows Napoleon becoming emperor. #line:fr01_coronation_1
The artist Jacques-Louis David painted many details. #line:fr01_coronation_2

docs.title: npc_oath_of_the_horatii_david
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
spawn_group: louvre
---
<<card oath_of_the_horatii_david>>
This painting shows brothers making a brave promise. #line:fr01_horatii_1
It teaches duty and courage from ancient Rome. #line:fr01_horatii_2

docs.title: npc_the_seated_scribe
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
spawn_group: louvre
---
<<card the_seated_scribe>>
This statue shows a man writing in ancient Egypt. #line:fr01_scribe_1
His eyes look very real and bright. #line:fr01_scribe_2

docs.title: npc_winged_victory_of_samothrace
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
spawn_group: louvre
---
<<card winged_victory_of_samothrace>>
This statue shows a winged figure landing on a ship. #line:fr01_victory_1
The wind shapes its clothes and wings. #line:fr01_victory_2

docs.title: talk_cook
docs.text:
group: bakery
actor: CRAZY_MAN
---
<<if $COLLECTED_ITEMS >= 4>>
    <<jump quest_end>>
<<else>>
    Help me! Antura made a mess in my kitchen! #line:07bbb10 
    I cannot find the ingredients to make the baguette. #line:09e867c 
    <<asset  baguette>>
    Our French bread! #line:0874503 
    <<set $QUEST_ITEMS = 4>>
    Please bring me four things: #line:07d64c7 
    flour, water, yeast, and salt. #line:0c01530 
<<endif>>

docs.title: visit_louvre
docs.text:
group: louvre
tags: actor=WOMAN
---
<<asset louvre_inside>>
There are many statues and paintings here. #line:08dc97f 
<<jump find_monalisa>>

docs.title: find_monalisa
docs.text:
group: louvre
tags: actor=WOMAN
---

<<action monalisa>>
Go find the Mona Lisa! #line:0442392

docs.title: go_bakery
docs.text:
group: louvre
tags: actor=WOMAN_OLD
---

Now look for Antura! It went to the bakery for a baguette! #line:076ef0f 
Hurry up! #line:0e9c3e7

docs.title: baguette_salt
docs.text:
group: bakery
color: yellow
tags: actor=MAN_BIG
---
<<action COLLECT_1>>
<<card baguette_salt>>
This is salt. #line:00f1d2f

docs.title: baguette_flour
docs.text:
group: bakery
color: yellow
tags: actor=MAN_BIG
---
<<action COLLECT_2>>
<<card baguette_flour>>
This is flour. #line:06022b0

docs.title: baguette_water
docs.text:
group: bakery
color: yellow
tags: actor=MAN_BIG
---
<<action COLLECT_3>>
<<card baguette_water>>
This is water. #line:0c4d1f6

docs.title: baguette_yeast
docs.text:
group: bakery
color: yellow
tags: actor=MAN_BIG
---
<<action COLLECT_4>>
<<card baguette_yeast>>
This is yeast. #line:025865d

docs.title: npc_french_guide
docs.text:
///////// NPCs SPAWNED IN THE SCENE //////////
// these npc are spawn automatically in the scene
// use these to add random facts. everythime you meet them
// they will say one of these lines randomly
tags: actor=WOMAN
color: purple
spawn_group: generic

---
Hello. What do you want to know? #line:0070084 
What is the Eiffel Tower? #line:0d91dc0 
    A tall iron tower, 300 meters high. #line:0f17af0 
    It is a symbol of Paris! #line:07a113f 
Where are we? #line:09dd1da 
    We are in Paris. #line:02b627d 
Is this place real? #line:08bede4 
    Yes! Why do you ask? #line:08654e6 
    Well... it looks like a video game. #line:0bc62a3 
Nothing. Bye. #line:0fe0732

docs.title: spawned_eiffell_tourist
docs.text:
tags: actor=WOMAN
color: purple
spawn_group: eiffel_tower
---
I would like to go up the Eiffel Tower. #line:0aee9bb 
You need a ticket to go up. #line:09be864 
There was a big fair in Paris in 1889. #line:0a3f4e1 
    It was to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the French Revolution. #line:01fa210 
    The Eiffel Tower was built for that event. #line:0d6f3c4 
I love Paris! #line:0bda18a

docs.title: spawned_man
docs.text:
tags: actor=MAN
color: purple
spawn_group: generic
---
Do you have questions? #line:07b94e9 
Have you seen Antura? #line:0f18ad3 
    Yes! Talk to people and follow the lights! #line:0cf9b4e 
    No. Who is Antura? #line:0f9dd62 
What are you doing? #line:002796f 
    I am going to work! #line:0fe4ff4 
    I am going to buy bread at the bakery. #line:05a38a8 
Where do you come from? #line:05eabcf 
    I was not born in this country. #line:0635a6a 
    From planet Earth. #line:0749690 
Goodbye #line:0ee51fc

docs.title: spawned_kid_m
docs.text:
tags: actor=KID_M
color: purple
spawn_group: kids
---
Hi! #line:0c4d9e4 
How are you? #line:032d401

docs.title: spawned_kid_f
docs.text:
tags: actor=KID_F
color: purple
spawn_group: kids
---
Bonjour! #line:041403d 
Ca va? #line:04986a3

docs.title: npc_louvre_museum
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
spawn_group: louvre
---
The Louvre is one of the largest museums in the world. #line:fr01_louvre_rand_1
You can walk here for hours and still not see everything. #line:fr01_louvre_rand_2
Many artworks here are older than your grandparents' grandparents. #line:fr01_louvre_rand_3
The glass pyramid lets in light for the halls below. #line:fr01_louvre_rand_4

docs.title: npc_notredame_base
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
spawn_group: notredame
---
Notre-Dame is a famous Gothic cathedral. #line:fr01_notredame_base_1
Builders started it more than 800 years ago. #line:fr01_notredame_base_2
The big bells ring across the city. #line:fr01_notredame_base_3

docs.title: npc_notredame_roof
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
spawn_group: notredame_roof
---
From the roof you can see much of Paris. #line:fr01_notredame_roof_1
Stone creatures called gargoyles sit up here. #line:fr01_notredame_roof_2
Workers are still restoring parts of the cathedral. #line:fr01_notredame_roof_3

docs.title: npc_bakery
docs.text:
tags: actor=MAN_BIG
color: purple
spawn_group: bakery
---
Fresh bread smell makes people happy. #line:fr01_bakery_1
A baguette uses flour, water, yeast, and salt. #line:fr01_bakery_2
Bakers wake up very early to start making dough. #line:fr01_bakery_3

docs.text:

docs.title: quest_start
docs.text:
// fr_01 | Paris
// 
tags:
type: panel
color: red
---
<<set $TOTAL_COINS = 0>>
<<set $COLLECTED_ITEMS = 0>>
<<declare $QUEST_ITEMS = 0>>
<<declare $MET_GUIDE = false>>
<<declare $MET_MAJOR = false>>
<<declare $MET_MONALISA = false>>

Witamy w Paryżu! #line:start 
Idź porozmawiać z korepetytorem! #line:start_2
<<target tutor>>

docs.title: quest_end
docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel_endgame
---
ŚWIETNIE! Teraz mogę upiec bagietkę. I... #line:0017917 
GRATULACJE! Wygrałeś grę! Podobała Ci się? #line:0d11596 
<<jump post_quest_activity>>

docs.title: post_quest_activity
docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel
tags: proposal
---
Dlaczego nie narysujesz Wieży Eiffla? #line:002620f 
<<quest_end>>

docs.title: talk_tutor
docs.text:
actor: tutor
color: blue
---
Widziałem, jak Antura udał się na Wieżę Eiffla. #line:talk_tutor
<<camera_focus tour_eiffell>>
Podążaj za światłem lub skorzystaj z mapy! #line:talk_tutor_2 
Idź tam teraz! #line:talk_tutor_3

docs.title: talk_eiffell_roof
docs.text:
group: toureiffel
tags: actor=GUIDE
---
<<asset toureiffell>>
Wieża Eiffla ma 300 metrów wysokości. #line:08c1973 
<<asset mr_eiffel>>
Zbudowany przez pana Eiffela w 1887 roku. #line:09e5c3b 
<<asset iron>>
Jest z żelaza! #line:0d59ade 
Widziałem Anturę zmierzającą w kierunku Notre Dame. #line:04d1e52 
<<camera_focus notredame>>

docs.title: Paris ! (fr_01)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: France - Paris

voyagez dans Paris à la recherche d’Antura !

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x20)
  • History (x11)
  • Geography (x9)
  • Art (x6)
  • Food (x6)

docs.title: Eiffel Tower
docs.text:
• Tour Eiffel Une haute tour, symbole de Paris. Construite en fer, elle mesure 300 mètres de haut. De là-haut, on peut admirer toute la ville.
  • Paris Paris, capitale de la France, possède une célèbre tour haute appelée la Tour Eiffel !
  • Gustave Eiffel L'homme qui a construit la tour Eiffel ! C'était un ingénieur passionné de construction en fer et il a créé la tour la plus célèbre du monde.
  • Fer Un outil chauffant utilisé pour lisser et aplatir les vêtements froissés. Attention, les fers à repasser sont très chauds !
  • Carte de la Tour Eiffel Une carte qui montre où se trouve la célèbre haute tour de Paris.
  • Billet pour la Tour Eiffel Un document spécial qui vous permet de visiter la célèbre haute tour de Paris, en France.

docs.title: Baguette
docs.text:
• Baguette française Un pain long et croustillant, l'aliment le plus célèbre en France. Les Français achètent des baguettes fraîches tous les jours à la boulangerie !
  • Paris Paris, capitale de la France, possède une célèbre tour haute appelée la Tour Eiffel !
  • Boulanger Une personne qui fait du pain, des gâteaux et des pâtisseries.
  • SEL Des cristaux blancs qui améliorent le goût des aliments.
  • Levure La levure est comme une poudre magique qui rend le pain moelleux et savoureux !
  • Farine Poudre blanche fabriquée à partir de blé qui est utilisée pour faire du pain.
  • Eau L'eau est essentielle à toute vie

docs.title: Notre Dame
docs.text:
• Notre-Dame de Paris Une magnifique cathédrale de Paris. Ses vitraux colorés racontent des histoires.
  • Paris Paris, capitale de la France, possède une célèbre tour haute appelée la Tour Eiffel !
  • Incendie de Notre-Dame En 2019, un important incendie a endommagé la magnifique cathédrale Notre-Dame de Paris. De nombreuses personnes ont œuvré ensemble pour sauver cet important édifice.
  • Île-de-France Région de France où se trouve la capitale Paris. De nombreuses personnes y vivent !

docs.title: Louvre
docs.text:
• Persienne Un immense musée rempli d'œuvres d'art. C'est là que vit la Joconde.
  • Paris Paris, capitale de la France, possède une célèbre tour haute appelée la Tour Eiffel !
  • La Joconde Le tableau le plus célèbre du monde ! Une femme au sourire mystérieux, peinte par Léonard de Vinci. Elle semble vous suivre du regard.
  • Léonard de Vinci Un artiste et scientifique italien exceptionnel. Il a peint la Joconde et inventé les machines volantes des siècles avant les avions !
  • La liberté guidant le peuple Un célèbre tableau sur la liberté et le courage. Il représente une femme courageuse brandissant le drapeau français et menant le peuple à la lutte pour ses droits.
  • Vénus de Milo Magnifique statue antique de femme en marbre blanc. Ses bras ont disparu, mais elle reste considérée comme l'une des plus belles statues jamais réalisées.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Cathédrale Une église très grande et importante dans une ville.

Église Un bâtiment spécial où les gens se réunissent pour prier et chanter.

Code d'Hammourabi Une pierre sur laquelle sont gravées de très vieilles lois.

Couronnement de Napoléon (David) Un immense tableau représentant une cérémonie d’un empereur français.

Ascenseurs de la Tour Eiffel Ascenseurs qui emmènent les visiteurs jusqu'à la tour de fer.

Arc-boutant Bras de pierre à l'extérieur qui aident à soutenir les hauts murs.

Gargouille Une statue drôle ou effrayante qui fonctionne également comme une gouttière.

Pyramide du Louvre La pyramide de verre qui constitue l’entrée moderne du Louvre.

Serment des Horaces (David) Un tableau de trois frères faisant une promesse courageuse.

Rosace Un grand vitrail rond qui raconte des histoires avec la lumière.

Le scribe assis Une ancienne statue égyptienne d'une personne en train d'écrire.

Victoire ailée de Samothrace Une célèbre sculpture antique d'une déesse avec des ailes.

Exposition universelle (1889) La grande exposition universelle où la Tour Eiffel a été présentée.

docs.text:

docs.title: Game Design Notes
docs.text:
Explore Paris tour through iconic landmarks.

Location: Paris, France

  1. Learn about Eiffel Tower construction
  2. visit Notre-Dame architecture
  3. explore Louvre artworks
  4. Bakery and French baguette making with ingredient collection

docs.title: Flow
docs.text:
Part 1: La Tour Eiffel and Gustave Eiffel Mission: Climb the Eiffel Tower with the elevator.

Part 2: Notre Dame de Paris Mission: find the 3 pieces of the map Character: MAJOR

Part 3: Musée du Louvre and Mona Lisa Mission: A stealth mission in the Louvre at night to go to Mona Lisa Character: TEACHER

Part 4: La Baguette Mission: Learn the art of making the perfect baguette and discover its cultural significance in French society.

docs.title: Parigi! (fr_01)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: France - Parigi

viaggia per Parigi cercando Antura!

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x20)
  • History (x11)
  • Geography (x9)
  • Art (x6)
  • Food (x6)

docs.title: Eiffel Tower
docs.text:
• Torre Eiffel Un'alta torre, simbolo di Parigi. È fatta di ferro e alta 300 metri. È possibile salire e ammirare l'intera città.
  • Parigi La capitale della Francia. Parigi ha una famosa torre alta chiamata Torre Eiffel!
  • Gustave Eiffel L'uomo che costruì la Torre Eiffel! Era un ingegnere che amava costruire in ferro e creò la torre più famosa del mondo.
  • Ferro Uno strumento caldo utilizzato per rendere i vestiti stropicciati lisci e piatti. Attenzione, i ferri da stiro sono molto caldi!
  • Mappa della Torre Eiffel Una mappa che mostra dove si trova la famosa torre alta di Parigi.
  • biglietto per la Torre Eiffel Una carta speciale che ti consente di visitare la famosa torre alta di Parigi, in Francia.

docs.title: Baguette
docs.text:
• Baguette francese Un pane lungo e croccante, il più famoso in Francia. I francesi comprano baguette fresche ogni giorno dal panettiere!
  • Parigi La capitale della Francia. Parigi ha una famosa torre alta chiamata Torre Eiffel!
  • Panettiere Una persona che prepara pane, torte e pasticcini.
  • SALE Cristalli bianchi che migliorano il sapore del cibo.
  • Lievito Il lievito è come una polvere magica che rende il pane morbido e gustoso!
  • Farina Polvere bianca ricavata dal grano, utilizzata per fare il pane.
  • Acqua L'acqua è essenziale per tutta la vita

docs.title: Notre Dame
docs.text:
• Notre-Dame de Paris Una splendida cattedrale di Parigi. Le sue vetrate colorate raccontano storie.
  • Parigi La capitale della Francia. Parigi ha una famosa torre alta chiamata Torre Eiffel!
  • Incendio di Notre-Dame Nel 2019, un grande incendio ha danneggiato la splendida Cattedrale di Notre-Dame a Parigi. Molte persone hanno collaborato per salvare questo importante edificio.
  • Île-de-France Una regione della Francia dove si trova la capitale Parigi. Qui vivono moltissime persone!

docs.title: Louvre
docs.text:
• Louvre Un enorme museo pieno d'arte. È lì che vive la Monna Lisa.
  • Parigi La capitale della Francia. Parigi ha una famosa torre alta chiamata Torre Eiffel!
  • Monna Lisa Il dipinto più famoso del mondo! Una donna dal sorriso misterioso dipinta da Leonardo da Vinci. Sembra seguirti con lo sguardo.
  • Leonardo da Vinci Un artista e scienziato italiano straordinario. Ha dipinto la Gioconda e inventato macchine volanti centinaia di anni prima degli aeroplani!
  • La libertà che guida il popolo Un famoso dipinto sulla libertà e il coraggio. Mostra una donna coraggiosa che regge la bandiera francese e guida il popolo nella lotta per i propri diritti.
  • Venere di Milo Una splendida statua antica di donna in marmo bianco. Le mancano le braccia, ma è comunque considerata una delle statue più belle mai realizzate.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Cattedrale Una chiesa molto grande e importante in una città.

Chiesa Un edificio speciale dove le persone si incontrano per pregare e cantare.

Codice di Hammurabi Una pietra su cui sono incise leggi molto antiche.

Incoronazione di Napoleone (David) Un enorme dipinto raffigurante la cerimonia di un imperatore francese.

Ascensori della Torre Eiffel Ascensori che portano i visitatori sulla torre di ferro.

Arco rampante Braccia in pietra all'esterno che aiutano a sostenere alte mura.

Gargoyle Una statua divertente o spaventosa che funziona anche come sgorgatore di pioggia.

Piramide del Louvre La piramide di vetro che costituisce l'ingresso moderno del Louvre.

Giuramento degli Orazi (Davide) Un dipinto raffigurante tre fratelli che fanno una promessa coraggiosa.

Rosone Una grande vetrata rotonda che racconta storie attraverso la luce.

Lo scriba seduto Un'antica statua egizia raffigurante una persona che scrive.

Vittoria alata di Samotracia Una famosa scultura antica raffigurante una dea con le ali.

Esposizione universale (1889) La grande esposizione universale in cui venne esposta la Torre Eiffel.

docs.title: Paris! (fr_01)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: France - Paris

travel around paris searching for Antura!

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x20)
  • History (x11)
  • Geography (x9)
  • Art (x6)
  • Food (x6)

docs.title: Eiffel Tower
docs.text:
• Eiffel Tower A tall tower and a symbol of Paris. It's made of iron and is 300 meters talll. You can go up and see the whole city.
  • Paris The capital city of France. Paris has a famous tall tower called the Eiffel Tower!
  • Gustave Eiffel The man who built the Eiffel Tower! He was an engineer who loved building with iron and created the most famous tower in the world.
  • Iron A hot tool used to make wrinkled clothes smooth and flat. Be careful, irons are very hot!
  • Eiffel Tower map A map that shows where the famous tall tower in Paris is located.
  • Eiffel Tower ticket A special paper that lets you visit the famous tall tower in Paris, France.

docs.title: Baguette
docs.text:
• French Baguette A long, crispy bread that is the most famous food in France. French people buy fresh baguettes every day from the bakery!
  • Paris The capital city of France. Paris has a famous tall tower called the Eiffel Tower!
  • Baker A person who makes bread, cakes, and pastries.
  • SALT White crystals that make food taste better.
  • Yeast Yeast is like magic powder that makes bread soft and tasty!
  • Flour White powder made from wheat that is used to make bread.
  • Water Water is essential for all life

docs.title: Notre Dame
docs.text:
• Notre-Dame de Paris A beautiful cathedral in Paris. Its colorful glass windows tell stories.
  • Paris The capital city of France. Paris has a famous tall tower called the Eiffel Tower!
  • Notre-Dame Fire In 2019, a big fire damaged the beautiful Notre-Dame Cathedral in Paris. Many people worked together to save this important building.
  • Ile-de-France A region in France where the capital city Paris is located. Many people live here!

docs.title: Louvre
docs.text:
• Louvre A huge museum full of art. It’s where the Mona Lisa lives.
  • Paris The capital city of France. Paris has a famous tall tower called the Eiffel Tower!
  • Mona Lisa The most famous painting in the world! A woman with a mysterious smile painted by Leonardo da Vinci. She seems to follow you with her eyes.
  • Leonardo da Vinci An amazing artist and scientist from Italy. He painted the Mona Lisa and invented flying machines hundreds of years before airplanes!
  • Liberty Leading the People A famous painting about freedom and courage. It shows a brave woman holding the French flag and leading people to fight for their rights.
  • Venus de Milo A beautiful ancient statue of a woman made from white marble. Her arms are missing but she is still considered one of the most beautiful statues ever made.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Cathedral A very large and important church in a city.

Church A special building where people meet to pray and sing.

Code of Hammurabi A stone with very old laws carved into it.

Coronation of Napoleon (David) A huge painting showing a French emperor’s ceremony.

Eiffel Tower Elevators Lifts that take visitors up the iron tower.

Flying Buttress Stone arms outside that help hold up tall walls.

Gargoyle A funny or scary statue that also works as a rain spout.

Louvre Pyramid The glass pyramid that is the Louvre’s modern entrance.

Oath of the Horatii (David) A painting of three brothers making a brave promise.

Rose Window A big round stained-glass window that tells stories with light.

The Seated Scribe An ancient Egyptian statue of a person writing.

Winged Victory of Samothrace A famous ancient sculpture of a goddess with wings.

World’s Fair (1889) The big world expo when the Eiffel Tower was shown.

docs.title: Paryż! (fr_01)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: France - Paryż

podróżuj po Paryżu szukając Antury!

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x20)
  • History (x11)
  • Geography (x9)
  • Art (x6)
  • Food (x6)

docs.title: Eiffel Tower
docs.text:
• Wieża Eiffla Wysoka wieża i symbol Paryża. Jest wykonana z żelaza i ma 300 metrów wysokości. Można na nią wejść i zobaczyć całe miasto.
  • Paryż Stolica Francji. Paryż ma słynną wysoką wieżę zwaną Wieżą Eiffla!
  • Gustave Eiffel Człowiek, który zbudował Wieżę Eiffla! Był inżynierem, który uwielbiał budować z żelaza i stworzył najsłynniejszą wieżę na świecie.
  • Żelazo Gorące narzędzie służące do wygładzania i prostowania pogniecionych ubrań. Uwaga, żelazka są bardzo gorące!
  • Mapa Wieży Eiffla Mapa pokazująca lokalizację słynnej wysokiej wieży w Paryżu.
  • Bilet na Wieżę Eiffla Specjalny dokument umożliwiający odwiedzenie słynnej wysokiej wieży w Paryżu, we Francji.

docs.title: Baguette
docs.text:
• Bagietka francuska Długi, chrupiący chleb, najsłynniejsze danie we Francji. Francuzi codziennie kupują świeże bagietki z piekarni!
  • Paryż Stolica Francji. Paryż ma słynną wysoką wieżę zwaną Wieżą Eiffla!
  • Piekarz Osoba zajmująca się wypiekiem chleba, ciast i wypieków.
  • SÓL Białe kryształy, które poprawiają smak potraw.
  • Drożdże Drożdże to magiczny proszek, który sprawia, że ​​chleb jest miękki i smaczny!
  • Mąka Biały proszek z pszenicy, używany do wypieku chleba.
  • Woda Woda jest niezbędna do życia

docs.title: Notre Dame
docs.text:
• Katedra Notre-Dame w Paryżu Piękna katedra w Paryżu. Jej kolorowe witraże opowiadają historie.
  • Paryż Stolica Francji. Paryż ma słynną wysoką wieżę zwaną Wieżą Eiffla!
  • Pożar Notre-Dame W 2019 roku wielki pożar zniszczył piękną katedrę Notre-Dame w Paryżu. Wiele osób współpracowało, aby uratować ten ważny budynek.
  • Ile-de-France Region we Francji, w którym znajduje się stolica, Paryż. Mieszka tu wielu ludzi!

docs.title: Louvre
docs.text:
• Żaluzja Ogromne muzeum pełne sztuki. To tu mieszka Mona Lisa.
  • Paryż Stolica Francji. Paryż ma słynną wysoką wieżę zwaną Wieżą Eiffla!
  • Mona Lisa Najsłynniejszy obraz świata! Kobieta o tajemniczym uśmiechu namalowana przez Leonarda da Vinci. Wydaje się, że śledzi cię wzrokiem.
  • Leonardo da Vinci Niesamowity artysta i naukowiec z Włoch. Namalował Monę Lisę i wynalazł maszyny latające setki lat przed samolotami!
  • Wolność wiodąca lud Słynny obraz o wolności i odwadze. Przedstawia odważną kobietę trzymającą flagę Francji i prowadzącą ludzi do walki o swoje prawa.
  • Wenus z Milo Piękna, starożytna statua kobiety wykonana z białego marmuru. Brakuje jej ramion, ale i tak jest uważana za jedną z najpiękniejszych rzeźb, jakie kiedykolwiek powstały.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Katedra Bardzo duży i ważny kościół w mieście.

Kościół Specjalny budynek, w którym ludzie spotykają się, aby modlić się i śpiewać.

Kodeks Hammurabiego Kamień z wyrytymi bardzo starymi prawami.

Koronacja Napoleona (Dawid) Ogromny obraz przedstawiający ceremonię cesarza Francji.

Windy Wieży Eiffla Windy, którymi zwiedzający mogą wjechać na żelazną wieżę.

Latająca przypora Kamienne ramiona na zewnątrz, które pomagają podtrzymywać wysokie mury.

Gargulec Zabawna lub straszna figurka, która pełni również funkcję rynny deszczowej.

Piramida Luwru Szklana piramida, która stanowi współczesne wejście do Luwru.

Przysięga Horacjuszy (Dawida) Obraz przedstawiający trzech braci składających odważną obietnicę.

Okno rozetowe Duży, okrągły witraż opowiadający historie światłem.

Siedzący skryba Starożytna egipska statua przedstawiająca osobę piszącą.

Nike z Samotraki Słynna starożytna rzeźba przedstawiająca boginię ze skrzydłami.

Wystawa światowa (1889) Wielka światowa wystawa, na której pokazano Wieżę Eiffla.

docs.title: Le système scolaire (fr_02) - Script
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

docs.title: quest_start
docs.text:
// fr_02 | Schools (Angers)
// 
type: panel
tags: 
color: red
---
<<declare $got_backpack = false>>
<<SetActive Collect_Backpack false>>
Bienvenue à Angers ! C'est le premier jour d'école ! #line:014887e 
Vous avez 10 ans et vous êtes en dernière année d’école primaire. #line:063e8e0 
Trouvez votre école et votre classe ! #line:0f65a1b 
<<task_start TASK_FIND_SCHOOL task_find_school_done>>

docs.title: quest_end
docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel_endgame
---
Le jeu est terminé ! Félicitations ! #line:022962d 
C'est notre jour d'école #line:038dacc 

<<jump post_quest_activity>>

docs.title: post_quest_activity
docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel
tags: proposal
---
Dessinez maintenant un plan de votre classe ! #line:09ac4f1 
<<quest_end>>

docs.title: task_find_school_done
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR
---
Vous avez trouvé votre école ! #line:03ed76a

docs.title: task_find_school_desc
docs.text:
type: task
---
Trouvez votre école ! #line:0da284c

docs.title: school_1
docs.text:
tags: actor=WOMAN
actor: WOMAN
---
Bienvenue ! C'est une école maternelle pour les enfants de 3 à 5 ans. #line:096b721 
Tu es trop grand pour nos petites chaises. Ton école est à proximité. #line:07ed07b

docs.title: school_2
docs.text:
tags:
---
<<if $got_backpack>>
    <<jump school_2_talk>>
<<else>>
    <<jump school_2_welcome>>
<<endif>>

docs.title: school_2_welcome
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
actor: GUIDE
---
Bonjour ! Bienvenue ! Vous avez trouvé. C'est votre école primaire. #line:092b309 
On dirait que tu as oublié ton sac à dos. #line:0dd7977 
Vous avez besoin de vos livres pour la leçon. #line:044385f 
<<jump task_backpack>>

docs.title: school_3
docs.text:
tags: actor=KID_M
actor: KID_MALE
---
Bonjour ! C'est un collège pour les élèves de 11 à 15 ans. #line:06478e9 
Tu es presque assez grand, mais pas encore. Continue à chercher ! #line:0df97f8

docs.title: school_4
docs.text:
tags: actor=MAN
actor: MAN
---
Bonjour ! C'est un lycée pour les 16-18 ans. #line:04a0e4b 
Les étudiants y préparent l'examen du baccalauréat avant d'aller à l'université. #line:027eba1 
Tu es trop jeune. Essaie une autre école. #line:0630d14

docs.title: school_4_talk_man
docs.text:
tags: actor=MAN_OLD
actor: OLD_MAN
---
Bonjour ! J'ai trouvé un sac à dos en venant ici. #line:0c3b4fe 
Ces livres sont plus simples que ceux que mes élèves utilisent, #line:0d3aba1 
donc je ne pense pas que cela leur appartient. #line:09c5297 
<<SetActive Collect_Backpack>>
Est-ce que ça pourrait être le tien ? #line:0f44535

docs.title: school_2_talk
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
actor: GUIDE
---
Et voilà ! Entrons et commençons la leçon. #line:0624437 
<<action door_open_2>>
Entrez ! Votre salle de classe est au bout du couloir. #line:0b91268 
<<jump task_find_classroom >>

docs.title: task_find_classroom
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR, task
color: green
---
TÂCHE : Trouvez votre salle de classe. #line:058ddbc 
<<task_start TASK_CLASSROOM task_class_done>>

docs.title: task_classroom_desc
docs.text:
type: task
---
Trouvez votre classe pour pouvoir commencer la leçon. #line:00e71a9

docs.title: task_class_done
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR
---
Oui ! Vous pouvez commencer la leçon maintenant. #line:093e91d

docs.title: classroom_1
docs.text:
tags: actor=MAN
actor: MAN
---
C'est la salle de classe du CP. #line:08b2774 
Les enfants commencent l’école primaire à 6 ans. #line:09bfe7f 
Ce n'est pas votre cours. Essayez le cours d'à côté ! #line:068e48b 
<<action DOOR_OPEN_2>>

docs.title: classroom_2
docs.text:
tags: actor=WOMAN
actor: WOMAN
---
Nous sommes en CE1, la deuxième année de l'école primaire. #line:08f3ab2 
Ce cours n'est pas pour vous. Réessayez ! #line:029fd9c 
<<action DOOR_OPEN_3>>

docs.title: classroom_3
docs.text:
tags: actor=WOMAN
actor: WOMAN
---
Bonjour ! Ici la classe de CE2. #line:0bce01a 
pour les élèves de 8 ans. #line:0b411ce 
Ce n'est pas votre cours, mais vous en êtes proche ! #line:0e4aa95 
<<action DOOR_OPEN_4>>

docs.title: classroom_4
docs.text:
tags: actor=WOMAN_OLD
actor: OLD_WOMAN
---
Bonjour ! Nous sommes en CM1, l'avant-dernière année de primaire. #line:0532330 
Votre cours est juste là-bas ! #line:00f6294 
<<action DOOR_OPEN_5>>

docs.title: classroom_5
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
actor: GUIDE
---
Et voilà ! Bienvenue en CM2 ! #line:02797f8 
Commençons. #line:0f90123 
C'est une leçon d'écriture. #line:0071a0d 
En France, on apprend à écrire en cursive. #line:0f8995f 
<<card concept_cursive_writing zoom>>
Maintenant, nous faisons de la géométrie ! #line:0365921 
<<jump activity_match_geometry>>

docs.title: activity_match_geometry
docs.text:
---
Associez chaque outil à la forme qu’il dessine. #line:052d22a 
<<activity match_shapes activity_match_done>>

docs.title: activity_match_done
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
color: purple
---
<<if GetActivityResult("match_shapes") > 0>>
    Excellent travail ! #line:0e3f1fa 
    <<jump quest_end>>
<<else>>
Ce n'est pas tout à fait exact. Réessayez. #line:0a5c8f1
<<jump activity_match_geometry>>
<<endif>>

docs.title: task_backpack
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE, task
color: green
---
Trouvez votre sac à dos et revenez ensuite. #line:0e3ad75 
<<task_start TASK_BACKPACK task_backpack_done>>

docs.title: task_backpack_done
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR
---
Tâche accomplie ! Vous pouvez entrer dans l'école. #line:063f354  
<<set $got_backpack = true>>

docs.title: task_backpack_desc
docs.text:
type: task
---
Trouve ton sac à dos pour pouvoir aller à l'école. #line:00faf2f

docs.title: school_canteen
docs.text:
tags: actor=WOMAN_OLD, 
color: yellow
---
Bonjour ! J'espère que vous êtes inscrit à la cantine. #line:021132d 
<<card object_canteen_menu>>
Regardez le menu d'aujourd'hui ! #line:0978619 
<<card object_canteen_menu zoom>>
Bon appétit! #line:0671097

docs.title: school_charte
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR
color: yellow
tags: item
---
<<card concept_charter_of_secularism>>
À l’école, tout le monde est le bienvenu et respecté, #line:02977c9 
peu importe leurs croyances. #line:09c12ac

docs.title: spawned_kid_f
docs.text:
///////// NPCs SPAWNED IN THE SCENE //////////
// these npc are spawn automatically in the scene
// use these to add random facts. everythime you meet them
// they will say one of these lines randomly
color: purple
actor: KID_F
spawn_group: kids 
---
Nous avons une pause de jeu le matin et l'après-midi. #line:027d036 
J'aime dessiner et colorier. #line:0879a44 
Ma matière préférée est l'art. #line:0cee587

docs.title: spawned_kid_m
docs.text:
color: purple
actor: KID_M
spawn_group: kids 
---
J'aime les mathématiques à cause des chiffres. #line:01b23d9 
Je joue au football avec des amis. #line:0b82cb5 
J'adore les jeux vidéo ! #line:0aeea98

docs.title: spawned_adult
docs.text:
color: purple
spawn_group: adults 
---
En France, l'école commence en septembre et se termine en juin. #line:037e288 
Il y a de nombreuses vacances dans l’année scolaire. #line:028f2bf 
J'aime quand mes enfants me disent ce qu'ils ont appris. #line:0d8d4aa

docs.title: spawned_teacher
docs.text:
color: purple
spawn_group: teachers 
---
L'école a lieu de 8h à 16h. #line:0f6b039 
Apportez votre déjeuner ou mangez à la cantine. #line:008ffb5 
Nous apprenons l’écriture cursive. #line:0d88d5b

tags:

<<declare $got_backpack = false>>
<<SetActive Collect_Backpack false>>

You are 10 years old and in the last year of primary school. #line:063e8e0

actor: KID_MALE

actor: MAN

Students study for the Baccalauréat exam here before university. #line:027eba1 
You are too young. Try another school. #line:0630d14

actor: OLD_MAN

Subjects:

  • Culture (x9)
  • Education (x7)
  • Math (x7)
  • Civics (x2)
  • Community (x2)

docs.title: French School
docs.text:
• French Schools In France, school happens in four main steps: maternelle (play-and-learn for little kids), école élémentaire (reading, writing, maths), collège (middle school), and lycée (high school). At the end of lycée, many students take a big exam called the baccalauréat (‘le bac’)
  • École maternelle École pour les petits de 3 à 5 ans. On apprend en jouant et en explorant.
  • École primaire en France École pour les enfants de 6 à 10 ans. Vous apprenez à lire, à écrire et à compter.
  • Lycée en France Lycée en France pour les adolescents de 16 à 18 ans. Les élèves étudient dur pour l'examen du baccalauréat pour aller à l'université.
  • Collège en France Collège en France pour les enfants de 11 à 15 ans. Les élèves apprennent de nombreuses matières et se préparent au lycée.
  • Écriture cursive Une façon particulière d'écrire où toutes les lettres d'un mot sont reliées entre elles. En France, les enfants apprennent cette écriture à l'école.
  • Menu de la cantine Une liste des aliments autorisés à la cantine. Elle vous aide à choisir vos repas !
  • Charte de la laïcité Un ensemble de règles visant à respecter les croyances de chacun. Il contribue à une coexistence pacifique.

docs.title: Elementary Math
docs.text:
• Eleementary Maths Numbers and shapes for everyday life: counting, adding and subtracting, simple fractions, measuring, telling time, and using money.
  • Doubler Une ligne droite reliant un point à un autre. Les lignes peuvent être longues ou courtes.
  • Triangle Une forme à trois côtés droits et trois coins. Les triangles ressemblent à des parts de pizza !
  • Boussole Un outil qui permet de dessiner des cercles parfaits. Il possède deux branches, comme des ciseaux.
  • Règle Un outil droit utilisé pour mesurer la longueur des objets. Les règles comportent des chiffres et des lignes.
  • Carré Un outil en forme de triangle utilisé pour dessiner des lignes droites et des angles droits en mathématiques.
  • Cercle Une forme ronde sans coins. Les cercles ressemblent à des roues, des boules et des pièces de monnaie !

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Cartable Un sac que les élèves utilisent pour transporter leurs livres, crayons et devoirs à l'école.

Classe Une salle à l'école où les élèves s'assoient et apprennent de nouvelles choses de leur professeur.

docs.text: The cat goes to different places until he finds his school. Then he visits the school and finds his class.

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
School system : the cats goes a lycée (16-18 ans), to a collège (11-15 ans), to a école maternelle (3-5 ans) and finally goes to an école primaire (6-10 ans), that corresponds to his age, called Jules Verne

A typical day at school

  • Morning childcare = garderie du matin
  • arrival at the school gate = le portail
  • work in class with different subjects/matières : maths, reading & writing
  • morning playtime (récréation) on the playground (la cour)
  • lunch at the canteen (la cantine) or at home (à la maison)
  • school work with different subjects/matières : PE = EPS (éducation physique et - sportive), hist/geog = histoire/géographie, science = sciences, arts= art
  • evening childcare = garderie du soir / homework support = aide aux devoirs

School levels with level names and age (CP–6 ans / CE1-7 ans / CE2-8 ans /CM1-9 ans / CM2–10 ans).

docs.title: Knowledge content
docs.text:
The French School System: Kids learn the names, age groups, and order of the main schools:

  • École Maternelle (3-5 years old)
  • École Primaire (6-10 years old) - 5 years total.
  • Collège (11-15 years old)
  • Lycée (16-18 years old)

The Baccalauréat: Kids learn that the Lycée prepares you for a final diploma called le Baccalauréat, which is needed for university.

Classroom Life: Kids learn that French students learn to write in cursive, have playtime (la récréation) in the morning and afternoon, and study things like geometry.

Cultural Values: Introduction to the principles of French public schools via the national motto and the Charter of Secularism.

docs.title: French School
docs.text:
• French Schools In France, school happens in four main steps: maternelle (play-and-learn for little kids), école élémentaire (reading, writing, maths), collège (middle school), and lycée (high school). At the end of lycée, many students take a big exam called the baccalauréat (‘le bac’)
  • École Maternelle Scuola per bambini dai 3 ai 5 anni. Si impara giocando ed esplorando.
  • Scuola primaria in Francia Scuola per bambini dai 6 ai 10 anni. Si impara a leggere, scrivere e contare.
  • Liceo in Francia Scuola superiore in Francia per adolescenti dai 16 ai 18 anni. Gli studenti studiano duramente per sostenere l'esame di Baccalauréat, che permette loro di accedere all'università.
  • Collège in Francia Scuola media in Francia per ragazzi dagli 11 ai 15 anni. Gli studenti studiano molte materie e si preparano per la scuola superiore.
  • Scrittura corsiva Un modo speciale di scrivere in cui tutte le lettere di una parola sono collegate. In Francia, i bambini imparano a scrivere in questo modo a scuola.
  • Menù della mensa Un elenco che mostra quali alimenti puoi mangiare a scuola. Ti aiuta a scegliere cosa mangiare!
  • Carta della Laicità Un insieme di regole per rispettare le convinzioni di tutti. Aiuta le persone a vivere insieme in pace.

docs.title: Elementary Math
docs.text:
• Eleementary Maths Numbers and shapes for everyday life: counting, adding and subtracting, simple fractions, measuring, telling time, and using money.
  • Linea Un segno dritto che va da un punto all'altro. Le linee possono essere lunghe o corte.
  • Triangolo Una forma con tre lati dritti e tre angoli. I triangoli sembrano fette di pizza!
  • Bussola Uno strumento che ti aiuta a disegnare cerchi perfetti. Ha due gambe come forbici.
  • Governate Uno strumento dritto usato per misurare la lunghezza degli oggetti. I righelli hanno numeri e linee.
  • Piazza Strumento a forma di triangolo utilizzato per disegnare linee rette e angoli retti in matematica.
  • Cerchio Una forma rotonda senza angoli. I cerchi sembrano ruote, palline e monete!

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Cartella Una borsa che gli studenti usano per portare a scuola libri, matite e compiti.

Aula Un'aula della scuola dove gli studenti si siedono e imparano cose nuove dal loro insegnante.

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: France - Angers

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x9)
  • Education (x7)
  • Math (x7)
  • Civics (x2)
  • Community (x2)

docs.title: French School
docs.text:
• French Schools In France, school happens in four main steps: maternelle (play-and-learn for little kids), école élémentaire (reading, writing, maths), collège (middle school), and lycée (high school). At the end of lycée, many students take a big exam called the baccalauréat (‘le bac’)
  • École Maternelle School for little kids aged 3 to 5. You learn by playing and exploring.
  • Primary School in France School for kids aged 6 to 10. You learn reading, writing, and counting.
  • Lycée in France High school in France for teenagers aged 16 to 18. Students study hard for the Baccalauréat exam to go to university.
  • Collège in France Middle school in France for kids aged 11 to 15. Students learn many subjects and prepare for high school.
  • Cursive Writing A special way of writing where all the letters in a word are connected. In France, children learn to write this way in school.
  • Canteen menu A list that shows what food you can eat at school lunch. It helps you choose what to eat!
  • Charter of Secularism A set of rules for respecting everyone's beliefs. It helps people live together in peace.

docs.title: Elementary Math
docs.text:
• Eleementary Maths Numbers and shapes for everyday life: counting, adding and subtracting, simple fractions, measuring, telling time, and using money.
  • Line A straight mark that goes from one point to another. Lines can be long or short.
  • Triangle A shape with three straight sides and three corners. Triangles look like pizza slices!
  • Compass A tool that helps you draw perfect circles. It has two legs like scissors.
  • Ruler A straight tool used to measure how long things are. Rulers have numbers and lines.
  • Square A triangle-shaped tool used to draw straight lines and right angles in math.
  • Circle A round shape with no corners. Circles look like wheels, balls, and coins!

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
School bag A bag that students use to carry their books, pencils, and homework to school.

Classroom A room in school where students sit and learn new things from their teacher.

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x9)
  • Education (x7)
  • Math (x7)
  • Civics (x2)
  • Community (x2)

docs.title: French School
docs.text:
• French Schools In France, school happens in four main steps: maternelle (play-and-learn for little kids), école élémentaire (reading, writing, maths), collège (middle school), and lycée (high school). At the end of lycée, many students take a big exam called the baccalauréat (‘le bac’)
  • Szkoła Maternelle Szkoła dla małych dzieci w wieku od 3 do 5 lat. Uczysz się poprzez zabawę i odkrywanie.
  • Szkoła podstawowa we Francji Szkoła dla dzieci w wieku od 6 do 10 lat. Uczysz się czytania, pisania i liczenia.
  • Liceum we Francji Szkoła średnia we Francji dla nastolatków w wieku od 16 do 18 lat. Uczniowie intensywnie przygotowują się do egzaminu maturalnego, aby móc iść na uniwersytet.
  • Collège we Francji Szkoła średnia we Francji dla dzieci w wieku od 11 do 15 lat. Uczniowie uczą się wielu przedmiotów i przygotowują się do szkoły średniej.
  • Pismo odręczne Specjalny sposób pisania, w którym wszystkie litery w słowie są połączone. We Francji dzieci uczą się tego sposobu pisania w szkole.
  • Menu stołówki Lista pokazująca, co możesz zjeść w szkolnym lunchu. Pomoże Ci wybrać, co zjeść!
  • Karta świeckości Zbiór zasad szanujących przekonania każdego. Pomaga ludziom żyć razem w pokoju.

docs.title: Elementary Math
docs.text:
• Eleementary Maths Numbers and shapes for everyday life: counting, adding and subtracting, simple fractions, measuring, telling time, and using money.
  • Linia Linia prosta, która prowadzi z jednego punktu do drugiego. Linie mogą być długie lub krótkie.
  • Trójkąt Kształt z trzema prostymi bokami i trzema narożnikami. Trójkąty wyglądają jak kawałki pizzy!
  • Kompas Narzędzie, które pomaga rysować idealne okręgi. Ma dwie nogi jak nożyczki.
  • Linijka Proste narzędzie do pomiaru długości przedmiotów. Linijki mają cyfry i linie.
  • Kwadrat Narzędzie w kształcie trójkąta, służące do rysowania linii prostych i kątów prostych w matematyce.
  • Koło Okrągły kształt bez rogów. Koła wyglądają jak koła, piłki i monety!

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Torba szkolna Torba, w której uczniowie noszą do szkoły książki, ołówki i prace domowe.

Klasa Pomieszczenie w szkole, w którym uczniowie siedzą i uczą się nowych rzeczy od nauczyciela.

docs.title: quest_start
docs.text:
// fr_03 | Jules Verne (Nantes)
// 
// Tasks:
// - FIND_BOOKS (collect 4 Jules Verne books)
// - COLLECT_TRAIN (collect from "Around the World in 80 Days")
// - COLLECT_ROCKET (collect from "From Earth to the Moon")
// - COLLECT_SUBMARINE (collect from "20,000 Leagues Under the Sea")
// - COLLECT_BALLOON (collect from "Five Weeks in a Balloon")

color: red
type: panel
---
<<set $TOTAL_COINS = 0>>
<<set $COLLECTED_ITEMS = 0>>
<<declare $QUEST_ITEMS = 4>>
Bienvenue au musée Jules Verne à Nantes ! #line:0b5e2f3

docs.title: quest_end
docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel_endgame
---
Maintenant, vous savez quelque chose sur Jules Verne #line:0174104 
et ses livres ! #line:0a01f9e 
<<jump post_quest_activity>>

docs.title: Jules Verne et les transports (fr_03)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: France - Nantes

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Literature (x6)
  • Science (x5)
  • History (x2)
  • Space (x1)
  • Transportation (x1)

docs.title: Jules Verne
docs.text:
• Jules Verne A French writer who imagined amazing adventures before they were possible! He wrote about submarines, rockets, and traveling around the world.
  • Around the World in Eighty Days An exciting book by Jules Verne about traveling around the whole world very quickly using trains, ships, and hot air balloons!
  • From the Earth to the Moon A book by Jules Verne about going to the Moon in a big cannon! It was written before real rockets existed.
  • 20000 Leagues Under the Sea A book by Jules Verne about underwater adventures in a submarine called the Nautilus. You meet giant sea creatures!
  • Hot-Air Balloon A balloon that flies using hot air. The first one flew in France.
  • Fusée spatiale Une fusée qui va dans l'espace.
  • Sous-marin (Le Nautilus) Un sous-marin du roman de Jules Verne. Il pouvait explorer les profondeurs marines.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Five Weeks in a Balloon A book by Jules Verne about flying across Africa in a hot air balloon. It's full of adventure and discovery!

Charte de la laïcité Un ensemble de règles visant à respecter les croyances de chacun. Il contribue à une coexistence pacifique.

Classe Une salle à l'école où les élèves s'assoient et apprennent de nouvelles choses de leur professeur.

Collège en France Collège en France pour les enfants de 11 à 15 ans. Les élèves apprennent de nombreuses matières et se préparent au lycée.

Affiche de l'école française Un grand tableau avec des informations qui s'affiche sur les murs des salles de classe dans les écoles françaises.

docs.title: Game Design Notes
docs.text:
Let’s go to Nantes and discover who Jules Verne was and discover some transport vehicles.

  • He was born in Nantes in 1828
  • He is a writer
  • He has written le tour du monde en 80 jours

Other books:

  • train & boat in Le tour du monde en 80 jours
  • hot air balloon in cinq semaines en ballon
  • submarin in 20.000 lieues sous les mers
  • rocket in de la terre à la lune

docs.title: quest_start
docs.text:
// fr_04 | Road Safety (Les Mans)
// 
// Cards:
// - lemans_race (sports heritage)
// - race_car (automotive)
// - traffic_lights safety education)
// - stop_sign (safety education)
// - danger_sign (safety education)
// - zebra_crossing (safety education)
// - scooter (transportation)
// Tasks:
// - Experience Le Mans race as spectator
// - Navigate city streets following traffic rules
// - Identify and respond to traffic signs correctly
// - Reach train station safely
// Words used: race, car, speed, traffic, lights, stop, danger, zebra crossing, scooter, train station, safety, street, road, pedestrian, red, yellow, green, triangle, stripes, careful
tags:
type: panel
color: red
---
<<set $TOTAL_COINS = 0>>
<<set $COLLECTED_ITEMS = 0>>
Bienvenue au Mans ! #line:0a4f3e1

docs.title: quest_end
docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel_endgame
---
Excellent travail ! #line:08cd696 
Vous avez utilisé les panneaux pour rester en sécurité. #line:0298d64 
La sécurité routière peut être amusante ! #line:001499f 
<<jump post_quest_activity>>

docs.title: post_quest_activity
docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel
tags: proposal
---
Dessinez une carte des rues autour de votre maison ! #line:0acd0a1 
<<quest_end>>

docs.title: talk_friend_intro
docs.text:
tags: actor=MAN
---
C'est la course automobile du Mans. #line:02f370e 
Les voitures sont très rapides ! #line:07f77f0 
Seuls les adultes peuvent les conduire. #line:0d0cd3f 
Ces voitures de course sont si rapides ! #line:0e54cfc 
Sur la piste, on ne peut aller qu'à cette vitesse. #line:053328c 
Dans les rues de la ville, nous roulons lentement. #line:0b70620 
Il est temps de rentrer à la maison. #line:06e4b9d 
<<jump talk_friend_scooter>>

docs.title: talk_friend_scooter
docs.text:
tags: actor=MAN
---
La course est terminée. Rentrez chez vous en train. #line:0b834f8 
J'emmène mon scooter à la gare. #line:00f2f65 
<<card scooter>>
J'attendrai là-bas. #line:0425fb5 
Regardez les panneaux. #line:0b5ee19 
<<action GIVE_SCOOTER>>
<<jump task_reach_station>>

docs.title: task_reach_station
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR, task
---
Arrivez à la gare en toute sécurité. #line:fr04_task_station
Arrêtez-vous au feu rouge. Continuez au feu vert. #line:fr04_task_station_2

docs.title: sign_stop
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR
---
Ceci est un panneau STOP. #line:09ac224 
<<card stop_sign>>
Arrêtez-vous complètement. #line:0fde84a 
Regardez dans les deux sens. #line:0758dbd

docs.title: restart_level
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR
---
Vous n'avez pas fait attention. Réessayez ! #line:0eed8ec

docs.title: sign_danger
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR
---
Ceci est un panneau de DANGER. #line:0a57038 
<<card danger_sign>>
Cela signifie ralentir. #line:02cfe75 
Il se peut qu'il y ait quelque chose sur la route. #line:07915e7

docs.title: street_lights
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR
---
Ce sont des feux de circulation. #line:0355437 
<<card traffic_lights>>
ROUGE - STOP #line:0cb35d6
JAUNE - LENT #line:0b0c56c 
VERT - ALLER #line:0c87bce

docs.title: zebra_crossing
docs.text:
tags:  
---
Ces rayures blanches sont un passage piéton. #line:02fbb57 
<<card zebra_crossing>>
Il donne la priorité aux piétons. #line:085d81b 
Ralentissez à proximité. #line:01cd74f 
Arrêtez-vous si quelqu'un veut traverser. #line:04e20a8

docs.title: danger_signs
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR
---
Ce sont des triangles. #line:08c3073

docs.title: bravo
docs.text:
tags: actor=MAN
---
Tu as réussi ! #line:03b112c 
Vous avez suivi les règles. #line:0662662 
Vous êtes excellent en matière de sécurité routière ! #line:0c88cfb

docs.title: spawned_pedestrian
docs.text:
///////// NPCs SPAWNED IN THE SCENE //////////
// these npc are spawn automatically in the scene
// use these to add random facts. everythime you meet them
// they will say one of these lines randomly
color: purple
actor: 
spawn_group: pedestrian 
---
Regardez toujours des deux côtés avant de traverser la rue ! #line:0d65c60 
Ne traversez jamais la rue en courant, même si vous êtes pressé ! #line:084a760 
Utilisez toujours un passage pour piétons ou un passage pour piétons lorsqu'il est disponible ! #line:07f8272 
Portez des vêtements clairs ou réfléchissants lorsque vous marchez la nuit ! #line:0587fd6 
N'utilisez jamais votre téléphone ou vos écouteurs lorsque vous traversez la rue ! #line:044f000

docs.title: spawned_race_lemans
docs.text:
color: purple
actor: MAN
spawn_group: race 
---
La course du Mans dure 24 heures ! #line:02e7a89 
Les voitures de course vont vite sur la piste, pas dans la rue. #line:0518750 
La vitesse est pour le circuit. #line:02e3d19 
Dans les rues, nous avançons lentement. #line:02f57a4

docs.title: spawned_kids_walking
docs.text:
color: purple
actor: 
spawn_group: kids 
---
Nous marchons sur le trottoir. #line:0999d95 
Nous nous arrêtons et regardons avant de traverser. #line:04b17e0 
Nous attendons le feu vert. #line:0b0fe8c 
Nous regardons à gauche et à droite pour voir les voitures. #line:0bbc9ed 
Nous ne jouons pas dans la rue. #line:08097b8

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Safety (x6)
  • Education (x3)
  • Transportation (x3)
  • Health (x1)

docs.title: Stree safety
docs.text:
• Sécurité routière Des règles qui assurent la sécurité de tous sur la route.
  • Casque (sécurité routière) Un casque de sécurité pour protéger votre tête lorsque vous roulez.
  • Panneau STOP Un panneau rouge qui signifie que vous devez arrêter votre véhicule.
  • Passage piéton Bandes blanches là où les gens traversent la rue.
  • Feux de signalisation Des lampadaires qui vous indiquent quand vous devez vous ARRÊTER ou PARTIR.
  • Panneau de DANGER Un panneau avertissant d'un danger imminent. Soyez extrêmement prudent.

  • Stefano Cecere (Italy) (development)

docs.title: Game Design
docs.text: After watching the famous "24 Hours of Le Mans" car race, help Cat navigate the city streets on a scooter to safely reach the train station, learning important traffic rules along the way.

docs.title: Flow
docs.text: The player must guide Cat on a scooter (trottinette) from the Le Mans racetrack to the train station. The path is linear but features four key intersections, each designed as a mini-game to teach a specific traffic rule (STOP sign, DANGER sign, traffic lights, zebra crossing). The player must successfully navigate these challenges while avoiding moving cars and bicycles to reach the destination.

docs.text:
///////// NPCs SPAWNED IN THE SCENE //////////
// these npc are spawn automatically in the scene
// use these to add random facts. everythime you meet them
// they will say one of these lines randomly
color: purple
actor: 
spawn_group: tourists 
---
Saviez-vous que la Vallée de la Loire est classée au patrimoine mondial de l’UNESCO ? #line:0c3f4e1 
Le château de Chambord compte 440 pièces ! #line:0a5f4f1 
Le château de Chinon était une résidence favorite du roi Henri II d'Angleterre. #line:0b6e2c3 
La vallée de la Loire est connue comme le « Jardin de la France ». #line:0d1e4b5 
Le château de Chambord a été construit au XVIe siècle. #line:0e2f6d7

docs.title: spawned_tourist_chambord
docs.text:
color: purple
actor:
spawn_group: tourists_chambord
---
Chambord a un escalier tellement sinueux que je m'y perdrais volontairement ! #line:03571b7 
<<card chambord>>
440 chambres… Il me faudrait 440 siestes. #line:0e2823f 
<<card chambord>>
Des bals royaux ? Je danserais comme une baguette ondulante. #line:0fd58d9 
<<card chambord_ball>>
Si je vivais ici, j'oublierais encore où j'ai laissé mes chaussures. #line:0409c6b 
<<card chambord>>

docs.title: spawned_tourist_chinon
docs.text:
color: purple
actor:
spawn_group: tourists_chinon
---
Les murs de Chinon sont si solides que même ma meilleure blague ne peut pas les briser ! #line:0b32af0 
<<card chinon_defence>>
Je fais semblant d'être un chevalier... en réalité, je garde des collations. #line:0d55219 
<<card chinon>>
Des échappatoires : de minuscules fenêtres pour les flèches… ou des vagues très fines. #line:0664af8 
<<card loopholes>>
Les parapets sont parfaits pour jeter un œil sans être vu. #line:0c42fc1 
<<card parapet>>

docs.title: spawned_tourist_loire
docs.text:
color: purple
actor:
spawn_group: tourists_loire
---
La Loire ressemble à un long ruban d’argent – ​​sans papier cadeau ! #line:08a92f7 
<<card map>>
Je salue chaque château. Un jour, une tour pourrait me saluer en retour. #line:0d7652c 
<<card map>>
Les ponts ici sont d'excellents endroits pour penser aux collations. #line:0724a44 
<<card bridge>>
Il y a tellement de châteaux que même les nuages ​​sont des touristes. #line:0b1036c 
<<card map>>
