// fr_05 | Castles (Loire)
// 
// Cards:
// - chinon (historical castle)
// - chambord (renaissance castle)
// - chinon_defence (military architecture)
// - chambord_ball (royal culture)
// - bridge (castle architecture)
// - parapet (defensive architecture)
// - loopholes (military feature)
// - obj_helmet (knight equipment)
// - obj_sword (knight equipment)
// - obj_bow (knight equipment)
// - obj_armor (knight equipment)
// - obj_hat (noble attire)
// - obj_musical_instruments (court culture)
// - obj_dance_shoes (court culture)
// - obj_ball_mask (court culture)
// - map (regional geography)
// Tasks:
// - Collect knight items: helmet, sword, bow, armor
// - Collect prince items: hat, musical instrument, dance shoes, ball mask
// - Explore different castle functions (defense vs luxury)
// Activities:
// Words used: castle, Chinon, Chambord, drawbridge, parapet, loopholes, defense, knight, armor, sword, bow, helmet, prince, mask, shoes, map, room, interior, Loire Valley, medieval, royal, French heritage
//

docs.title: Un conte de deux châteaux (fr_05)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: France - Loire

Voyagez dans la vallée de la Loire pour visiter deux châteaux très différents : une forte forteresse défensive et un magnifique palais royal

docs.title: Content
docs.text: Subjects:

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text: Château de Chinon Le château de Chinon est une puissante forteresse de pierre perchée sur une colline surplombant la Loire. Jadis, des rois y séjournèrent, et Jeanne d'Arc vint y rencontrer le futur roi de France.

docs.title: Quest Script
docs.text: See the full script here

docs.title: Activities
docs.text: • (none)

docs.title: Tasks
docs.text: • (none)

docs.title: Gameplay
docs.text:
• Difficulty: Normal
  • Duration (min): 10

docs.title: Credits
docs.text:
• Anne (France) (content)
  • Fabio Cecere (Italy) (design, development)
  • Lucie Paillat (France) (content, design)
  • Stefano Cecere (Italy) (content, design, development)

docs.title: Game Design Notes
docs.text:
Journey to the Loire Valley and help Cat find the perfect outfits to visit two very different castles: a strong defensive fortress and a magnificent royal palace.

Medieval adventure exploring French castle heritage. Discover defensive architecture at Chinon and royal luxury at Chambord while collecting knight equipment and prince items. Learn about drawbridges, parapets, medieval life, and Loire Valley's 200+ castles.

Mission The player must visit two distinct castles on the Loire river. In each castle, they will embark on a scavenger hunt to find a complete outfit that is appropriate for that castle's function (a knight's armor in the defensive castle, a prince's finery in the pleasure castle). By finding the items, the player explores and learns the purpose of each castle's unique architecture.

docs.title: Knowledge Content
docs.text:
• Dual Function of Castles: To understand that castles aren't all the same; some are built for war (defensive), and some are built for living and parties (residential/pleasure).
  • Architectural Vocabulary (Defense): To identify and learn the purpose of a drawbridge, keep, ramparts, loopholes, and portcullis.
  • Architectural Vocabulary (Pleasure): To identify and learn the purpose of a royal bedroom (with canopied beds), formal gardens, a ballroom, and a facade with many large windows for light and views.

docs.title: Assets
docs.text:
• Environments:
  • A serene country environment representing the banks of the Loire River.
  • A detailed model of Château de Chinon, emphasizing its strong, defensive features (high walls, few windows, stone textures).
  • A detailed model of Château de Chambord, emphasizing its elegant, decorative features (large windows, ornate rooftops, gardens).
  • 3D Models
  • Knight's Outfit: Helmet, Armor, Sword, Bow, Arrow.
  • Prince's Outfit: Feathered Hat, Lute (musical instrument), Dancing Shoes, Masquerade Mask.
  • Sounds: River ambiance, castle soundscapes (echoing stone halls in Chinon, faint ballroom music in Chambord), a "quest item found" sound.

docs.title: Flow
docs.text:
The Mission: The quest begins on the bank of the Loire River. The Boatman is with his boat.

Boatman: "Bonjour! My friend Antura wants to visit the famous castles of the Loire, but he doesn't know what to wear! Can you help? First, take my boat to the fortress of Chinon and find the perfect outfit for a strong knight."

First Castle: Château de Chinon (Defense)

The player travels by boat to an imposing stone fortress. A sign at the entrance reads: "Château de Chinon: A Fortress for Defense." The "Knight's Outfit" checklist appears. * The player explores the castle to find the items, which are placed near relevant architectural features: * The Bow and Arrow are found near a loophole (a narrow window for archers). A pop-up explains: "Loopholes let defenders shoot arrows out, without letting enemy arrows in!" * The Helmet is on the parapet walk, high up on the castle ramparts. * The Sword is inside the central tower, the Keep. * The Armor is located just behind the portcullis (the main iron gate). * Bonus: At the top of the keep, the player can click on a catapult and launch a stone into the river. * Cutscene: Once all items are collected, a short, fun cutscene plays showing Antura proudly wearing the full suit of knight's armor. The Boatman's voice says: "Excellent! Now Antura looks like a real knight! Let's go to a very different castle: the magnificent Château de Chambord."

Second Castle: Château de Chambord (Pleasure)

  • The player travels by boat to an elegant, beautiful palace with many windows and gardens. A sign reads: "Château de Chambord: A Palace for Parties and Princes." The "Prince's Outfit" checklist appears.
  • The player explores the castle to find the items:
    • The Dancing Shoes are in the center of the grand Ballroom.
    • The Masquerade Mask is on a table in the castle's main courtyard where guests would arrive.
    • The Lute (musical instrument) is found in a luxurious room with ornate decorations.
    • The Feathered Hat is in the Royal Bedroom, next to a large canopied bed.
  • Cutscene: Once all items are collected, a cutscene shows Antura looking dashing in his full prince's outfit, complete with a hat and lute.

Conclusion: The player is automatically taken back to the Boatman on the river.

  • Boatman: "Bravo! You found the perfect outfits. Did you see how different the two castles were? One was a strong fort, and the other a beautiful palace. This region is famous for them - there are over 200 castles along the Loire River! You have a great eye for history!"

docs.title: Credits
docs.text:
• Anne (France) (content)
  • Fabio Cecere (Italy) (design, development)
  • Lucie Paillat (France) (content, design)
  • Stefano Cecere (Italy) (content, design, development)

docs.title: Game Design Notes
docs.text:
Journey to the Loire Valley and help Cat find the perfect outfits to visit two very different castles: a strong defensive fortress and a magnificent royal palace.

Medieval adventure exploring French castle heritage. Discover defensive architecture at Chinon and royal luxury at Chambord while collecting knight equipment and prince items. Learn about drawbridges, parapets, medieval life, and Loire Valley's 200+ castles.

Mission The player must visit two distinct castles on the Loire river. In each castle, they will embark on a scavenger hunt to find a complete outfit that is appropriate for that castle's function (a knight's armor in the defensive castle, a prince's finery in the pleasure castle). By finding the items, the player explores and learns the purpose of each castle's unique architecture.

docs.title: Knowledge Content
docs.text:
• Dual Function of Castles: To understand that castles aren't all the same; some are built for war (defensive), and some are built for living and parties (residential/pleasure).
  • Architectural Vocabulary (Defense): To identify and learn the purpose of a drawbridge, keep, ramparts, loopholes, and portcullis.
  • Architectural Vocabulary (Pleasure): To identify and learn the purpose of a royal bedroom (with canopied beds), formal gardens, a ballroom, and a facade with many large windows for light and views.

docs.title: Assets
docs.text:
• Environments:
  • A serene country environment representing the banks of the Loire River.
  • A detailed model of Château de Chinon, emphasizing its strong, defensive features (high walls, few windows, stone textures).
  • A detailed model of Château de Chambord, emphasizing its elegant, decorative features (large windows, ornate rooftops, gardens).
  • 3D Models
  • Knight's Outfit: Helmet, Armor, Sword, Bow, Arrow.
  • Prince's Outfit: Feathered Hat, Lute (musical instrument), Dancing Shoes, Masquerade Mask.
  • Sounds: River ambiance, castle soundscapes (echoing stone halls in Chinon, faint ballroom music in Chambord), a "quest item found" sound.

docs.title: Flow
docs.text:
The Mission: The quest begins on the bank of the Loire River. The Boatman is with his boat.

Boatman: "Bonjour! My friend Antura wants to visit the famous castles of the Loire, but he doesn't know what to wear! Can you help? First, take my boat to the fortress of Chinon and find the perfect outfit for a strong knight."

First Castle: Château de Chinon (Defense)

The player travels by boat to an imposing stone fortress. A sign at the entrance reads: "Château de Chinon: A Fortress for Defense." The "Knight's Outfit" checklist appears. * The player explores the castle to find the items, which are placed near relevant architectural features: * The Bow and Arrow are found near a loophole (a narrow window for archers). A pop-up explains: "Loopholes let defenders shoot arrows out, without letting enemy arrows in!" * The Helmet is on the parapet walk, high up on the castle ramparts. * The Sword is inside the central tower, the Keep. * The Armor is located just behind the portcullis (the main iron gate). * Bonus: At the top of the keep, the player can click on a catapult and launch a stone into the river. * Cutscene: Once all items are collected, a short, fun cutscene plays showing Antura proudly wearing the full suit of knight's armor. The Boatman's voice says: "Excellent! Now Antura looks like a real knight! Let's go to a very different castle: the magnificent Château de Chambord."

Second Castle: Château de Chambord (Pleasure)

  • The player travels by boat to an elegant, beautiful palace with many windows and gardens. A sign reads: "Château de Chambord: A Palace for Parties and Princes." The "Prince's Outfit" checklist appears.
  • The player explores the castle to find the items:
    • The Dancing Shoes are in the center of the grand Ballroom.
    • The Masquerade Mask is on a table in the castle's main courtyard where guests would arrive.
    • The Lute (musical instrument) is found in a luxurious room with ornate decorations.
    • The Feathered Hat is in the Royal Bedroom, next to a large canopied bed.
  • Cutscene: Once all items are collected, a cutscene shows Antura looking dashing in his full prince's outfit, complete with a hat and lute.

Conclusion: The player is automatically taken back to the Boatman on the river.

  • Boatman: "Bravo! You found the perfect outfits. Did you see how different the two castles were? One was a strong fort, and the other a beautiful palace. This region is famous for them - there are over 200 castles along the Loire River! You have a great eye for history!"

docs.title: Content
docs.text: Subjects:

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text: Zamek Chinon Zamek Chinon to potężna kamienna twierdza na wzgórzu nad rzeką w Dolinie Loary. Dawno temu przebywali tu królowie, a Joanna d'Arc przybyła tu, aby spotkać się z przyszłym królem Francji.

docs.title: quest_start
docs.text:
// fr_08 | Mont Blanc
// 
// Cards:
// - mont_blanc (geographical landmark)
// - flag_france (national symbol)
// - flag_italy (national symbol) 
// - flag_swiss (national symbol)
// Tasks:
// - Place 3 flags correctly on Mont Blanc summit
// Activities:
// - Basic flag placement
// - Order activity for mountain equipment preparation
// - Memory game for Alpine animal identification
// - Quiz on mountain safety and geography
// Words used:Europe, flags, France, Italy, Switzerland, Alps, altitude, summit, glacier, avalanche, marmot, crampons, rope, weather, safety
type: panel
color: red
---
<<set $COLLECTED_ITEMS = 0>>

docs.title: quest_end
docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel_endgame
---
Vous avez atteint le Mont Blanc et appris des faits sur le sommet ! #line:0b99e77 
Vous avez placé les trois drapeaux. #line:057afc7 
<<card mountain>>
Vous vous êtes préparé avec des vêtements chauds. #line:0dda4d7 
Brave explorateur de montagne ! #line:04f90c6 
<<card summit>>
<<jump post_quest_activity>>

docs.title: post_quest_activity
docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel
tags: proposal
---
Pourquoi ne dessines-tu pas le Mont Blanc avec les trois drapeaux. #line:0232ab7 
<<quest_end>>

docs.title: talk_tutor
docs.text:
tags:  asset=mont_blanc
---
Il faut monter le Mont Blanc #line:0f4644b 
la plus haute montagne d'Europe #line:07d23cb 
et placez correctement les 3 drapeaux #line:07f2699

docs.title: item_backpack
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR asset=backpack
---
<<card backpack>>
Ce sac à dos contient de la nourriture, de l'eau et une carte. #line:05e80cb 
Il permet de garder les mains libres pendant la randonnée. #line:06d7fcf

docs.title: item_coat
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR asset=coat
---
<<card coat>>
Ce manteau garde votre corps au chaud en cas de vent et de neige. #line:0e23f1f 
Fermez toujours la fermeture éclair bien haute. #line:06fe689

docs.title: item_gloves
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR asset=gloves
---
<<card gloves>>
Les gants gardent les doigts au chaud et au sec. #line:0f2aac7 
Les mains froides rendent l’escalade difficile. #line:0d01879

docs.title: item_hat
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR asset=hat
---
<<card hat>>
Un chapeau chaud empêche la chaleur de quitter votre tête. #line:000fc05 
Portez-le même en plein soleil. #line:059d744

docs.title: item_rope
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR asset=rope
---
<<card rope>>
La corde aide les grimpeurs à rester en sécurité sur la glace et le rocher. #line:038d1bc 
Coupez-le toujours correctement. #line:0b3d07e

docs.title: item_scarf
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR asset=scarf
---
<<card scarf>>
Une écharpe bloque le vent sur votre cou. #line:0afb2dc 
Rentrez-le pour qu'il ne flotte pas. #line:07cb76f

docs.title: item_sunglasses
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR asset=sunglasses
---
<<card sunglasses>>
La neige et la glace reflètent le soleil éclatant. #line:02a2ea9 
Les lunettes protègent vos yeux. #line:088fb7f

docs.title: flag_france
docs.text:
tags:  asset=flag_france
---
Trouvez le drapeau français. #line:0d23529

docs.title: flag_italy
docs.text:
tags:  asset=flag_italy
---
Trouvez le drapeau italien. #line:050fe70

docs.title: flag_swiss
docs.text:
tags:  asset=flag_swiss
---
Trouvez le drapeau suisse. #line:03db010

docs.title: spawned_tourist
docs.text:
///////// NPCs SPAWNED IN THE SCENE //////////
// these npc are spawn automatically in the scene
// use these to add random facts. everythime you meet them
// they will say one of these lines randomly
color: purple
actor: 
spawn_group: tourists 
---
J'adore la montagne ! #line:011dc7e 
Les Alpes sont magnifiques ! #line:0e6a8d1 
Le Mont Blanc est la plus haute montagne d'Europe ! #line:003ecb2 
Je veux gravir le Mont Blanc un jour ! #line:01c1599 
J'espère voir une marmotte ! #line:04bbada 
La vue depuis le sommet doit être incroyable ! #line:031feca 
N'oubliez pas d'apporter des vêtements chauds ! #line:0590129 
Les montagnes peuvent être dangereuses, soyez prudents ! #line:097ecf0

docs.title: spawned_hiker
docs.text:
color: purple
actor:
spawn_group: hikers
---
La randonnée ici nécessite de bonnes chaussures. #line:0dbac73 
<<card hiking>>
Le vent peut changer rapidement. #line:0557ef5 
<<card wind>>
Je suis la ligne de corde quand il y a de la glace. #line:0bc67f7 
<<card rope>>
Ce glacier ressemble à une rivière gelée. #line:01e5f66 
<<card glacier>>

docs.title: spawned_alps_climber
docs.text:
color: purple
actor:
spawn_group: alps_climber
---
Les Alpes sont mon terrain de jeu. #line:0809dce 
<<card alps>>
Bientôt le sommet ! Je sens le soleil. #line:0face28 
<<card summit>>
<<card sun>>
Les crampons m'aident sur la glace dure. #line:081fbe4 
<<card crampons>>
Grimper avec un guide est plus sûr. #line:0371d31 
<<card climbing>>
<<card mountain_guide>>

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Environment (x13)
  • Education (x9)
  • Safety (x9)
  • Weather (x7)
  • Sport (x5)

docs.title: mont blanc
docs.text:
• Mont Blanc La plus haute montagne d'Europe occidentale. Recouverte de neige toute l'année.
  • Guide de montagne Une personne qui aide les gens à grimper en toute sécurité.
  • Vent Un air en mouvement qui peut sembler fort en montagne.
  • Sommet Le sommet d'une montagne.
  • Alpes Une haute chaîne de montagnes en Europe.
  • Montagne Les piliers de la terre
  • Neige Eau gelée qui tombe par temps froid.
  • Glace Eau gelée qui peut être très glissante.

docs.title: mountain tools
docs.text:
• Montagne Les piliers de la terre
  • Gants Des couvertures chaudes pour vos mains.
  • Chapeau Un bonnet chaud pour votre tête.
  • Sac à dos Un sac que vous portez sur votre dos.
  • Corde Une ligne solide utilisée pour la sécurité lors de l'escalade.
  • Crampons Poignées métalliques pointues que vous attachez aux bottes pour la glace.
  • Foulard Un tissu chaud que vous portez autour du cou.
  • Lunettes de soleil Des lunettes qui protègent vos yeux de la lumière vive.

docs.title: mountain activities
docs.text:
• Montagne Les piliers de la terre
  • Guide de montagne Une personne qui aide les gens à grimper en toute sécurité.
  • Randonnée Promenade sur des sentiers en pleine nature.
  • Escalade Escalader des rochers ou de la glace avec un équipement spécial.
  • Ski Glisser sur la neige avec des skis.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Bobsleigh Un traîneau rapide utilisé pour glisser sur la glace.

Manteau Une veste chaude pour le temps froid.

Glacier Glace à mouvement lent trouvée sur les hautes montagnes.

Marmotte Un animal de montagne à fourrure qui siffle.

Soleil Une lumière vive qui peut se refléter sur la neige.

docs.text: • (none)

docs.text: • (none)

docs.title: Gameplay
docs.text:
• Difficulty: Normal
  • Duration (min): 15

docs.title: Credits
docs.text:
• Anne (France) (content)
  • Lucie Paillat (France) (content, design)
  • Stefano Cecere (Italy) (development)
  • Valeria Passarella (Italy) (design)

docs.title: Game Design Notes
docs.text:
Prepare for an alpine adventure! Help The cat select the right gear for changing weather as he climbs Mont Blanc, the highest peak in the Alps, and learn about the countries that surround it.

Mission The player must guide Cat up a winding path to the summit of Mont Blanc. The ascent is divided into sections with different weather conditions (wind, snow, bright sun). At each section, the player must open Cat's backpack and choose the correct clothing to proceed safely. The quest culminates in a flag-placing puzzle at the peak, followed by a fun bobsled ride down.

Location Mont Blanc, French Alps - Mountain peak

docs.title: Knowledge Content
docs.text:
• Geography:
  • Know that Mont Blanc is the highest mountain in the Alps mountain range, with a height of 4807m.
  • Identify France's neighboring countries visible from the mountain: Switzerland and Italy.
  • Vocabulary (Mountains & Weather): Learn terms like mountain, peak, snow, ice, sun, and wind in a practical context.
  • Vocabulary (Preparation & Activities):
  • Learn the names of essential clothing for a cold environment.
  • See examples of mountain activities like skiing, climbing, and hiking.

docs.title: Flow
docs.text:
Base Camp - The Preparation: The quest starts at a base camp at the foot of Mont Blanc. The Mountain Guide greets Cat.

  • Guide: "Bonjour, mountaineer! Ready to climb Mont Blanc, the highest peak in the Alps? The weather on the mountain can change quickly, so you must be prepared. I've packed your bag with all the essential gear. I'm also entrusting you with these three flags to place at the summit. Let's begin!"
  • The player is shown the backpack UI, filled with the 5 clothing items.

The Ascent - A Series of Challenges: The player starts moving up a winding path.

  • Challenge 1 (The Windy Pass): The environment becomes windy (visual effects and sound). The Cat shivers.
  • Guide's Voice-over: "Brrr, that wind is biting! Open your backpack and put on something to protect yourself. You should have a coat and a hat."
    • Puzzle: The player must open the backpack UI and select the Coat and Scarf. Once selected, the Cat puts them on, and can proceed.
  • Challenge 2 (The Snow Line): It begins to snow heavily. Along this part of the path, the player sees NPCs skiing.
    • Guide's Voice-over: "Snow! It's beautiful but cold. You'll need your warmest layers now!"
    • Puzzle: The player must open the backpack and select the Hat and Gloves.
  • Challenge 3 (The Sun-Glacier): The path crosses a wide, snowy field where the sun is intensely bright. The player sees NPCs hiking with poles and sunglasses.
    • Guide's Voice-over: "The sun's reflection on the snow can be blinding! Protect your eyes."
    • Puzzle: The player must select the Sunglasses.

The Summit: The player reaches the peak. The view is spectacular. A signpost reads "Mont Blanc: 4807m". The Mountain Guide is waiting for them. Near the sign are three empty flagpoles.

Final Challenge - Placing the Flags:

  • Guide: "You made it! Welcome to the top of the Alps! From here, we can see into France, Italy, and Switzerland. Show me you know your geography. Place the flags on the correct poles!"
  • The Guide gives the player the first flag (France), then the second (Switzerland) and then the last one (Italy). Hint?
  • Puzzle: The player is shown the three flags. They must drag each flag and drop it onto the correctly labeled pole (France, Italy, Switzerland).

docs.title: Final Assessment
docs.text:
1. What is the name of the mountain range where Mont Blanc is located?
  2. Answer: The Alps
  3. The Pyrenees
  4. The Apennines
  5. How high is Mont Blanc?
  6. Answer: 4807 meters
  7. 3705 meters
  8. 4016 meters
  9. Which countries can you see from the top of Mont Blanc?
  10. Answer: Italy, France and Switzerland
  11. Italy, Austria, France
  12. Germany, France, Switzerland

  • Mountain Guide A person who helps people climb safely.

  • Summit The very top of a mountain.
  • Alps A tall mountain range in Europe.
  • Mountain The pillars of earth
  • Snow Frozen water that falls in cold weather.
  • Ice Frozen water that can be very slippery.

docs.title: mountain tools
docs.text:

  • Gloves Warm covers for your hands.
  • Hat A warm cap for your head.
  • Backpack A bag you carry on your back.
  • Rope A strong line used for safety when climbing.
  • Crampons Spiky metal grips you attach to boots for ice.
  • Scarf A warm cloth you wear around your neck.
  • Sunglasses Glasses that protect your eyes from bright light.

docs.title: mountain activities

• Mountain The pillars of earth
  • Mountain Guide A person who helps people climb safely.
  • Hiking Walking on trails in nature.

Bobsled A fast sled used to slide down ice.

Coat A warm jacket for cold weather.

Marmot A furry mountain animal that whistles.

Sun Bright light that can reflect on the snow.

  • Puzzle: The player is shown the three flags. They must drag each flag and drop it onto the correctly labeled pole (France, Italy, Switzerland).

docs.title: Game Design Notes
docs.text:
Prepare for an alpine adventure! Help The cat select the right gear for changing weather as he climbs Mont Blanc, the highest peak in the Alps, and learn about the countries that surround it.

Mission The player must guide Cat up a winding path to the summit of Mont Blanc. The ascent is divided into sections with different weather conditions (wind, snow, bright sun). At each section, the player must open Cat's backpack and choose the correct clothing to proceed safely. The quest culminates in a flag-placing puzzle at the peak, followed by a fun bobsled ride down.

Location Mont Blanc, French Alps - Mountain peak

docs.title: Knowledge Content
docs.text:
• Geography:
  • Know that Mont Blanc is the highest mountain in the Alps mountain range, with a height of 4807m.
  • Identify France's neighboring countries visible from the mountain: Switzerland and Italy.
  • Vocabulary (Mountains & Weather): Learn terms like mountain, peak, snow, ice, sun, and wind in a practical context.
  • Vocabulary (Preparation & Activities):
  • Learn the names of essential clothing for a cold environment.
  • See examples of mountain activities like skiing, climbing, and hiking.

docs.title: Flow
docs.text:
Base Camp - The Preparation: The quest starts at a base camp at the foot of Mont Blanc. The Mountain Guide greets Cat.

  • Guide: "Bonjour, mountaineer! Ready to climb Mont Blanc, the highest peak in the Alps? The weather on the mountain can change quickly, so you must be prepared. I've packed your bag with all the essential gear. I'm also entrusting you with these three flags to place at the summit. Let's begin!"
  • The player is shown the backpack UI, filled with the 5 clothing items.

The Ascent - A Series of Challenges: The player starts moving up a winding path.

  • Challenge 1 (The Windy Pass): The environment becomes windy (visual effects and sound). The Cat shivers.
  • Guide's Voice-over: "Brrr, that wind is biting! Open your backpack and put on something to protect yourself. You should have a coat and a hat."
    • Puzzle: The player must open the backpack UI and select the Coat and Scarf. Once selected, the Cat puts them on, and can proceed.
  • Challenge 2 (The Snow Line): It begins to snow heavily. Along this part of the path, the player sees NPCs skiing.
    • Guide's Voice-over: "Snow! It's beautiful but cold. You'll need your warmest layers now!"
    • Puzzle: The player must open the backpack and select the Hat and Gloves.
  • Challenge 3 (The Sun-Glacier): The path crosses a wide, snowy field where the sun is intensely bright. The player sees NPCs hiking with poles and sunglasses.
    • Guide's Voice-over: "The sun's reflection on the snow can be blinding! Protect your eyes."
    • Puzzle: The player must select the Sunglasses.

The Summit: The player reaches the peak. The view is spectacular. A signpost reads "Mont Blanc: 4807m". The Mountain Guide is waiting for them. Near the sign are three empty flagpoles.

Final Challenge - Placing the Flags:

  • Guide: "You made it! Welcome to the top of the Alps! From here, we can see into France, Italy, and Switzerland. Show me you know your geography. Place the flags on the correct poles!"
  • The Guide gives the player the first flag (France), then the second (Switzerland) and then the last one (Italy). Hint?
  • Puzzle: The player is shown the three flags. They must drag each flag and drop it onto the correctly labeled pole (France, Italy, Switzerland).

docs.title: Final Assessment
docs.text:
1. What is the name of the mountain range where Mont Blanc is located?
  2. Answer: The Alps
  3. The Pyrenees
  4. The Apennines
  5. How high is Mont Blanc?
  6. Answer: 4807 meters
  7. 3705 meters
  8. 4016 meters
  9. Which countries can you see from the top of Mont Blanc?
  10. Answer: Italy, France and Switzerland
  11. Italy, Austria, France
  12. Germany, France, Switzerland

docs.text:

color: blue
tags:

<<elseif GetCollectedItem("COLLECT_THE_INGREDIENTS") > 0 >>

<<else>>

<<endif>>

docs.text:
group: chef
tags: actor=MAN

Ma ho bisogno di alcuni ingredienti. #line:0623733 
<<jump task_ingredients>>

docs.title: task_ingredients

color: green
tags: task

Ricordatevi le buone maniere! #line:02819db 
Dire "Bonjour" per salutare qualcuno, #line:04c9d69 
e "Merci" per ringraziarli. #line:022fd8f

docs.title: task_ingredients_desc

type: task

Raccogli tutti gli ingredienti per la ricetta. #line:00849bb

docs.title: chef_welcome
docs.text:
group: chef
tags: actor=MAN
---
Bonjour! Welcome to Marseille, on the Mediterranean Sea! #line:02548dd 
I want to make a special dish for you, a bouillabaisse! #line:0c65de3 
<<card bouillabaisse zoom>>
But I need some ingredients. #line:0623733 
<<jump task_ingredients>>

docs.title: task_ingredients
docs.text:
group: chef
color: green
tags: task
---
Please go to the market and buy them for me. #line:06602c6 
<<task_start COLLECT_THE_INGREDIENTS task_ingredients_done>>
Remember your manners! #line:02819db 
Say "Bonjour" to greet someone, #line:04c9d69 
and "Merci" to thank them. #line:022fd8f

docs.title: task_ingredients_desc
docs.text:
type: task
---
Collect all the ingredients for the recipe. #line:00849bb 
They are: bread, fish, orange, lemon, tomato, milk, pepper and salt, oil. #line:03fbee1

docs.title: Nourriture et marché (fr_09)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: France - Marseille

Visitez le Vieux-Port animé de Marseille ! Apprenez les formules de politesse en achetant les ingrédients d'un célèbre plat local, la bouillabaisse.

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x17)
  • Food (x11)
  • History (x6)

docs.title: market traders
docs.text:
• Market traders People who sell food and goods at market stalls—like fishmongers, cheesemongers, and fruit sellers. They weigh, wrap, and call out today’s prices.
  • Fromager Une personne qui vend de nombreux types de fromages.
  • Boulanger Une personne qui fait du pain, des gâteaux et des pâtisseries.
  • Marchand de légumes Une personne qui vend des fruits et légumes frais.
  • Épicier Une personne qui vend de nombreux types d’aliments et de boissons.
  • Poissonnier Une personne qui vend du poisson frais et des fruits de mer.

docs.title: Bouillabaisse
docs.text:
• Bouillabaisse Une soupe de poisson typique de Marseille, dans le sud de la France. Elle est composée de différentes variétés de poissons et dégage une délicieuse odeur !
  • PAIN Un délicieux aliment à base de farine et d'eau. Vous pouvez faire des sandwichs avec du pain !
  • POISSON Un animal qui vit et nage dans l'eau. Les poissons ont des nageoires et des branchies pour respirer sous l'eau.
  • Crabe Un animal marin doté de grandes pinces et d'une carapace dure. Les crabes marchent latéralement sur la plage !
  • Lait Une boisson blanche issue du lait de vache. Le lait contribue à la solidité des os et des dents !
  • Orange Un fruit rond et orange, au goût sucré et juteux. L'orange est riche en vitamine C !
  • Tomate Un fruit rouge et rond qui pousse sur les plantes. On utilise les tomates pour faire de la sauce à pizza !
  • Citron Un fruit jaune au goût très acide. On utilise le citron pour faire de la limonade !
  • Huile d'olive Une huile spéciale à base d'olives. On l'utilise pour cuisiner des plats savoureux.
  • Poivre Sel Des épices qui rehaussent le goût des aliments. Le sel est blanc et le poivre est noir avec de petits morceaux.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Pirates français De braves marins qui sillonnaient les mers pour le roi de France. On les appelait corsaires et ils protégeaient les navires français de l'ennemi.

Monnaie euro Monnaie utilisée dans de nombreux pays d'Europe. Vous pouvez acheter des jouets et des glaces avec des euros !

docs.title: Game Design
docs.text:
Title: The Colors of the Marseille Market

Short Description: Visit the vibrant Old Port of Marseille! Learn polite French phrases as you shop for the ingredients to a famous local dish, bouillabaisse, and discover the famous artists who were inspired by the light of the Côte d'Azur.

docs.title: Mission
docs.text: The player is given a shopping list by a chef and must navigate a bustling French market to buy the correct ingredients. The core gameplay involves interacting with various vendors. For each interaction, the player must use polite phrases ("Bonjour," "Merci") and decide whether to purchase the vendor's goods based on the shopping list. The quest is completed by successfully gathering all ingredients.

docs.title: Cibo e mercato (fr_09)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: France - Marsiglia

Visita il vivace Porto Vecchio di Marsiglia! Impara frasi di cortesia in francese mentre fai la spesa per preparare un famoso piatto locale, la bouillabaisse.

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x17)
  • Food (x11)
  • History (x6)

docs.title: market traders
docs.text:
• Market traders People who sell food and goods at market stalls—like fishmongers, cheesemongers, and fruit sellers. They weigh, wrap, and call out today’s prices.
  • casaro Una persona che vende molti tipi di formaggio.
  • Panettiere Una persona che prepara pane, torte e pasticcini.
  • Fruttivendolo Una persona che vende frutta e verdura fresca.
  • Droghiere Persona che vende molti tipi di cibo e bevande.
  • Pescivendolo Persona che vende pesce fresco e frutti di mare.

docs.title: Bouillabaisse
docs.text:
• Bouillabaisse Una zuppa di pesce speciale tipica di Marsiglia, nel sud della Francia. È preparata con molti tipi diversi di pesce e ha un profumo delizioso!
  • PANE Un alimento delizioso a base di farina e acqua. Puoi preparare dei panini con il pane!
  • PESCARE Un animale che vive e nuota nell'acqua. I pesci hanno pinne e branchie per respirare sott'acqua.
  • Granchio Un animale marino con grandi chele e un guscio duro. I granchi camminano di traverso sulla spiaggia!
  • Latte Una bevanda bianca che proviene dalle mucche. Il latte aiuta a rafforzare ossa e denti!
  • Arancia Un frutto rotondo e arancione, dal sapore dolce e succoso. Le arance sono ricche di vitamina C!
  • Pomodoro Un frutto rosso e rotondo che cresce sulle piante. I pomodori vengono usati per fare la salsa per la pizza!
  • Limone Un frutto giallo dal sapore molto aspro. I limoni vengono usati per fare la limonata!
  • Olio d'oliva Un olio speciale ricavato dalle olive. Viene utilizzato per cucinare piatti gustosi.
  • Sale al pepe Spezie che migliorano il sapore del cibo. Il sale è bianco e il pepe è nero, con pezzetti minuscoli.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Pirati francesi Coraggiosi marinai che solcavano i mari per il re di Francia. Venivano chiamati corsari e proteggevano le navi francesi dai nemici.

Valuta Euro Valuta utilizzata in molti paesi europei. Con gli euro puoi comprare giocattoli e gelati!

docs.title: The Colors of the Marseille Market (fr_09)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: France - Marseille

Visit the vibrant Old Port of Marseille! Learn polite French phrases as you shop for the ingredients to a famous local dish, bouillabaisse.

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x17)
  • Food (x11)
  • History (x6)

docs.title: market traders
docs.text:
• Market traders People who sell food and goods at market stalls—like fishmongers, cheesemongers, and fruit sellers. They weigh, wrap, and call out today’s prices.
  • Cheesemonger A person who sells many types of cheese.
  • Baker A person who makes bread, cakes, and pastries.
  • Greengrocer A person who sells fresh fruit and vegetables.
  • Grocer A person who sells many kinds of food and drinks.
  • Fishmonger A person who sells fresh fish and seafood.

docs.title: Bouillabaisse
docs.text:
• Bouillabaisse A special fish soup from Marseille in southern France. It's made with many different types of fish and has a delicious smell!
  • BREAD A yummy food made from flour and water. You can make sandwiches with bread!
  • FISH An animal that lives and swims in water. Fish have fins and gills to breathe underwater.
  • Crab A sea animal with big claws and a hard shell. Crabs walk sideways on the beach!
  • Milk A white drink that comes from cows. Milk helps your bones and teeth grow strong!
  • Orange A round, orange fruit that tastes sweet and juicy. Oranges have lots of vitamin C!
  • Tomato A red, round fruit that grows on plants. Tomatoes are used to make pizza sauce!
  • Lemon A yellow fruit that tastes very sour. Lemons are used to make lemonade!
  • Olive oil A special oil made from olives. People use it for cooking tasty food.
  • Pepper Salt Spices that make food taste better. Salt is white and pepper is black with tiny pieces.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
French Pirates Brave sailors who sailed the seas for the King of France. They were called corsairs and protected French ships from enemies.

Euro Currency Money used in many countries in Europe. You can buy toys and ice cream with euros!

docs.title: Jedzenie i targ (fr_09)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: France - Marsylia

Odwiedź tętniący życiem Stary Port w Marsylii! Naucz się grzecznych francuskich zwrotów, kupując składniki do słynnego lokalnego dania, bouillabaisse.

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x17)
  • Food (x11)
  • History (x6)

docs.title: market traders
docs.text:
• Market traders People who sell food and goods at market stalls—like fishmongers, cheesemongers, and fruit sellers. They weigh, wrap, and call out today’s prices.
  • Kupiec handlujący serem Osoba sprzedająca wiele rodzajów sera.
  • Piekarz Osoba zajmująca się wypiekiem chleba, ciast i wypieków.
  • Badylarz Osoba sprzedająca świeże owoce i warzywa.
  • Właściciel sklepu spożywczego Osoba sprzedająca różnego rodzaju żywność i napoje.
  • Sprzedawca ryb Osoba sprzedająca świeże ryby i owoce morza.

docs.title: Bouillabaisse
docs.text:
• Bouillabaisse Wyjątkowa zupa rybna z Marsylii w południowej Francji. Przyrządzana z wielu różnych gatunków ryb, ma pyszny zapach!
  • CHLEB Pyszne danie z mąki i wody. Można zrobić kanapki z chleba!
  • RYBA Zwierzę żyjące i pływające w wodzie. Ryby mają płetwy i skrzela, które umożliwiają im oddychanie pod wodą.
  • Krab Zwierzę morskie z dużymi szczypcami i twardą skorupą. Kraby chodzą bokiem po plaży!
  • Mleko Biały napój pochodzący od krów. Mleko wzmacnia kości i zęby!
  • Pomarańczowy Okrągły, pomarańczowy owoc o słodkim i soczystym smaku. Pomarańcze mają mnóstwo witaminy C!
  • Pomidor Czerwony, okrągły owoc rosnący na roślinach. Pomidory służą do robienia sosu do pizzy!
  • Cytrynowy Żółty owoc o bardzo kwaśnym smaku. Cytryny służą do robienia lemoniady!
  • Oliwa z oliwek Specjalny olej z oliwek. Ludzie używają go do gotowania smacznych potraw.
  • Pieprz Sól Przyprawy, które poprawiają smak potraw. Sól jest biała, a pieprz czarny i ma drobne kawałki.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Francuscy piraci Odważni żeglarze, którzy żeglowali po morzach dla króla Francji. Nazywano ich korsarzami i chronili francuskie statki przed wrogami.

Waluta euro Waluta używana w wielu krajach Europy. Za euro można kupić zabawki i lody!

Short Description: Visit the vibrant Old Port of Marseille! Learn polite French phrases as you shop for the ingredients to a famous local dish, bouillabaisse, and discover the famous artists who were inspired by the light of the Côte d'Azur.

docs.title: Mission
docs.text: The player is given a shopping list by a chef and must navigate a bustling French market to buy the correct ingredients. The core gameplay involves interacting with various vendors. For each interaction, the player must use polite phrases ("Bonjour," "Merci") and decide whether to purchase the vendor's goods based on the shopping list. The quest is completed by successfully gathering all ingredients.

docs.title: quest_start
docs.text:
// fr_10 | Seine (Paris)
// 
tags:
type: panel
color: red
---
<<set $TOTAL_COINS = 0>>
<<set $CURRENT_PROGRESS = 0>>
<<set $MAX_PROGRESS = 8>>
Witamy nad Sekwaną w Paryżu! #line:042160f 
Dowiesz się o rzece, jej mostach i łodziach, które po niej pływają. #line:0280e8f

docs.title: quest_end
docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel_endgame
---
Świetnie, znalazłeś wszystkie mosty. #line:0c408c3 
<<card place_bridge_people>>
Dowiedziałeś się o mostach dla pociągów, samochodów i ludzi. #line:091e9fc 
<<card boat_river>>
Widziałeś łodzie do przewozu ludzi, łodzie towarowe, a nawet dom na wodzie. #line:01d91fb 
<<card seine_map>>
Spojrzeliśmy na mapę, żeby zobaczyć którędy płynie Sekwana. #line:0ca298e 
Sekwana kończy się w kanale La Manche. #line:0c693da 
<<card pont_alexandre_iii>>
Most Aleksandra III to słynny most ze złotymi posągami. #line:091d35c 
<<card boat_eiffel_tower>>
Paryż rozrasta się wokół Sekwany. Rzeki pomagają miastom żyć. #line:08cc02a 
<<jump post_quest_activity>>

docs.title: post_quest_activity
docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel
tags: proposal
---

Pokoloruj rzekę na niebiesko i dodaj małą łódkę. #line:04f7aaa 
Opowiedz znajomemu jedną ciekawostkę o Sekwanie. #line:0062ddd 
<<quest_end>>

<<endif>>

docs.title: Paris Seine (fr_10)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: France - Paris

Découvrons le principal fleuve de France

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Environment (x5)
  • Geography (x5)

docs.title: Seine Bridges
docs.text:
• Pont pour voitures Une route qui traverse l'eau pour que les voitures puissent traverser les rivières et les lacs.
  • Passerelles De petits ponts pour les piétons. Ils vous protègent de la circulation.
  • Pont pour trains Un pont spécial construit suffisamment solide pour que les trains lourds puissent traverser l'eau.
  • bateau fluvial Un bateau qui navigue sur les rivières. Les rivières sont comme des routes faites d'eau !

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Bateau sur la Seine Un bateau exceptionnel qui navigue sur la Seine à Paris. Depuis l'eau, vous pourrez admirer la Tour Eiffel et d'autres magnifiques monuments !

Pont Alexandre III Un beau pont à Paris avec des décorations fantaisistes et des statues dorées dessus.

Seine Un fleuve de 777 kilomètres de long dans le nord de la France

Carte de la Seine Une image qui montre la Seine et où elle coule à travers le pays.

Carte de la Seine à Paris Une image qui montre comment la Seine traverse la ville de Paris.

docs.text:
• Anne (France) (content)
  • Lucie Paillat (France) (content, design)
  • Stefano Cecere (Italy) (development)

docs.title: Didactical content
docs.text:
1. How to recognize a sign indicating a river or a waterway?
  2. The Seine is spanned by many bridges. Some are very famous. There are 37 bridges on the Seine.
  3. there are bridges for cars
  4. there are footbridges
  5. there are bridges for trains and metros
  6. On the Seine, you can see all kinds of boats. There are boats:
  7. with large windows so that tourists can see the city, the ''bâteaux mouches''
  8. to live, the barges
  9. to transport goods
  10. The Seine flows into the English Channel, north of France

docs.title: Parigi Senna (fr_10)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: France - Parigi

Scopriamo il fiume principale della Francia

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Environment (x5)
  • Geography (x5)

docs.title: Seine Bridges
docs.text:
• Ponte per auto Una strada che attraversa l'acqua, consentendo alle auto di attraversare fiumi e laghi.
  • Passerelle Piccoli ponti per i pedoni. Ti proteggono dal traffico.
  • Ponte per treni Un ponte speciale costruito in modo sufficientemente robusto da consentire ai treni pesanti di attraversare l'acqua.
  • barca fluviale Una barca che naviga sui fiumi. I fiumi sono come strade fatte d'acqua!

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Battello sulla Senna Un'imbarcazione speciale che naviga sulla Senna a Parigi. Dall'acqua si possono ammirare la Torre Eiffel e altri splendidi edifici!

Ponte Alessandro III Uno splendido ponte di Parigi con decorazioni fantasiose e statue dorate.

Senna Un fiume lungo 777 chilometri nel nord della Francia

Mappa della Senna Un'immagine che mostra la Senna e il suo percorso attraverso il territorio.

Mappa della Senna a Parigi Un'immagine che mostra come la Senna scorre attraverso la città di Parigi.

• Bridge for cars A road that goes over water so cars can drive across rivers and lakes.
  • Footbridges Small bridges for people walking. They keep you safe from traffic.
  • Bridge for trains A special bridge built strong enough for heavy trains to cross over water.
  • River boat A boat that travels on rivers. Rivers are like roads made of water!

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Seine River Boat A special boat that sails on the Seine River in Paris. You can see the Eiffel Tower and other beautiful buildings from the water!

Pont Alexandre III A beautiful bridge in Paris with fancy decorations and golden statues on it.

Seine A 777-kilometre-long river in northern France

Map of Seine River A picture that shows the Seine River and where it flows through the land.

Map of Seine in Paris A picture that shows how the Seine River flows through the city of Paris.

docs.title: Didactical content
docs.text:
1. How to recognize a sign indicating a river or a waterway?
  2. The Seine is spanned by many bridges. Some are very famous. There are 37 bridges on the Seine.
  3. there are bridges for cars
  4. there are footbridges
  5. there are bridges for trains and metros
  6. On the Seine, you can see all kinds of boats. There are boats:
  7. with large windows so that tourists can see the city, the ''bâteaux mouches''
  8. to live, the barges
  9. to transport goods
  10. The Seine flows into the English Channel, north of France

docs.title: Seine Bridges
docs.text:
• Most dla samochodów Droga biegnąca nad wodą, dzięki której samochody mogą pokonywać rzeki i jeziora.
  • Kładki dla pieszych Małe mostki dla pieszych. Chronią przed ruchem ulicznym.
  • Most dla pociągów Specjalny most o konstrukcji wystarczająco wytrzymałej, aby umożliwić przejazd ciężkich pociągów nad wodą.
  • Łódź rzeczna Łódź, która płynie po rzekach. Rzeki są jak drogi zbudowane z wody!

docs.text:

docs.title: quest_start
docs.text:
=
tags:
type: panel
---
<<set $MAX_PROGRESS = 4>>
<<set $CURRENT_PROGRESS = 0>>
<<set $TOTAL_COINS = 0>>
<<declare $quest1 = false>>
<<declare $activity1 = false>>
<<declare $quest2 = false>>
<<declare $activity2 = false>>
Bienvenue dans la quête musicale ! #line:0e2f565

docs.title: band_member
docs.text:
tags: actor=MAN
---
<<if $quest1 == true>>
    <<if $activity1 == false>>
    Merci de nous aider ! #line:09fc7ad 
    Peux-tu le mettre ensemble ? #line:0515a95 
    <<set $activity1 = true>>
    <<activity order_Musical_notes>>
    <<elseif $activity1 ==true >>
    [MISSING TRANSLATION:     We're gonna play soon!]
    <<endif>>
<<else>>
Bonjour ! Nous faisons partie d'un groupe. Nous sommes musiciens. #line:09a50f8 
Nous voulions jouer l'hymne français, mais nous ne pouvons pas ! #line:0a9df26 
Antura a mélangé le scénario musical. #line:0f0ccdf 
Retrouvez les notes du script. #line:0c9616b 
<<task_start find_the_script_parts win_quest1>>
<<endif>>

docs.title: jean_michelle_jarre
docs.text:
tags: 
---
<<if $activity2 == true>>
[MISSING TRANSLATION: Great job!]
<<elseif $quest2 == true >>
    Merci ! Les paroles de l'hymne français sont importantes. #line:025e35b 
    L'hymne national français, « La Marseillaise », représente la France et son peuple. #line:0e4484d 
    Peux-tu mettre les mots dans l'ordre ? #line:07e4ff1 
    <<set $activity2 = true>>
    <<activity  order_marseillese_audio marseillese_played>>
<<elseif $activity1 ==true >>
    Bonjour, je m'appelle Jean Michelle Jarre. #line:02f7c8b 
    Je suis un compositeur français et j'aide le groupe à jouer "La Marseillaise". #line:0bd77b7 
    Trouvez les paroles de l'hymne. #line:0e7033c 
    Ils ont été dispersés par Antura. #line:0dc84d4 
    <<task_start find_the_words win_quest2>>
<<else>>
Je suis occupé en ce moment, viens me parler plus tard #line:08be987 
<<endif>>

Découvrez l'histoire de l'hymne français et comment le jouer !

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Music (x16)
  • Education (x14)
  • Culture (x7)
  • Civics (x1)
  • History (x1)

docs.title: marseillaise music
docs.text:
• La Marseillaise L'hymne national français. On le chante lors des grands événements et des compétitions sportives.
  • Révolution française Une époque dans les années 1790 où la France a changé de gouvernement.
  • Le jour de la gloire Paroles de la première ligne de l’hymne.
  • Allons les enfants Les premiers mots de la première ligne de l’hymne.
  • De la patrie Paroles de la première ligne de l’hymne.
  • Est arrivé Paroles de la première ligne de l’hymne.

docs.title: Musical Notes
docs.text:
• Partition musicale Les notes écrites et les paroles d'une chanson.
  • Piano Un instrument à clavier utilisé pour jouer des mélodies et des accords.
  • La Une note de musique.
  • Fa Une note de musique.
  • Si Une note de musique.
  • Sol Une note de musique.
  • Ut Une note de musique.
  • Mi Une note de musique.
  • Concernant Une note de musique.

docs.title: Game Design Notes
docs.text: Mission: Play the first part of the French anthem (La Marseillaise)

docs.title: Knowledge Content
docs.text:
History: “La Marseillaise” was written in 1792 and played for the first time in 1795 The historical context of the time it was written - during the French Revolution

Vocabulary (Putting a Phrase together):

  • Assembling the first phrase of “La Marseillaise”
  • What’s a Hymn/anthem

Musical Knowledge: Knowing the musical notes (Do, Re - Mi - Fa - Sol - La - Si) we need a card for each

docs.title: Flow
docs.text:
The Mission - Find the script The band wants to play “La Marseillaise” but the script has been scattered around by Antura, the cat must find the 7 pieces that make up the script that are scattered around the park. Every piece will have a musical note on them, the band will tell you that they are Ut - Re - Mi - Fa - Sol - La - Si.

Using the activity Order : Ut - Re - Mi - Fa - Sol - La - Si

Phrase - Find the words Once the pieces of the song have been put together the leader of the band, Jean Michelle Jarre, is gonna introduce himself and then he will tell the player that the French Hymn is a song that is meant to represent the Nation and unite its people. Once the hymn is put together the band will shortly play the song with the lyrics and then Antura acting up again will scatter the first words of the hymn. The Band remembers them but they’re scared to play without them so they’ll ask the cat to re-order them. With a button you can hear the song.

Using the activity Order : “Allons enfants” - “De la patrie” - “Le jour de la gloire” - “Est arrivé” (we need a Card for each part)

Conclusion - Play the song Once the words are put together the band will say that it was written in 1792 during the French Revolution and they’ll ask the player to play with them the first part of a Xylophone, giving them a musical score with the notes written on top. Once done the band will congratulate the cat and Antura calmed down by the music will stop causing trouble. For now.

Interactions Band Member 1 : “We want to play “La marseillaise!” But Antura has lost all the musical scores! Help us find them! They’re scattered all around and they are seven like the notes : Ut - Re - Mi - Fa - Sol - La - Si”

After collecting everything “Thank you for getting everything back!” Jean :”but the words are all messed up! The band remembers them but we want to have them ordered! You know the National Anthem

Final Assessment

What is “La Marseillaise”?

  • The French National Anthem (correct)
  • The English National anthem
  • The song of Antura

What is a National Anthem?

  • A song to represent a Nation and its people (correct)
  • A song to represent a War that happened in French
  • A song to represent Antura

When was “La Marseillaise” written?

  • 1792 (correct)
  • 2025
  • 1970

docs.title: Les voisins de la Pologne (pl_00)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: Poland - Pologne

Découvrez les voisins de la Pologne

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x15)
  • Geography (x15)
  • Community (x2)
  • Education (x2)

docs.title: Poland country
docs.text:
• Pologne Un pays d'Europe dont la capitale est Varsovie. La Pologne est célèbre pour ses scientifiques comme Copernic et ses délicieux pierogi !
  • Drapeau de la Pologne Le drapeau polonais est orné de bandes horizontales blanches et rouges. La Pologne est célèbre pour ses scientifiques comme Copernic et ses délicieux pierogi !
  • Varsovie La capitale de la Pologne.

docs.title: Flags of Europe
docs.text:
• Carte de l'Europe Une carte montrant tous les pays d'Europe. Vous pouvez voir où se trouvent la France, la Pologne, l'Allemagne et d'autres pays.
  • Drapeau de l'Allemagne Le drapeau allemand comporte trois bandes horizontales : noire, rouge et jaune. L'Allemagne est célèbre pour ses voitures, ses châteaux et ses contes de fées !
  • Drapeau de l'Italie Le drapeau italien comporte trois bandes verticales : verte, blanche et rouge. Ces couleurs rappellent le basilic, la mozzarella et les tomates sur une pizza !
  • Drapeau du Luxembourg Le drapeau luxembourgeois est composé de bandes horizontales rouges, blanches et bleu clair. Le Luxembourg est un tout petit pays qui parle trois langues !
  • Drapeau de Monaco Le drapeau de Monaco est composé de bandes horizontales rouges et blanches. Monaco est une petite ville, mais célèbre pour ses voitures de luxe et ses palais royaux en bord de mer !
  • Drapeau de la Belgique Le drapeau belge comporte trois bandes verticales : noire, jaune et rouge. La Belgique est célèbre pour son chocolat et ses gaufres !
  • Drapeau de l'Espagne Le drapeau espagnol est orné de bandes horizontales rouges et jaunes. Ces couleurs évoquent le soleil et les poivrons ! L'Espagne a inventé le flamenco.
  • Drapeau de la Suisse Le drapeau suisse est rouge avec une croix blanche au milieu. On dirait une trousse de premiers secours ! La Suisse est célèbre pour ses montagnes et son fromage.
  • Drapeau de la France Le drapeau français comporte trois bandes verticales : bleu, blanc et rouge. Ces couleurs représentent la liberté, l'égalité et la fraternité !
  • Flag of Czech Republic The flag has white and red stripes with a blue triangle. The Czech Republic is famous for beautiful Prague castle and crystal glass.
  • Drapeau de la Slovaquie Un drapeau aux couleurs blanche, bleue et rouge. Il représente la Slovaquie.
  • Drapeau de l'Ukraine Un drapeau bleu et jaune, comme le ciel et le soleil. Il représente l'Ukraine.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Drapeau de la Biélorussie Le drapeau de la Biélorussie est composé de bandes horizontales rouges et vertes, ornées de magnifiques motifs traditionnels sur les côtés. La Biélorussie est voisine de la Pologne.

Drapeau de la Lituanie Le drapeau est composé de bandes horizontales jaunes, vertes et rouges. La Lituanie est un pays balte doté de magnifiques forêts et plages.

Drapeau de la Russie Un drapeau à rayures blanches, bleues et rouges. Il représente la Russie.

docs.text: Comprehensive Polish geography introduction.

docs.title: Knowledge Content
docs.text:
European Geography: learn the 8 countries that border mainland Poland and their capitals

  • Belarus
  • Czech Republic
  • Germany
  • Lithuania
  • Russia
  • Slovakia
  • Ukraine

Vexillology (the study of flags): recognize the flags of these 8 nations and learn to identify them based on color and pattern descriptions.

Cultural Snippets: learn a simple greeting in each country.

docs.title: I vicini della Polonia (pl_00)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: Poland - Polonia

Scopri i vicini della Polonia

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x15)
  • Geography (x15)
  • Community (x2)
  • Education (x2)

docs.title: Poland country
docs.text:
• Polonia Un paese in Europa. La capitale è Varsavia. La Polonia è famosa per scienziati come Copernico e per i deliziosi pierogi!
  • Bandiera della Polonia La bandiera della Polonia è a strisce orizzontali bianche e rosse. La Polonia è famosa per scienziati come Copernico e per i deliziosi pierogi!
  • Varsavia La capitale della Polonia.

docs.title: Flags of Europe
docs.text:
• Mappa dell'Europa Una mappa che mostra tutti i paesi d'Europa. Puoi vedere dove si trovano Francia, Polonia, Germania e altri paesi.
  • Bandiera della Germania La bandiera della Germania ha tre strisce orizzontali: nera, rossa e gialla. La Germania è famosa per le automobili, i castelli e le fiabe!
  • Bandiera dell'Italia La bandiera italiana ha tre strisce verticali: verde, bianco e rosso. I colori ricordano il basilico, la mozzarella e i pomodori sulla pizza!
  • Bandiera del Lussemburgo La bandiera del Lussemburgo è a strisce orizzontali rosse, bianche e azzurre. Il Lussemburgo è un paese molto piccolo in cui si parlano tre lingue!
  • Bandiera di Monaco La bandiera di Monaco è a strisce orizzontali rosse e bianche. Monaco è piccola ma famosa per le sue auto di lusso e i palazzi reali sul mare!
  • Bandiera del Belgio La bandiera del Belgio ha tre strisce verticali: nera, gialla e rossa. Il Belgio è famoso per il cioccolato e i waffle!
  • Bandiera della Spagna La bandiera spagnola ha strisce orizzontali rosse e gialle. I colori sono quelli del sole e dei peperoni! La Spagna ha inventato il flamenco.
  • Bandiera della Svizzera La bandiera svizzera è rossa con una croce bianca al centro. Sembra un kit di pronto soccorso! La Svizzera è famosa per le montagne e il formaggio.
  • Bandiera della Francia La bandiera francese ha tre strisce verticali: blu, bianco e rosso. Questi colori rappresentano libertà, uguaglianza e fratellanza!
  • Flag of Czech Republic The flag has white and red stripes with a blue triangle. The Czech Republic is famous for beautiful Prague castle and crystal glass.
  • Bandiera della Slovacchia Una bandiera con i colori bianco, blu e rosso. Rappresenta la Slovacchia.
  • Bandiera dell'Ucraina Una bandiera con i colori blu e giallo, come il cielo e il sole. Rappresenta il paese dell'Ucraina.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Bandiera della Bielorussia La bandiera della Bielorussia presenta strisce orizzontali rosse e verdi con splendidi motivi tradizionali sui lati. La Bielorussia è uno stato vicino alla Polonia.

Bandiera della Lituania La bandiera presenta strisce orizzontali gialle, verdi e rosse. La Lituania è un paese baltico con splendide foreste e spiagge.

Bandiera della Russia Una bandiera a strisce bianche, blu e rosse. Rappresenta la Russia.

docs.title: The neighbors of Poland (pl_00)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: Poland - Poland

Discover the neighbours of Poland

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x15)
  • Geography (x15)
  • Community (x2)
  • Education (x2)

docs.title: Poland country
docs.text:
• Poland A country in Europe. Capital is Warsaw. Poland is famous for scientists like Copernicus and delicious pierogi!
  • Flag of Poland The flag of Poland has white and red horizontal stripes. Poland is famous for scientists like Copernicus and delicious pierogi!
  • Warsaw The capital city of Poland.

docs.title: Flags of Europe
docs.text:
• Europe Map A map showing all the countries in Europe. You can see where France, Poland, Germany, and other countries are located.
  • Flag of Germany The flag of Germany has three horizontal stripes: black, red, and yellow. Germany is famous for cars, castles, and fairy tales!
  • Flag of Italy The flag of Italy has three vertical stripes: green, white, and red. The colors look like basil, mozzarella, and tomatoes on pizza!
  • Flag of Luxembourg The flag of Luxembourg has red, white, and light blue horizontal stripes. Luxembourg is a very small country that speaks three languages!
  • Flag of Monaco The flag of Monaco has red and white horizontal stripes. Monaco is tiny but famous for fancy cars and royal palaces by the sea!
  • Flag of Belgium The flag of Belgium has three vertical stripes: black, yellow, and red. Belgium is famous for chocolate and waffles!
  • Flag of Spain The flag of Spain has red and yellow horizontal stripes. The colors are like the sun and peppers! Spain invented flamenco dancing.
  • Flag of Switzerland The flag of Switzerland is red with a white cross in the middle. It looks like a first aid kit! Switzerland is famous for mountains and cheese.
  • Flag of France The flag of France has three vertical stripes: blue, white, and red. These colors represent liberty, equality, and fraternity!
  • Flag of Czech Republic The flag has white and red stripes with a blue triangle. The Czech Republic is famous for beautiful Prague castle and crystal glass.
  • Flag of Slovakia A flag with white, blue, and red colors. It represents the country of Slovakia.
  • Flag of Ukraine A flag with blue and yellow colors like the sky and sun. It represents the country of Ukraine.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Flag of Belarus The flag of Belarus has red and green horizontal stripes with beautiful traditional patterns on the side. Belarus is Poland's neighbor.

Flag of Lithuania The flag has yellow, green, and red horizontal stripes. Lithuania is a Baltic country with beautiful forests and beaches.

Flag of Russia A flag with white, blue, and red stripes. It represents the country of Russia.

docs.title: Sąsiedzi Polski (pl_00)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: Poland - Polska

Odkryj sąsiadów Polski

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x15)
  • Geography (x15)
  • Community (x2)
  • Education (x2)

docs.title: Poland country
docs.text:
• Polska Kraj w Europie. Stolicą jest Warszawa. Polska słynie z naukowców takich jak Kopernik i pysznych pierogów!
  • Flaga Polski Flaga Polski ma poziome, biało-czerwone pasy. Polska słynie z naukowców takich jak Kopernik i pysznych pierogów!
  • Warszawa Stolica Polski.

docs.title: Flags of Europe
docs.text:
• Mapa Europy Mapa przedstawiająca wszystkie kraje Europy. Możesz zobaczyć, gdzie znajdują się Francja, Polska, Niemcy i inne kraje.
  • Flaga Niemiec Flaga Niemiec ma trzy poziome pasy: czarny, czerwony i żółty. Niemcy słyną z samochodów, zamków i bajek!
  • Flaga Włoch Flaga Włoch ma trzy pionowe pasy: zielony, biały i czerwony. Kolory te przypominają bazylię, mozzarellę i pomidory na pizzy!
  • Flaga Luksemburga Flaga Luksemburga ma poziome pasy w kolorze czerwonym, białym i jasnoniebieskim. Luksemburg to bardzo mały kraj, w którym mówi się trzema językami!
  • Flaga Monako Flaga Monako ma poziome, czerwone i białe pasy. Monako jest malutkie, ale słynie z luksusowych samochodów i królewskich pałaców nad morzem!
  • Flaga Belgii Flaga Belgii ma trzy pionowe pasy: czarny, żółty i czerwony. Belgia słynie z czekolady i gofrów!
  • Flaga Hiszpanii Flaga Hiszpanii ma poziome, czerwone i żółte pasy. Kolory te przypominają słońce i paprykę! To Hiszpania wynalazła taniec flamenco.
  • Flaga Szwajcarii Flaga Szwajcarii jest czerwona z białym krzyżem pośrodku. Wygląda jak apteczka pierwszej pomocy! Szwajcaria słynie z gór i sera.
  • Flaga Francji Flaga Francji ma trzy pionowe pasy: niebieski, biały i czerwony. Te kolory symbolizują wolność, równość i braterstwo!
  • Flag of Czech Republic The flag has white and red stripes with a blue triangle. The Czech Republic is famous for beautiful Prague castle and crystal glass.
  • Flaga Słowacji Flaga w kolorach białym, niebieskim i czerwonym. Reprezentuje Słowację.
  • Flaga Ukrainy Flaga w kolorach niebieskim i żółtym, przypominającym niebo i słońce. Reprezentuje Ukrainę.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Flaga Białorusi Flaga Białorusi ma poziome, czerwone i zielone pasy z pięknymi, tradycyjnymi wzorami po bokach. Białoruś jest sąsiadem Polski.

Flaga Litwy Flaga ma poziome pasy w kolorze żółtym, zielonym i czerwonym. Litwa to kraj bałtycki z pięknymi lasami i plażami.

Flaga Rosji Flaga z białymi, niebieskimi i czerwonymi paskami. Reprezentuje Rosję.

docs.title: Découvrir Varsovie (pl_01) - Script
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

docs.title: quest_start
docs.text:
// pl_01 | Warsaw
// 
// WANTED:
// Cards:
// - MermaidOfWarsaw (cultural symbol)
// - warsaw_chopin_monument (musical heritage)
// - FryderykChopin (historical figure)
// - warsaw_wars_statue (legendary figure)
// - WarsAndSawa (city legend)
// - warsaw_wisla_river (geographical feature)
// - RiverWisla (major river)
// - KingSigismund (historical figure)
// - warsaw_sejm (government building)
// - President (political figure)
// - warsaw_palace_culture (cultural landmark)
// - MariaCurie (scientific figure)
// - MoneyZloty (currency education)
// - warsaw_national_stadium (sports venue)
//
// Tasks:
// - Return Mermaid's sword after parliament visit
// - Help Wars find Sawa by the river
// - Find King Sigismund's crown
// - Follow Maria Curie's coin trail
//
// Activities:
// - piano chopin_melody (musical activity)
// - quiz polish_flag_colors (civic education)
// - quiz warsaw_basics (comprehensive review)
//
// Words used: TRANSPORT (TRAIN, TRAM, BUS, CAR, BIKE), SPORT (FOOTBALL, BALL, GOAL, FIELD), FLAG, ZŁOTY, MERMAID OF WARSAW, CHOPIN, WARS & SAWA, KING SIGISMUND, PRESIDENT/SEJM, PALACE OF CULTURE AND SCIENCE, MARIA SKŁODOWSKA-CURIE, NATIONAL STADIUM, COPERNICUS
color: red
type: panel
---
<<set $TOTAL_COINS = 0>>
<<set $COLLECTED_ITEMS = 0>>
Bienvenue à VARSOVIE, la capitale de la POLOGNE. #line:0b126ba

docs.title: quest_end
docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel_endgame
---
Super ! Vous avez exploré Varsovie. #line:0f168cb 
<<card warsaw_mermaid_plaza>>
Vous avez rencontré la Sirène, Wars et Sawa. #line:07b58db 
<<card warsaw_chopin_monument>>
Vous avez entendu parler de Chopin et de Maria Skłodowska-Curie. #line:0421ca8 
<<card warsaw_palace_culture>>
Vous avez visité le Parlement et le Palais de la Culture. #line:06ad318 
<<card warsaw_wisla_river>>
Vous avez vu la rivière, le stade et une haute colonne. #line:07661f8 
Vous avez appris les couleurs des drapeaux et quelques mots liés aux transports. #line:03f7300 
Varsovie mélange histoire, science, musique et sport. #line:063523b 
<<jump post_quest_activity>>

docs.title: post_quest_activity
docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel
tags: proposal
---
Dessinez le drapeau polonais, blanc en haut, rouge en bas. #line:0a4ef13 
Indiquez Varsovie sur une carte de la Pologne. #line:056b063 
<<quest_end>>

docs.title: GUIDE_INTRO
docs.text:
tags: actor=Guide
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_city_gate>>
Antura a couru à travers la ville et a fait des dégâts. #line:0f4026d 
Pouvez-vous nous aider à réparer les choses ? #line:0e40172 
Commencez par la Sirène de Varsovie au bord de la rivière. #line:0303973

docs.title: MERMAID_SQUARE
docs.text:
tags: actor=Mermaid
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_mermaid_plaza>>
Bonjour. Je suis la sirène de Varsovie. #line:048b274 
Antura a pris mon épée pendant que j'essayais de l'arrêter. #line:03284c1 
S'il vous plaît, trouvez-le et aidez d'autres endroits sur sa piste. #line:0b37c7e 
Savez-vous comment les gens se déplacent à Varsovie ? #line:014ebd5 
Vous pouvez prendre un tramway, un bus ou un train. #line:0f69ca8 
Vous pouvez également y aller en voiture ou en vélo. #line:01b35cc 
J'ai vu Antura près du monument Chopin. #line:016885a 
Suivez la musique. #line:00591a8

docs.title: CHOPIN_MONUMENT
docs.text:
tags: actor=Chopin
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_chopin_monument>>
Bonjour. Je suis Fryderyk Chopin. #line:05e23dd 
Mes notes de musique se sont envolées. #line:0c2dc21 
S'il vous plaît, recréez la mélodie. #line:0cd9161 
<<activity piano chopin_melody tutorial>>
Magnifique. Merci. #line:0588964 
J'ai écrit de nombreuses pièces pour piano. #line:02f0cb6 
J'ai vu Antura courir vers Copernic. #line:0d0dfb2 
Continue. La sirène a besoin de récupérer son épée. #line:0f18f1a

docs.title: WARS_AND_SAWA
docs.text:
tags: actor=Wars
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_wars_statue>>
Tu as vu Sawa ? On s'est séparés. #line:0f91d02 
Antura a semé le trouble. Sawa a couru vers la rivière. #line:0d21844 
S'il vous plaît, ramenez-la. #line:0fac801

docs.title: SAWA_BY_WISLA
docs.text:
tags: actor=Sawa
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_wisla_river>>
Bonjour, je suis près de la rivière Wisła. #line:057d461 
La Vistule est le plus long fleuve de Pologne. #line:0345857 
Revenons aux guerres. #line:071d7d4

docs.title: WARS_SAWA_LEGEND
docs.text:
tags: actor=Wars
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_wars_sawa_back>>
Merci. Nous sommes à nouveau ensemble. #line:099f978 
Nous sommes Wars et Sawa. C'est une légende de Varsovie. #line:012d571 
Trouvez ensuite la colonne du roi Sigismond. #line:023e2de

docs.title: SIGISMUND_COLUMN
docs.text:
tags: actor=King_Sigismund
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_sigismund_column>>
Salutations. Je suis le roi Sigismond. #line:0735d68 
Ma couronne est tombée quand Antura est passée en courant ! #line:06acced 
Il devrait être à proximité. Veuillez le trouver. #line:0a6c3f8 
// Task hint
// task=find_crown, action=HighlightCrown could be handled by scene logic if needed
Bravo. Ma couronne est de retour. #line:0853f81 
Va au Parlement. L'épée de la Sirène s'y trouve. #line:0fe293d

docs.title: PRESIDENT_PARLIAMENT
docs.text:
tags: actor=President
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_sejm>>
Bienvenue au Parlement polonais. #line:049ead5 
Je travaille également au Palais présidentiel. #line:0bd4bf9 
J'ai l'épée de la sirène. #line:0a0d570 
Mais d’abord, aidez-moi à réparer le drapeau polonais. #line:08e2833 
Choisissez les bonnes couleurs. #line:0b6a50a 
<<activity quiz polish_flag_colors tutorial>>
Merci. Le drapeau est blanc et rouge. #line:0c1be80 
Nous célébrons également le 3 mai, jour de la Constitution. #line:0691d35 
Voici l'épée de la sirène. Veuillez la rapporter. #line:09a7cf5

docs.title: MERMAID_RETURN
docs.text:
tags: actor=Mermaid
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_mermaid_sword>>
Tu as trouvé mon épée. Merci. #line:0098677 
Je suis un symbole de Varsovie. #line:02279a9 
Antura a également atteint le Palais de la Culture et de la Science. #line:03d0b7a 
Veuillez le vérifier. #line:0c28f2d

docs.title: PALACE_CULTURE_MARIA
docs.text:
tags: actor=Maria_Curie
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_palace_culture>>
Bonjour. Je m'appelle Maria Skłodowska‑Curie. #line:0d43ca0 
C'est le Palais de la Culture et de la Science. #line:02b3d6b 
Antura a égaré mon portefeuille. #line:0666af3 
Suivez la trace des pièces. Notre monnaie est le złoty. #line:00a545d 
<<activity order curie_coin_trail tutorial>>
Vous l'avez trouvé. Merci. #line:0585b5a 
J'ai entendu du bruit au stade national. #line:0762923

docs.title: NATIONAL_STADIUM
docs.text:
tags: actor=Robert_Lewandowski
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_national_stadium>>
C'est le stade national. #line:0bb0aa5 
Pouvez-vous marquer 5 buts ? #line:09126e5 
<<activity order score_5_goals tutorial>>
Superbes clichés ! #line:0c55643 
Mots sportifs : football, ballon, but, terrain. #line:06ef367 
Les gens chantent notre hymne national ici. #line:0b65eb8 
Le jour de l’indépendance est le 11 novembre. #line:09c2e0c

docs.title: GUIDE_OUTRO
docs.text:
tags: actor=Guide
type: panel
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_city_sunset>>
Vous avez aidé la ville. Antura a quitté Varsovie. #line:0afa91b 
La Sirène, Chopin et leurs amis disent merci. #line:0be619e 
Continuez à explorer la Pologne ! #line:0aeb8fb

docs.title: FINAL_QUIZ
docs.text:
tags: actor= Narrator
type: quiz
group: Quiz
---
<<card warsaw_quiz>>
Questions finales. #line:01faf50 
// Q1: How does the POLISH FLAG look? (image choices handled in activity content)
// Q2: Match picture with words (TRANSPORT/SPORT vocabulary)
<<activity quiz warsaw_basics tutorial>>
Bien joué! #line:08f99a0 
<<jump quest_end>>

docs.title: FACTS_TRANSPORT
docs.text:
// FACT NODES
color: purple
actor: Guide
group: Warsaw
---
<<card tram>>
Les tramways et les bus aident les gens à se déplacer. #line:07888ab 
<<card bus>>
<<card bike>>
Vous pouvez également faire du vélo. #line:0a01a9a

docs.title: FACTS_HISTORY
docs.text:
color: purple
actor: Guide
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_sigismund_column>>
La colonne du roi Sigismond est un symbole de la ville. #line:0507774 
<<card constitution_of_3_may>>
Le 3 mai est un jour spécial. #line:0d4bfcd

docs.title: FACTS_SCIENCE
docs.text:
color: purple
actor: Guide
group: Warsaw
---
<<card maria_skodowskacurie>>
Maria a étudié les sciences et a remporté des prix. #line:072ab93 
<<card nicolaus_copernicus_monument_warsaw>>
Copernic a étudié le ciel. #line:057e76e

docs.title: FACTS_SYMBOLS
docs.text:
color: purple
actor: Guide
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_mermaid_plaza>>
La sirène protège la ville. #line:014ff09 
<<card warsaw_wisla_river>>
La rivière Vistule traverse Varsovie. #line:057e3a3 
<<card warsaw_palace_culture>>
Ce grand bâtiment abrite des musées. #line:034f607

docs.title: spawned_warsaw_local
docs.text:
///////// NPCs SPAWNED IN THE SCENE //////////
// these npc are spawn automatically in the scene
// use these to add random facts. everythime you meet them
// they will say one of these lines randomly
color: purple
actor: WOMAN
spawn_group: warsaw_locals
---
Varsovie a la rivière Vistule. #line:004922a 
Le drapeau est blanc et rouge. #line:01536e4 
J'aime prendre le tram. #line:028722e 
Le Palais de la Culture est très haut. #line:06fa7a6

docs.title: spawned_warsaw_guide
docs.text:
color: purple
actor: MAN
spawn_group: warsaw_guides
---
Chopin a écrit de la musique pour piano. #line:0016e94 
Maria Curie a étudié les sciences. #line:0c899ce 
Le roi Sigismond se tient sur une colonne. #line:0582b47 
La sirène figure sur les armoiries. #line:0a5a892

docs.title: spawned_warsaw_student
docs.text:
color: purple
actor: KID_F
spawn_group: warsaw_students
---
J'apprends l'histoire de Copernic à l'école. #line:08a617b 
Nous jouons au football au stade. #line:0eeafaf 
Le jour de l'indépendance est en novembre. #line:0f85b89 
Je peux nommer toutes les couleurs de tramway ! #line:05fa279
