docs.title: post_quest_activity
docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel
tags: proposal
---
Disegna la bandiera polacca, bianca in alto e rossa in basso. #line:0a4ef13 
Indica Varsavia su una mappa della Polonia. #line:056b063 
<<quest_end>>

docs.title: GUIDE_INTRO
docs.text:
tags: actor=Guide
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_city_gate>>
Antura corse attraverso la città e combinò un gran pasticcio. #line:0f4026d 
Puoi aiutarci a sistemare le cose? #line:0e40172 
Si inizia con la Sirena di Varsavia sul fiume. #line:0303973

docs.title: MERMAID_SQUARE
docs.text:
tags: actor=Mermaid
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_mermaid_plaza>>
Ciao. Sono la Sirena di Varsavia. #line:048b274 
Antura mi prese la spada mentre cercavo di fermarlo. #line:03284c1 
Per favore, trovatelo e aiutate gli altri luoghi sulle sue tracce. #line:0b37c7e 
Sai come si muovono le persone a Varsavia? #line:014ebd5 
Puoi prendere un tram, un autobus o un treno. #line:0f69ca8 
È possibile spostarsi anche in auto o in bicicletta. #line:01b35cc 
Ho visto Antura vicino al monumento a Chopin. #line:016885a 
Segui la musica. #line:00591a8

docs.title: CHOPIN_MONUMENT
docs.text:
tags: actor=Chopin
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_chopin_monument>>
Ciao. Sono Fryderyk Chopin. #line:05e23dd 
Le mie note musicali volarono via. #line:0c2dc21 
Per favore, ricrea la melodia. #line:0cd9161 
<<activity piano chopin_melody tutorial>>
Bellissimo. Grazie. #line:0588964 
Ho scritto molti pezzi per pianoforte. #line:02f0cb6 
Ho visto Antura correre verso Copernico. #line:0d0dfb2 
Continua. La Sirena ha bisogno della sua spada. #line:0f18f1a

docs.title: WARS_AND_SAWA
docs.text:
tags: actor=Wars
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_wars_statue>>
Hai visto Sawa? Ci siamo separati. #line:0f91d02 
Antura creò problemi. Sawa corse verso il fiume. #line:0d21844 
Per favore, riportatela indietro. #line:0fac801

docs.title: SAWA_BY_WISLA
docs.text:
tags: actor=Sawa
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_wisla_river>>
Ciao. Mi trovo vicino al fiume Vistola. #line:057d461 
La Vistola è il fiume più lungo della Polonia. #line:0345857 
Torniamo a Wars. #line:071d7d4

docs.title: WARS_SAWA_LEGEND
docs.text:
tags: actor=Wars
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_wars_sawa_back>>
Grazie. Siamo di nuovo insieme. #line:099f978 
Siamo Wars e Sawa. Questa è una leggenda di Varsavia. #line:012d571 
Di seguito troverete la colonna di Re Sigismondo. #line:023e2de

docs.title: SIGISMUND_COLUMN
docs.text:
tags: actor=King_Sigismund
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_sigismund_column>>
Saluti. Sono Re Sigismondo. #line:0735d68 
La mia corona è caduta quando Antura mi è passata di corsa! #line:06acced 
Dovrebbe essere qui vicino. Per favore, trovalo. #line:0a6c3f8 
// Task hint
// task=find_crown, action=HighlightCrown could be handled by scene logic if needed
Ben fatto. La mia corona è tornata. #line:0853f81 
Vai al Parlamento. La spada della Sirena è lì. #line:0fe293d

docs.title: PRESIDENT_PARLIAMENT
docs.text:
tags: actor=President
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_sejm>>
Benvenuti al Parlamento polacco. #line:049ead5 
Lavoro anche al Palazzo Presidenziale. #line:0bd4bf9 
Ho la spada della Sirena. #line:0a0d570 
Ma prima aiutami a sistemare la bandiera polacca. #line:08e2833 
Scegli i colori corretti. #line:0b6a50a 
<<activity quiz polish_flag_colors tutorial>>
Grazie. La bandiera è bianca e rossa. #line:0c1be80 
Celebriamo anche il 3 maggio, Giorno della Costituzione. #line:0691d35 
Ecco la spada della Sirena. Per favore, restituiscila. #line:09a7cf5

docs.title: MERMAID_RETURN
docs.text:
tags: actor=Mermaid
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_mermaid_sword>>
Hai trovato la mia spada. Grazie. #line:0098677 
Sono un simbolo di Varsavia. #line:02279a9 
Antura raggiunse anche il Palazzo della Cultura e della Scienza. #line:03d0b7a 
Per favore, controllalo. #line:0c28f2d

docs.title: PALACE_CULTURE_MARIA
docs.text:
tags: actor=Maria_Curie
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_palace_culture>>
Ciao. Sono Maria Skłodowska‑Curie. #line:0d43ca0 
Questo è il Palazzo della Cultura e della Scienza. #line:02b3d6b 
Antura ha smarrito il mio portafoglio. #line:0666af3 
Segui il percorso delle monete. La nostra valuta è lo złoty. #line:00a545d 
<<activity order curie_coin_trail tutorial>>
L'hai trovato. Grazie. #line:0585b5a 
Ho sentito del rumore allo Stadio Nazionale. #line:0762923

docs.title: NATIONAL_STADIUM
docs.text:
tags: actor=Robert_Lewandowski
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_national_stadium>>
Questo è lo Stadio Nazionale. #line:0bb0aa5 
Riesci a segnare 5 gol? #line:09126e5 
<<activity order score_5_goals tutorial>>
Ottimi scatti! #line:0c55643 
Parole sportive: calcio, palla, porta, campo. #line:06ef367 
Qui la gente canta il nostro inno nazionale. #line:0b65eb8 
Il giorno dell'Indipendenza è l'11 novembre. #line:09c2e0c

docs.title: GUIDE_OUTRO
docs.text:
tags: actor=Guide
type: panel
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_city_sunset>>
Hai aiutato la città. Antura ha lasciato Varsavia. #line:0afa91b 
La Sirena, Chopin e gli amici ringraziano. #line:0be619e 
Continua ad esplorare la Polonia! #line:0aeb8fb

docs.title: FINAL_QUIZ
docs.text:
tags: actor= Narrator
type: quiz
group: Quiz
---
<<card warsaw_quiz>>
Domande finali. #line:01faf50 
// Q1: How does the POLISH FLAG look? (image choices handled in activity content)
// Q2: Match picture with words (TRANSPORT/SPORT vocabulary)
<<activity quiz warsaw_basics tutorial>>
Ben fatto! #line:08f99a0 
<<jump quest_end>>

docs.title: FACTS_TRANSPORT
docs.text:
// FACT NODES
color: purple
actor: Guide
group: Warsaw
---
<<card tram>>
Tram e autobus aiutano le persone a spostarsi. #line:07888ab 
<<card bus>>
<<card bike>>
Si può anche andare in bicicletta. #line:0a01a9a

docs.title: FACTS_HISTORY
docs.text:
color: purple
actor: Guide
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_sigismund_column>>
La colonna di re Sigismondo è un simbolo della città. #line:0507774 
<<card constitution_of_3_may>>
Il 3 maggio è un giorno speciale. #line:0d4bfcd

docs.title: FACTS_SCIENCE
docs.text:
color: purple
actor: Guide
group: Warsaw
---
<<card maria_skodowskacurie>>
Maria ha studiato scienze e ha vinto dei premi. #line:072ab93 
<<card nicolaus_copernicus_monument_warsaw>>
Copernico studiò il cielo. #line:057e76e

docs.title: FACTS_SYMBOLS
docs.text:
color: purple
actor: Guide
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_mermaid_plaza>>
La Sirena protegge la città. #line:014ff09 
<<card warsaw_wisla_river>>
Il fiume Vistola attraversa Varsavia. #line:057e3a3 
<<card warsaw_palace_culture>>
Questo alto edificio ospita dei musei. #line:034f607

docs.title: spawned_warsaw_local
docs.text:
///////// NPCs SPAWNED IN THE SCENE //////////
// these npc are spawn automatically in the scene
// use these to add random facts. everythime you meet them
// they will say one of these lines randomly
color: purple
actor: WOMAN
spawn_group: warsaw_locals
---
Varsavia ha il fiume Vistola. #line:004922a 
La bandiera è bianca e rossa. #line:01536e4 
Mi piace prendere il tram. #line:028722e 
Il Palazzo della Cultura è molto alto. #line:06fa7a6

docs.title: spawned_warsaw_guide
docs.text:
color: purple
actor: MAN
spawn_group: warsaw_guides
---
Chopin scrisse musica per pianoforte. #line:0016e94 
Maria Curie studiò scienze. #line:0c899ce 
Re Sigismondo è in piedi su una colonna. #line:0582b47 
La sirena è raffigurata sullo stemma. #line:0a5a892

docs.title: spawned_warsaw_student
docs.text:
color: purple
actor: KID_F
spawn_group: warsaw_students
---
Ho imparato a conoscere Copernico a scuola. #line:08a617b 
Giochiamo a calcio allo stadio. #line:0eeafaf 
Il giorno dell'Indipendenza cade a novembre. #line:0f85b89 
So nominare tutti i colori dei tram! #line:05fa279

docs.title: Discover Warszawa (pl_01) - Script
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

docs.title: quest_start
docs.text:
// pl_01 | Warsaw
// 
// WANTED:
// Cards:
// - MermaidOfWarsaw (cultural symbol)
// - warsaw_chopin_monument (musical heritage)
// - FryderykChopin (historical figure)
// - warsaw_wars_statue (legendary figure)
// - WarsAndSawa (city legend)
// - warsaw_wisla_river (geographical feature)
// - RiverWisla (major river)
// - KingSigismund (historical figure)
// - warsaw_sejm (government building)
// - President (political figure)
// - warsaw_palace_culture (cultural landmark)
// - MariaCurie (scientific figure)
// - MoneyZloty (currency education)
// - warsaw_national_stadium (sports venue)
//
// Tasks:
// - Return Mermaid's sword after parliament visit
// - Help Wars find Sawa by the river
// - Find King Sigismund's crown
// - Follow Maria Curie's coin trail
//
// Activities:
// - piano chopin_melody (musical activity)
// - quiz polish_flag_colors (civic education)
// - quiz warsaw_basics (comprehensive review)
//
// Words used: TRANSPORT (TRAIN, TRAM, BUS, CAR, BIKE), SPORT (FOOTBALL, BALL, GOAL, FIELD), FLAG, ZŁOTY, MERMAID OF WARSAW, CHOPIN, WARS & SAWA, KING SIGISMUND, PRESIDENT/SEJM, PALACE OF CULTURE AND SCIENCE, MARIA SKŁODOWSKA-CURIE, NATIONAL STADIUM, COPERNICUS
color: red
type: panel
---
<<set $TOTAL_COINS = 0>>
<<set $COLLECTED_ITEMS = 0>>
Welcome to WARSAW, the capital of POLAND. #line:0b126ba

docs.title: quest_end
docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel_endgame
---
Great! You explored Warsaw. #line:0f168cb 
<<card warsaw_mermaid_plaza>>
You met the Mermaid, Wars and Sawa. #line:07b58db 
<<card warsaw_chopin_monument>>
You heard about Chopin and Maria Skłodowska‑Curie. #line:0421ca8 
<<card warsaw_palace_culture>>
You visited the Parliament and the Palace of Culture. #line:06ad318 
<<card warsaw_wisla_river>>
You saw the river, the stadium, and a tall column. #line:07661f8 
You learned flag colors and some transport words. #line:03f7300 
Warsaw mixes history, science, music, and sport. #line:063523b 
<<jump post_quest_activity>>

docs.title: post_quest_activity
docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel
tags: proposal
---
Draw the Polish flag, white on top, red below. #line:0a4ef13 
Point to Warsaw on a map of Poland. #line:056b063 
<<quest_end>>

docs.title: GUIDE_INTRO
docs.text:
tags: actor=Guide
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_city_gate>>
Antura ran through the city and made a mess. #line:0f4026d 
Can you help us fix things? #line:0e40172 
Start with the Mermaid of Warsaw by the river. #line:0303973

docs.title: MERMAID_SQUARE
docs.text:
tags: actor=Mermaid
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_mermaid_plaza>>
Hello. I am the Mermaid of Warsaw. #line:048b274 
Antura took my sword while I tried to stop him. #line:03284c1 
Please find it and help other places on his trail. #line:0b37c7e 
Do you know how people move in Warsaw? #line:014ebd5 
You can ride a tram, take a bus, or a train. #line:0f69ca8 
You can also go by car or bike. #line:01b35cc 
I saw Antura near the Chopin Monument. #line:016885a 
Follow the music. #line:00591a8

docs.title: CHOPIN_MONUMENT
docs.text:
tags: actor=Chopin
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_chopin_monument>>
Hello. I am Fryderyk Chopin. #line:05e23dd 
My music notes flew away. #line:0c2dc21 
Please recreate the melody. #line:0cd9161 
<<activity piano chopin_melody tutorial>>
Beautiful. Thank you. #line:0588964 
I wrote many pieces for piano. #line:02f0cb6 
I saw Antura run toward Copernicus. #line:0d0dfb2 
Keep going. The Mermaid needs her sword back. #line:0f18f1a

docs.title: WARS_AND_SAWA
docs.text:
tags: actor=Wars
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_wars_statue>>
Have you seen Sawa? We got separated. #line:0f91d02 
Antura caused trouble. Sawa ran toward the river. #line:0d21844 
Please bring her back. #line:0fac801

docs.title: SAWA_BY_WISLA
docs.text:
tags: actor=Sawa
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_wisla_river>>
Hello. I am by the Wisła River. #line:057d461 
The Wisła is the longest river in Poland. #line:0345857 
Let’s go back to Wars. #line:071d7d4

docs.title: WARS_SAWA_LEGEND
docs.text:
tags: actor=Wars
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_wars_sawa_back>>
Thank you. We are together again. #line:099f978 
We are Wars and Sawa. This is a Warsaw legend. #line:012d571 
Find King Sigismund’s column next. #line:023e2de

docs.title: SIGISMUND_COLUMN
docs.text:
tags: actor=King_Sigismund
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_sigismund_column>>
Greetings. I am King Sigismund. #line:0735d68 
My crown fell when Antura ran past! #line:06acced 
It should be nearby. Please find it. #line:0a6c3f8 
// Task hint
// task=find_crown, action=HighlightCrown could be handled by scene logic if needed
Well done. My crown is back. #line:0853f81 
Go to the Parliament. The Mermaid’s sword is there. #line:0fe293d

docs.title: PRESIDENT_PARLIAMENT
docs.text:
tags: actor=President
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_sejm>>
Welcome to the Polish Houses of Parliament. #line:049ead5 
I also work at the Presidential Palace. #line:0bd4bf9 
I have the Mermaid’s sword. #line:0a0d570 
But first, help me fix the Polish flag. #line:08e2833 
Choose the correct colors. #line:0b6a50a 
<<activity quiz polish_flag_colors tutorial>>
Thank you. The flag is white and red. #line:0c1be80 
We also celebrate the 3 May Constitution Day. #line:0691d35 
Here is the Mermaid’s sword. Please return it. #line:09a7cf5

docs.title: MERMAID_RETURN
docs.text:
tags: actor=Mermaid
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_mermaid_sword>>
You found my sword. Thank you. #line:0098677 
I am a symbol of Warsaw. #line:02279a9 
Antura also reached the Palace of Culture and Science. #line:03d0b7a 
Please check it. #line:0c28f2d

docs.title: PALACE_CULTURE_MARIA
docs.text:
tags: actor=Maria_Curie
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_palace_culture>>
Hello. I am Maria Skłodowska‑Curie. #line:0d43ca0 
This is the Palace of Culture and Science. #line:02b3d6b 
Antura misplaced my wallet. #line:0666af3 
Follow the coin trail. Our currency is the złoty. #line:00a545d 
<<activity order curie_coin_trail tutorial>>
You found it. Thank you. #line:0585b5a 
I heard noise at the National Stadium. #line:0762923

docs.title: NATIONAL_STADIUM
docs.text:
tags: actor=Robert_Lewandowski
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_national_stadium>>
This is the National Stadium. #line:0bb0aa5 
Can you score 5 goals? #line:09126e5 
<<activity order score_5_goals tutorial>>
Great shots! #line:0c55643 
Sport words: football, ball, goal, field. #line:06ef367 
People sing our national anthem here. #line:0b65eb8 
Independence Day is on 11 November. #line:09c2e0c

docs.title: GUIDE_OUTRO
docs.text:
tags: actor=Guide
type: panel
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_city_sunset>>
You helped the city. Antura left Warsaw. #line:0afa91b 
The Mermaid, Chopin, and friends say thank you. #line:0be619e 
Keep exploring Poland! #line:0aeb8fb

docs.title: FINAL_QUIZ
docs.text:
tags: actor= Narrator
type: quiz
group: Quiz
---
<<card warsaw_quiz>>
Final questions. #line:01faf50 
// Q1: How does the POLISH FLAG look? (image choices handled in activity content)
// Q2: Match picture with words (TRANSPORT/SPORT vocabulary)
<<activity quiz warsaw_basics tutorial>>
Well done! #line:08f99a0 
<<jump quest_end>>

docs.title: FACTS_TRANSPORT
docs.text:
// FACT NODES
color: purple
actor: Guide
group: Warsaw
---
<<card tram>>
Trams and buses help people move. #line:07888ab 
<<card bus>>
<<card bike>>
You can also ride a bike. #line:0a01a9a

docs.title: FACTS_HISTORY
docs.text:
color: purple
actor: Guide
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_sigismund_column>>
King Sigismund’s column is a city symbol. #line:0507774 
<<card constitution_of_3_may>>
May 3 is a special day. #line:0d4bfcd

docs.title: FACTS_SCIENCE
docs.text:
color: purple
actor: Guide
group: Warsaw
---
<<card maria_skodowskacurie>>
Maria studied science and won prizes. #line:072ab93 
<<card nicolaus_copernicus_monument_warsaw>>
Copernicus studied the sky. #line:057e76e

docs.title: FACTS_SYMBOLS
docs.text:
color: purple
actor: Guide
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_mermaid_plaza>>
The Mermaid protects the city. #line:014ff09 
<<card warsaw_wisla_river>>
The Wisła River crosses Warsaw. #line:057e3a3 
<<card warsaw_palace_culture>>
This tall building has museums. #line:034f607

docs.title: spawned_warsaw_local
docs.text:
///////// NPCs SPAWNED IN THE SCENE //////////
// these npc are spawn automatically in the scene
// use these to add random facts. everythime you meet them
// they will say one of these lines randomly
color: purple
actor: WOMAN
spawn_group: warsaw_locals
---
Warsaw has the Wisła River. #line:004922a 
The flag is white and red. #line:01536e4 
I like to ride the tram. #line:028722e 
The Palace of Culture is very tall. #line:06fa7a6

docs.title: spawned_warsaw_guide
docs.text:
color: purple
actor: MAN
spawn_group: warsaw_guides
---
Chopin wrote piano music. #line:0016e94 
Maria Curie studied science. #line:0c899ce 
King Sigismund stands on a column. #line:0582b47 
The Mermaid is on the coat of arms. #line:0a5a892

docs.title: spawned_warsaw_student
docs.text:
color: purple
actor: KID_F
spawn_group: warsaw_students
---
I learn about Copernicus in school. #line:08a617b 
We play football at the stadium. #line:0eeafaf 
Independence Day is in November. #line:0f85b89 
I can name all tram colors! #line:05fa279

docs.title: quest_end
docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel_endgame
---
Świetnie! Zwiedziłeś Warszawę. #line:0f168cb 
<<card warsaw_mermaid_plaza>>
Poznałeś Syrenę, Warsa i Sawę. #line:07b58db 
<<card warsaw_chopin_monument>>
Słyszeliście o Chopinie i Marii Skłodowskiej‑Curie. #line:0421ca8 
<<card warsaw_palace_culture>>
Odwiedził Pan Parlament i Pałac Kultury. #line:06ad318 
<<card warsaw_wisla_river>>
Widziałeś rzekę, stadion i wysoką kolumnę. #line:07661f8 
Nauczyłeś się kolorów flag i kilku słów związanych z transportem. #line:03f7300 
Warszawa łączy w sobie historię, naukę, muzykę i sport. #line:063523b 
<<jump post_quest_activity>>

docs.title: post_quest_activity
docs.text:
color: green
panel: panel
tags: proposal
---
Narysuj polską flagę, białą na górze, czerwoną na dole. #line:0a4ef13 
Wskaż Warszawę na mapie Polski. #line:056b063 
<<quest_end>>

docs.title: GUIDE_INTRO
docs.text:
tags: actor=Guide
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_city_gate>>
Antura przebiegł przez miasto i narobił zamieszania. #line:0f4026d 
Czy możesz nam pomóc to naprawić? #line:0e40172 
Zacznij od Syrenki Warszawskiej nad rzeką. #line:0303973

docs.title: MERMAID_SQUARE
docs.text:
tags: actor=Mermaid
group: Warsaw
---
<<card warsaw_mermaid_plaza>>
Cześć. Jestem Syrenką Warszawską. #line:048b274 
Antura zabrał mi miecz, gdy próbowałem go powstrzymać. #line:03284c1 
Proszę go odnaleźć i pomóc innym osobom na jego tropie. #line:0b37c7e 
Czy wiesz, jak poruszają się ludzie w Warszawie? #line:014ebd5 
Możesz pojechać tramwajem, autobusem lub pociągiem. #line:0f69ca8

docs.title: Découvrir Varsovie (pl_01)
docs.text:

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: Poland - Varsovie

Explorez la capitale polonaise pour réparer le chaos laissé par Antura

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x5)
  • Music (x3)
  • History (x2)
  • Community (x1)

docs.title: Warsaw
docs.text:
• Monument Chopin Une grande statue du parc Łazienki de Varsovie est dédiée à Frédéric Chopin. C'est également le lieu de concerts de piano en plein air très populaires en été. (L'arbre sous lequel il est assis est un saule polonais typique.)
  • Sirène de Varsovie Le symbole de la ville est une sirène courageuse armée d'une épée et d'un bouclier. Sa statue est visible au bord de la rivière.
  • Guerres et Sawa Deux personnages légendaires ont donné son nom à Varsovie. Wars était un guerrier courageux et Sawa était une belle sirène vivant dans la Vistule.
  • Frédéric Chopin Célèbre compositeur polonais pour piano, il a composé une musique magnifique qui évoque la danse ou les histoires. Sa musique rend les gens heureux ou tristes.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Balle Un objet rond utilisé dans de nombreux jeux.

Vélo Un véhicule à deux roues sur lequel on pédale.

Bus Un gros véhicule qui transporte de nombreuses personnes.

Voiture Un petit véhicule pour les routes.

Constitution du 3 mai Une constitution polonaise historique célébrée le 3 mai.

Football (soccer) Un jeu d'équipe joué avec un ballon que vous frappez.

But Le filet dans lequel vous essayez de marquer.

Jour de l'Indépendance (Pologne) Un jour férié national le 11 novembre.

La colonne du roi Sigismond Une haute colonne honorant le roi Sigismond sur la place du château.

La couronne du roi Sigismond La couronne du roi qui est tombée et qui doit être retrouvée.

Maria Curie Une brillante scientifique polonaise qui a découvert la radioactivité. Elle a été la première femme à recevoir un prix Nobel, et ce, à deux reprises !

Maria Skłodowska-Curie Un scientifique qui a remporté deux prix Nobel.

Mazurek Dąbrowskiego L'hymne national de la Pologne.

L'épée de la sirène L'épée de la sirène qui doit être rendue.

Stade national (Varsovie) Un stade moderne pour les matchs de football et les concerts.

Monument Nicolas Copernic (Varsovie) Un monument à l'astronome Nicolas Copernic.

Palais de la culture et de la science Un grand bâtiment pour les musées, les théâtres et l'apprentissage.

Le roi Sigismond III Roi de Pologne, il fit construire de nombreux et magnifiques édifices à Varsovie. Sa statue se dresse sur une haute colonne au centre-ville.

Nain polonais (gnomes de Wrocław) De petites statues de nains se cachent un peu partout à Wrocław. Les trouver est un jeu de ville amusant.

Chambres du Parlement polonais Là où les lois sont faites : la Diète et le Sénat.

Palais présidentiel La résidence officielle du président de la Pologne.

Robert Lewandowski Un célèbre joueur de football polonais.

Château Royal (Varsovie) Un château historique des rois polonais, aujourd'hui un musée.

terrain de football Le terrain en herbe où se joue le football.

Tram Un train urbain qui circule sur des rails dans la rue.

Statue des Guerres et de Sawa Une statue représentant la légende de la ville sur les guerres et Sawa.

Pièces de złoty Monnaie polonaise (złoty) représentée sous forme de pièces de monnaie.

docs.title: Game Design Notes
docs.text: Complete Warsaw exploration following Antura through capital landmarks. Meet Mermaid of Warsaw, experience Chopin's music, learn Wars & Sawa legend, visit parliament, encounter Maria Curie at Palace of Culture, and conclude at National Stadium with sports activities.

docs.title: Knowledge Content
docs.text:
Buildings:

  • Mermaid of Warsaw
  • Palace of Culture and Science
  • Royal Castle
  • Polish Houses of Parliament
  • National Stadium
  • Chopin Monument
  • King Sigismund’s Column
  • Wars and Sawa statue (and legend)
  • Nicolaus Copernicus Monument
  • Presidential Palace Polish flag, złoty The river Wisła

Music:

  • National anthem “Mazurek Dąbrowskiego”
  • a Chopin’s music piece or a polish folk song like “Czerwone Jabłuszko”/”Mam chusteczkę haftowaną”

Constitution of 3 May, Independence day Maria Curie-Skłodowska

Vocabulary: sport: football (soccer), ball, goal/gate, soccer field Transport: train, tram, bus, car, bike

docs.title: Flow
docs.text:
You are greeted in Warsaw, the capital of Poland by the Guide. He asks you for your help. It seems that Antura has been creating chaos since it arrived here and somebody needs to stop it and fix it. He points you in the direction of the Mermaid of Warsaw.

Mermaid of Warsaw You meet with the Mermaid of Warsaw, who is missing her sword. She tells you that she saw Antura disturb other monuments of Warsaw and tried to stop him but in the process he managed to take her sword away. She asks you to retrieve it, and help other monuments while you follow Antura’s trail. She points you to the Chopin Monument. She also asks you if you know how the transportation works in Warsaw and explains the vocabulary and types of transport.

Chopin Monument Once you find the Chopin Monument, you can see that it seems the music notes to his music piece are missing. To get them back, you have to recreate the melody. [Activity Piano] When you do, Chopin’s statue thanks you and tells you about himself. He also tells you that he saw Antura with the Mermaid’s sword going in the direction of Nicolaus Copernicus’ Monument. —-

Wars and Sawa statue Once you get there, you meet with Wars. Apparently Sawa seems to be missing and he is asking you to find her. Once you follow her trail, you can see her by the Wisła river. You learn about the river from Sawa and convince her to go back to Wars. She says they got separated during the chaos that Antura was creating. Once you go back with her, they tell you the legend about them and the origin of the city. They also say that you should head in the direction of King Sigismund’s Column.

King Sigismund’s Column When you go to King Sigismund’s Column, he greets you and introduces himself. He explains that he used to be a king of Poland and tells you about the Royal Castle, later mentioning that right now the country is governed by the Parliament. He asks you to find his missing crown [task] which has been knocked off his head while Antura was running by. It is not far from him. Once you complete the task, he tells you to go to the Sejm, since apparently that is where the Mermaid’s Sword has been left.

President and Houses of Parliament Once you go there, you meet the President who explains what the Polish Houses of Parliament are and tells you about the Presidential Palace. He says he has the Mermaid’s sword, but before you go to give it back to her, he asks you to help with a little thing. Apparently Antura stole the colours from the Polish flag and needs you to give them back. You then learn how the Polish flag looks and need to choose the correct colours for the flag. The President thanks you for your help. He wants to share some more facts with you and asks you if you know about the 3 May Constitution Day in Poland. He then explains what it means.

Mermaid of Warsaw You go back to the Mermaid of Warsaw and you give back her sword. She tells you, she is a symbol of Warsaw and tells you about herself. Then she says that she has heard Antura has also messed with a few other places. She points you to the Palace of Culture and Science.

Palace of Culture and Science and Maria Skłodowska-Curie Once you get there, you meet Maria Skłodowska-Curie. She explains that although she is not associated with this place, it is called The Palace of Culture and Science and she herself is connected to scientific fields. She explains its role today and tells a little bit about herself. She also asks you for a favor. Antura seems to have misplaced her wallet. She asks you to retrieve it and you need to follow the trail of coins that are polish złoty until you find it and bring it back. She thanks you and explains that in Poland this is the currency. She also says that she has heard some commotion at the National Stadium.

National Stadium and national anthem You go to the National Stadium, where you meet Robert Lewandowski. He tells you a little about the Stadium and you are challenged by him to score 5 goals (minigame) to cheer everybody up after Antura’s visit.

When you manage to do it, he explains to you some vocabulary associated with sport. The people at the stadium also sing the national anthem and Robert Lewandowski tells you about the Independence Day in Poland that takes place on the 11th of November. Then the Guide comes and he says that you have managed to clear the commotion that Antura left behind him. In the meantime Antura seems to have left the city.

Final Assessment Question 1: How does the polish flag look? (with a few pictures to choose from) Question 2: Math the picture with words (the vocabulary)

docs.title: Resources
docs.text:
Palace of Culture and Science A tall, historic skyscraper in Warsaw built in the 1950s as a gift from the Soviet Union. Today it houses theaters, museums, offices, and a viewing terrace.

Royal Castle The Royal Castle in Warsaw was once the official residence of Polish kings and is now a museum. It was rebuilt after World War II and features grand halls, royal paintings, and historic furniture.

Polish Houses of Parliament The main government buildings in Warsaw where Polish laws are debated and passed. The complex includes both chambers of Parliament: the Sejm and the Senate.

National Stadium A modern sports arena in Warsaw built for the 2012 UEFA European Championship. It hosts football matches, concerts, and public events.

Chopin Monument A large statue in Warsaw’s Łazienki Park dedicated to Frédéric Chopin, Poland’s most famous composer. It’s also the site of popular open-air piano concerts in summer. (the special tree he is sitting under is a typical polish.. Willow )

King Sigismund’s Column, A tall monument in Castle Square honoring the Polish king who moved the capital from Kraków to Warsaw. It’s one of the city’s oldest and most famous landmarks.

Wars and Siwa statue The statue is based on a local legend about a fisherman named Wars who lived by the Vistula River. One night, he discovered a mysterious mermaid named Sawa singing by the shore; they became friends, and the city that grew nearby was named after them — Warsawa, now Warsaw.

Mermaid of Warsaw The mermaid is a symbol of Warsaw and appears on the city’s coat of arms. A statue of her stands by the river, holding a sword and shield to protect the city.

Presidential Palace The Presidential Palace in Warsaw is the official residence of the President of Poland. It’s a historic building with elegant architecture, often used for important ceremonies and state events.

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: Poland - Varsavia

Esplora la capitale polacca per risolvere il caos lasciato da Antura

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x5)
  • Music (x3)
  • History (x2)
  • Community (x1)

docs.title: Warsaw
docs.text:
• Monumento a Chopin Una grande statua nel Parco Łazienki di Varsavia, dedicata a Frédéric Chopin. È anche sede di popolari concerti di pianoforte all'aperto in estate. (L'albero speciale sotto cui è seduto è un tipico salice polacco)

  • Sirena di Varsavia Il simbolo della città è una coraggiosa sirena con spada e scudo. La sua statua è visibile lungo il fiume.

  • Guerre e Sawa Due figure leggendarie che diedero il nome a Varsavia: Wars era un coraggioso guerriero e Sawa era una bellissima sirena che viveva nel fiume Vistola.
  • Fryderyk Chopin Un famoso compositore polacco per pianoforte. Ha scritto musica meravigliosa che sembra danzare o raccontare storie. La sua musica trasmette felicità o tristezza.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Palla Un oggetto rotondo utilizzato in molti giochi.

Bicicletta Un veicolo a due ruote su cui si pedala.

Autobus Un veicolo di grandi dimensioni che trasporta molte persone.

Auto Un piccolo veicolo per le strade.

Costituzione del 3 maggio Una storica costituzione polacca celebrata il 3 maggio.

Calcio Un gioco di squadra che si gioca calciando una palla.

Obiettivo La rete in cui si cerca di segnare.

Giorno dell'Indipendenza (Polonia) Festa nazionale l'11 novembre.

Colonna di Re Sigismondo Un'alta colonna in onore di Re Sigismondo nella Piazza del Castello.

Corona di Re Sigismondo La corona del re che è caduta e deve essere ritrovata.

Maria Curie Una brillante scienziata polacca che scoprì la radioattività. Fu la prima donna a vincere il Premio Nobel, e lo vinse due volte!

Maria Skłodowska-Curie Uno scienziato che ha vinto due premi Nobel.

Mazurek Dąbrowskiego Inno nazionale polacco.

Spada della sirena La spada della sirena che deve essere restituita.

Stadio Nazionale (Varsavia) Uno stadio moderno per partite di calcio e concerti.

Monumento a Nicola Copernico (Varsavia) Monumento all'astronomo Niccolò Copernico.

Palazzo della Cultura e della Scienza Un edificio alto per musei, teatri e centri di apprendimento.

Re Sigismondo III Re di Polonia, che costruì molti splendidi edifici a Varsavia. La sua statua si erge su un'alta colonna nel centro della città.

Nano polacco (gnomi di Breslavia) Piccole statue di nani si nascondono in giro per Breslavia. Trovarle è un divertente gioco cittadino.

Camere del Parlamento polacco Dove vengono fatte le leggi: il Sejm e il Senato.

Palazzo presidenziale La residenza ufficiale del Presidente della Polonia.

Roberto Lewandowski Un famoso calciatore polacco.

Castello Reale (Varsavia) Uno storico castello dei re polacchi, ora un museo.

Campo da calcio Il campo erboso dove si gioca a calcio.

Tram Un treno urbano che corre sui binari della strada.

Guerre e statua di Sawa Una statua che raffigura la leggenda della città su Wars e Sawa.

Monete Złoty Denaro polacco (złoty) raffigurato come monete.

She also asks you if you know how the transportation works in Warsaw and explains the vocabulary and types of transport.

Chopin Monument Once you find the Chopin Monument, you can see that it seems the music notes to his music piece are missing. To get them back, you have to recreate the melody. [Activity Piano] When you do, Chopin’s statue thanks you and tells you about himself. He also tells you that he saw Antura with the Mermaid’s sword going in the direction of Nicolaus Copernicus’ Monument. —-

Wars and Sawa statue Once you get there, you meet with Wars. Apparently Sawa seems to be missing and he is asking you to find her. Once you follow her trail, you can see her by the Wisła river. You learn about the river from Sawa and convince her to go back to Wars. She says they got separated during the chaos that Antura was creating. Once you go back with her, they tell you the legend about them and the origin of the city. They also say that you should head in the direction of King Sigismund’s Column.

King Sigismund’s Column When you go to King Sigismund’s Column, he greets you and introduces himself. He explains that he used to be a king of Poland and tells you about the Royal Castle, later mentioning that right now the country is governed by the Parliament. He asks you to find his missing crown [task] which has been knocked off his head while Antura was running by. It is not far from him. Once you complete the task, he tells you to go to the Sejm, since apparently that is where the Mermaid’s Sword has been left.

President and Houses of Parliament Once you go there, you meet the President who explains what the Polish Houses of Parliament are and tells you about the Presidential Palace. He says he has the Mermaid’s sword, but before you go to give it back to her, he asks you to help with a little thing. Apparently Antura stole the colours from the Polish flag and needs you to give them back. You then learn how the Polish flag looks and need to choose the correct colours for the flag. The President thanks you for your help. He wants to share some more facts with you and asks you if you know about the 3 May Constitution Day in Poland. He then explains what it means.

Mermaid of Warsaw You go back to the Mermaid of Warsaw and you give back her sword. She tells you, she is a symbol of Warsaw and tells you about herself. Then she says that she has heard Antura has also messed with a few other places. She points you to the Palace of Culture and Science.

Palace of Culture and Science and Maria Skłodowska-Curie Once you get there, you meet Maria Skłodowska-Curie. She explains that although she is not associated with this place, it is called The Palace of Culture and Science and she herself is connected to scientific fields. She explains its role today and tells a little bit about herself. She also asks you for a favor. Antura seems to have misplaced her wallet. She asks you to retrieve it and you need to follow the trail of coins that are polish złoty until you find it and bring it back. She thanks you and explains that in Poland this is the currency. She also says that she has heard some commotion at the National Stadium.

National Stadium and national anthem You go to the National Stadium, where you meet Robert Lewandowski. He tells you a little about the Stadium and you are challenged by him to score 5 goals (minigame) to cheer everybody up after Antura’s visit.

When you manage to do it, he explains to you some vocabulary associated with sport. The people at the stadium also sing the national anthem and Robert Lewandowski tells you about the Independence Day in Poland that takes place on the 11th of November. Then the Guide comes and he says that you have managed to clear the commotion that Antura left behind him. In the meantime Antura seems to have left the city.

Final Assessment Question 1: How does the polish flag look? (with a few pictures to choose from) Question 2: Math the picture with words (the vocabulary)

docs.title: Resources
docs.text:
Palace of Culture and Science A tall, historic skyscraper in Warsaw built in the 1950s as a gift from the Soviet Union. Today it houses theaters, museums, offices, and a viewing terrace.

Royal Castle The Royal Castle in Warsaw was once the official residence of Polish kings and is now a museum. It was rebuilt after World War II and features grand halls, royal paintings, and historic furniture.

Polish Houses of Parliament The main government buildings in Warsaw where Polish laws are debated and passed. The complex includes both chambers of Parliament: the Sejm and the Senate.

National Stadium A modern sports arena in Warsaw built for the 2012 UEFA European Championship. It hosts football matches, concerts, and public events.

Chopin Monument A large statue in Warsaw’s Łazienki Park dedicated to Frédéric Chopin, Poland’s most famous composer. It’s also the site of popular open-air piano concerts in summer. (the special tree he is sitting under is a typical polish.. Willow )

King Sigismund’s Column, A tall monument in Castle Square honoring the Polish king who moved the capital from Kraków to Warsaw. It’s one of the city’s oldest and most famous landmarks.

Wars and Siwa statue The statue is based on a local legend about a fisherman named Wars who lived by the Vistula River. One night, he discovered a mysterious mermaid named Sawa singing by the shore; they became friends, and the city that grew nearby was named after them — Warsawa, now Warsaw.

Mermaid of Warsaw The mermaid is a symbol of Warsaw and appears on the city’s coat of arms. A statue of her stands by the river, holding a sword and shield to protect the city.

Presidential Palace The Presidential Palace in Warsaw is the official residence of the President of Poland. It’s a historic building with elegant architecture, often used for important ceremonies and state events.

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: Poland - Warsaw

Explore the polish capital to fix the chaos left by Antura

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x5)
  • Music (x3)
  • History (x2)
  • Community (x1)

docs.title: Warsaw
docs.text:
• Chopin Monument A large statue in Warsaw’s Łazienki Park dedicated to Frédéric Chopin. It’s also the site of popular open-air piano concerts in summer. (the special tree he is sitting under is a typical polish.. Willow)

  • Mermaid of Warsaw The city’s symbol is a brave mermaid with a sword and shield. You can see her statue by the river.

  • Wars and Sawa Two legendary figures who gave Warsaw its name. Wars was a brave warrior and Sawa was a beautiful mermaid who lived in the Vistula River.
  • Fryderyk Chopin A famous piano composer from Poland. He wrote beautiful music that sounds like dancing or telling stories. His music makes people feel happy or sad.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Ball A round object used in many games.

Bike A two‑wheeled vehicle you pedal.

Bus A big vehicle that carries many people.

Car A small vehicle for roads.

Constitution of 3 May A historic Polish constitution celebrated on May 3.

Football (Soccer) A team game played with a ball you kick.

Goal The net you try to score into.

Independence Day (Poland) A national holiday on 11 November.

King Sigismund’s Column A tall column honoring King Sigismund in Castle Square.

King Sigismund’s Crown The king’s crown that fell off and must be found.

Maria Curie A brilliant scientist from Poland who discovered radioactivity. She was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize and won it twice!

Maria Skłodowska‑Curie A scientist who won two Nobel Prizes.

Mazurek Dąbrowskiego Poland’s national anthem.

Mermaid’s Sword The mermaid’s sword that must be returned.

National Stadium (Warsaw) A modern stadium for football games and concerts.

Nicolaus Copernicus Monument (Warsaw) A monument to the astronomer Nicolaus Copernicus.

Palace of Culture and Science A tall building for museums, theaters, and learning.

King Sigismund III A king of Poland who built many beautiful buildings in Warsaw. His statue stands on a tall column in the city center.

Polish Dwarf (Wrocław gnomes) Small dwarf statues hide around Wrocław. Finding them is a fun city game.

Polish Houses of Parliament Where laws are made: the Sejm and the Senate.

Presidential Palace The official home of the President of Poland.

Robert Lewandowski A famous Polish football player.

Royal Castle (Warsaw) A historic castle of Polish kings, now a museum.

Soccer Field The grass field where football is played.

Tram A city train that runs on tracks in the street.

Wars and Sawa Statue A statue showing the city’s legend about Wars and Sawa.

Złoty Coins Polish money (złoty) shown as coins.

docs.title: Odkryj Warszawę (pl_01)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: Poland - Warszawa

Zwiedzaj stolicę Polski i napraw chaos pozostawiony przez Anturę

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x5)
  • Music (x3)
  • History (x2)
  • Community (x1)

docs.title: Warsaw
docs.text:
• Pomnik Chopina Duży pomnik w warszawskich Łazienkach Królewskich poświęcony Fryderykowi Chopinowi. Latem odbywają się tam również popularne plenerowe koncerty fortepianowe. (Specjalne drzewo, pod którym siedzi, to typowa polska… wierzba)

  • Syrena Warszawska Symbolem miasta jest odważna syrena z mieczem i tarczą. Jej posąg można zobaczyć nad rzeką.

  • Wars i Sawa Dwie legendarne postacie, które nadały Warszawie nazwę. Wars był dzielnym wojownikiem, a Sawa piękną syreną, która mieszkała w Wiśle.
  • Fryderyk Chopin Znany polski kompozytor fortepianowy. Tworzył piękną muzykę, która brzmi jak taniec lub opowiadanie historii. Jego muzyka sprawia, że ​​ludzie czują się szczęśliwi lub smutni.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Piłka Okrągły obiekt używany w wielu grach.

Rower Dwukołowy pojazd, który napędza się pedałami.

Autobus Duży pojazd, którym można przewieźć wiele osób.

Samochód Mały pojazd do jazdy po drogach.

Konstytucja 3 Maja Historyczna polska konstytucja obchodzona 3 Maja.

Piłka nożna Gra zespołowa, w którą gra się piłką, którą się kopie.

Bramka Siatka, do której próbujesz strzelić gola.

Dzień Niepodległości (Polska) Święto narodowe obchodzone 11 listopada.

Kolumna Króla Zygmunta Wysoka kolumna ku czci króla Zygmunta na Placu Zamkowym.

Korona króla Zygmunta Korona króla, która spadła i musi zostać odnaleziona.

Maria Curie Genialna polska naukowiec, która odkryła radioaktywność. Była pierwszą kobietą, która otrzymała Nagrodę Nobla i to dwukrotnie!

Maria Skłodowska‑Curie Naukowiec, który zdobył dwie Nagrody Nobla.

Mazurek Dąbrowskiego Hymn narodowy Polski.

Miecz Syreny Miecz syreny, który musi zostać zwrócony.

Stadion Narodowy (Warszawa) Nowoczesny stadion przeznaczony do meczów piłkarskich i koncertów.

Pomnik Mikołaja Kopernika (Warszawa) Pomnik astronoma Mikołaja Kopernika.

Pałac Kultury i Nauki Wysoki budynek przeznaczony na muzea, teatry i placówki edukacyjne.

Król Zygmunt III Król Polski, który wzniósł wiele pięknych budowli w Warszawie. Jego pomnik stoi na wysokiej kolumnie w centrum miasta.

Polskie krasnale (wrocławskie krasnale) Małe figurki krasnali kryją się we Wrocławiu. Ich odnalezienie to fajna gra miejska.

Polskie Izby Parlamentu Gdzie tworzone jest prawo: Sejm i Senat.

Pałac Prezydencki Oficjalna siedziba Prezydenta Polski.

Robert Lewandowski Znany polski piłkarz.

Zamek Królewski (Warszawa) Historyczny zamek królów polskich, obecnie muzeum.

Boisko do piłki nożnej Trawiaste boisko, na którym gra się w piłkę nożną.

Tramwajowy Pociąg miejski poruszający się po torach ulicznych.

Statua Warsa i Sawy Rzeźba przedstawiająca legendę miasta o Warsie i Sawie.

Monety złote Polskie pieniądze (złoty) przedstawiane jako monety.

docs.title: post_quest_activity
docs.text:
panel: panel
color: green
tags: proposal

Pourquoi ne dessines-tu pas ton Nain ? #line:0e7c76a 
<<quest_end>>

docs.title: npg_task_dwarves
docs.text:
tags: task
---
Oh non ! Antura est coincée au sommet de la Sky Tower. #line:0a18e6c 
<<card wroclaw_sky_tower zoom>>
Les nains ont verrouillé l'ascenseur. #line:08bcfba 
Trouvez 10 nains autour de Wrocław. Ils nous aideront. #line:07471d4 
<<card wroklaw_map zoom>>
Explorez la ville. Parlez à chaque nain que vous rencontrez. #line:09148d9 
<<task_start FIND_DWARVES task_dwarves_done>>

docs.title: task_dwarves_done
docs.text:
tags: task
---
Vous avez trouvé tous les nains ! #line:03df148 
Maintenant, monte dans l'ascenseur ! #line:0364c03

docs.title: dwarf_1_origin
docs.text:
// 1) The origin of dwarves
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
<<card wroclaw_dwarf_statue zoom>>
Wrocław est la ville des nains. On en trouve partout. #line:007686b 
Ils sont petits et gentils. Ils aiment jouer des tours. #line:0143908 
Voulez-vous jouer avec moi? #line:0e460fe 
Oui #line:02a4fb8 
    <<activity jigsaw_dwarf_origin dwarf_1_origin_done>>
Non #line:0f7786d 
    Oh, d'accord. Peut-être plus tard. #line:0e236f0 
    <<SetActive dwarf_1 false>>

docs.title: dwarf_1_origin_done
docs.text:
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
Bravo ! Vous avez résolu l'énigme. #line:0a87d03 
Maintenant je viens avec toi. #line:0f49b50 
<<inventory wroclaw_dwarfs add>>
<<set $dwarf_1_found = true>>
<<set $found = $found + 1>>
<<SetActive dwarf_1 false>>

docs.title: dwarf_2_town_hall
docs.text:
// 2) Old Town Hall
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
<<asset wroclaw_old_town_hall>>
Voici l'ancien hôtel de ville. C'est ici que travaillent les élus municipaux. #line:02cbbf0 
Les réunions ont lieu à l'intérieur. L'horloge est très ancienne. #line:0ca6131 
<<activity jigsaw_town_hall dwarf_2_town_hall_done>>

docs.title: dwarf_2_town_hall_done
docs.text:
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
Bien joué! #line:004110a 
<<inventory wroclaw_dwarfs add>>
<<set $dwarf_2_found = true>>
<<set $found = $found + 1>>
<<SetActive dwarf_2 false>>

docs.title: dwarf_3_cathedral
docs.text:
// 3) Cathedral with quiz
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
<<card bishop_dwarf>>
Voici la cathédrale. C'est une grande et importante église. #line:00f2132 
Savez-vous ce qu’est une église ? #line:080f821 
Oui #line:07550a5 
Non #line:09e7452 
 <<detour info_church>>
Il possède de hautes tours et des vitraux colorés. #line:08871e4 
<<jump dwarf_3_quiz>>

docs.title: info_church
docs.text:
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
<<card church>>
Une église est un lieu où les gens prient. #line:0b1f4e1

docs.title: dwarf_3_quiz
docs.text:
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
Que font les gens dans une cathédrale ? #line:05ea00d 
Ils font les courses pour acheter de la nourriture. #line:0c891cc 
   Pas ici. Réessayez. #line:0d84e58 
   <<jump dwarf_3_quiz>>
Ils prient. #line:01ac8e6 
   Oui. Vous pouvez récupérer le nain. #line:071c92a 
   <<jump dwarf_3_activity>>
Ils pilotent des avions. #line:09d9b34 
   Non. Réessayez. #line:06ebc0c 
   <<jump dwarf_3_quiz>>

docs.text:
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
Jouons à un jeu. #line:0c5d8d3 
<<activity jigsaw_wroclaw_cathedral dwarf_3_activity_done>>

docs.text:

tags: actor=DWARF

<<inventory wroclaw_dwarfs add>>
<<set $dwarf_3_found = true>>
<<set $found = $found + 1>>
<<SetActive dwarf_3 false>>

docs.title: dwarf_8
docs.text:
// 8) Olga Tokarczuk
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
Olga Tokarczuk est une écrivaine célèbre à Wrocław. #line:0496de5 
Elle a remporté le prix Nobel de littérature. #line:00ae354 
<<activity jigsawpuzzle olga_tokarczuk dwarf_8_activity_done>>

docs.title: elevator_keymaster
docs.text:
// Keymaster at the elevator
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
Je garde l'ascenseur. #line:0dd986c 
<<if $found < $need>>
    Vous avez trouvé {0} / {1} nains. Continuez votre exploration. #line:08dfa28 
<<else>>
    Super ! Tu les as tous trouvés. J'ouvre la porte avec ma clé. #line:0fdc177 
    <<action activate_elevator>>
<<endif>>

docs.title: elevator_up
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
---
L'ascenseur monte. Ding ! #line:0abe973 
La vue est magnifique. #line:008b500

docs.title: npg_rescue_top
docs.text:
tags: actor=ANTURA
---
<<if $top_met>>
    <<jump assessment_intro>>
<<else>>
    <<set $top_met = true>>
    AHhh Antura était là. #line:0708555 
    Mais c'est juste parti ! #line:0f710dd 
    Peut-être que la prochaine fois tu y arriveras ! #line:081c124 
    Mais la vue n'est-elle pas magnifique ? #line:079ea46 
    <<jump assessment_intro>>
<<endif>>

docs.title: assessment_intro
docs.text:
// Final Assessment
tags: actor=GUIDE
---
Souhaitez-vous répondre à deux brèves questions ? #line:07982da 
Oui #line:012a7d1 
    <<jump assessment_q1>>
Non #line:0d0b965 
    Ok. Revenez vers moi pour terminer la partie. #line:0b51184

docs.title: assessment_q1
docs.text:
tags: assessment, actor=GUIDE
---
Quel est le symbole de Wrocław ? #line:020c66a 
un chien #line:03ffcee 
    Pas ça. #line:07344d2 
    <<jump assessment_q1>>
un singe #line:0760b20 
    Non. #line:0868c5e 
    <<jump assessment_q1>>
un nain #line:0972bf0 
    Correct! #line:088b881 
    <<jump assessment_q2>>

docs.title: assessment_q2
docs.text:
tags: assessment, actor=GUIDE
---
Wrocław est la plus grande ville de Pologne. #line:09d303d 
d'abord #line:0ce9571 
    Non. #line:039419a 
    <<jump assessment_q2>>
deuxième #line:0fea2e7 
    Pas ça. #line:028148c 
    <<jump assessment_q2>>
troisième #line:0ebe219 
    C'est vrai ! Bravo. #line:0802440 
    <<jump assessment_end>>

docs.title: assessment_end
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
---
Super ! Vous avez terminé la quête ! #line:0fc1bad 
<<jump quest_end>>

docs.title: Il grande salvataggio dei nani di Breslavia (pl_02) - Script
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

docs.title: quest_start
docs.text:
// pl_02 | Dwarves (Wroclaw)
// 
// ---------------------------------------------
// WANTED:
// - wroclaw_dwarf_statue (cultural symbol)
// - PolishDwarf (cultural tradition)
// - wroclaw_market_square (city center)
// - WroclawOldTownHall (historical building)
// - WroclawCathedral (religious architecture)
// - WroclawSkyTower (modern landmark)
tags: type=Start
color: red
type: panel
---
<<declare $found = 0>>
<<declare $need = 10>>
<<declare $dwarf_1_found = false>>
<<declare $dwarf_2_found = false>>
<<declare $dwarf_3_found = false>>
<<declare $dwarf_4_found = false>>
<<declare $dwarf_5_found = false>>
<<declare $dwarf_6_found = false>>
<<declare $dwarf_7_found = false>>
<<declare $dwarf_8_found = false>>
<<declare $dwarf_9_found = false>>
<<declare $dwarf_10_found = false>>
<<declare $top_met = false>>

Benvenuti a Breslavia! #line:023b330

docs.title: quest_end
docs.text:
panel: panel_endgame
color: green
---
Questa missione è completata. #line:04eb3f4 
<<jump post_quest_activity>>

docs.title: npg_task_dwarves
docs.text:
tags: task
---
Oh no! Antura è bloccato in cima alla Sky Tower. #line:0a18e6c 
<<card wroclaw_sky_tower zoom>>
I nani bloccarono l'ascensore. #line:08bcfba 
Trova 10 nani nei dintorni di Breslavia. Ci aiuteranno. #line:07471d4 
<<card wroklaw_map zoom>>
Esplora la città. Parla con ogni nano che incontri. #line:09148d9 
<<task_start FIND_DWARVES task_dwarves_done>>

docs.title: task_dwarves_done
docs.text:
tags: task
---
Hai trovato tutti i nani! #line:03df148 
Adesso sali con l'ascensore! #line:0364c03

docs.title: dwarf_1_origin
docs.text:
// 1) The origin of dwarves
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
<<card wroclaw_dwarf_statue zoom>>
Breslavia è la città degli gnomi. Li puoi trovare ovunque. #line:007686b 
Sono piccoli e gentili. Amano fare scherzi. #line:0143908 
Vuoi giocare con me? #line:0e460fe 
SÌ #line:02a4fb8 
    <<activity jigsaw_dwarf_origin dwarf_1_origin_done>>
NO #line:0f7786d 
    Oh, ok. Forse più tardi. #line:0e236f0 
    <<SetActive dwarf_1 false>>

docs.title: dwarf_1_origin_done
docs.text:

tags: actor=DWARF

Adesso vengo con te. #line:0f49b50 
<<inventory wroclaw_dwarfs add>>
<<set $dwarf_1_found = true>>
<<set $found = $found + 1>>
<<SetActive dwarf_1 false>>

docs.text:

<<activity jigsaw_town_hall dwarf_2_town_hall_done>>

 <<detour info_church>>

<<endif>>

docs.title: quest_start
docs.text:
// pl_02 | Dwarves (Wroclaw)
// 
// ---------------------------------------------
// WANTED:
// - wroclaw_dwarf_statue (cultural symbol)
// - PolishDwarf (cultural tradition)
// - wroclaw_market_square (city center)
// - WroclawOldTownHall (historical building)
// - WroclawCathedral (religious architecture)
// - WroclawSkyTower (modern landmark)
tags: type=Start
color: red
type: panel
---
<<declare $found = 0>>
<<declare $need = 10>>
<<declare $dwarf_1_found = false>>
<<declare $dwarf_2_found = false>>
<<declare $dwarf_3_found = false>>
<<declare $dwarf_4_found = false>>
<<declare $dwarf_5_found = false>>
<<declare $dwarf_6_found = false>>
<<declare $dwarf_7_found = false>>
<<declare $dwarf_8_found = false>>
<<declare $dwarf_9_found = false>>
<<declare $dwarf_10_found = false>>
<<declare $top_met = false>>

Welcome to Wrocław! #line:023b330

docs.title: quest_end
docs.text:
panel: panel_endgame
color: green
---
This quest is complete. #line:04eb3f4 
<<jump post_quest_activity>>

docs.title: post_quest_activity
docs.text:
panel: panel
color: green
tags: proposal
---
Why don't you draw your Dwarf? #line:0e7c76a 
<<quest_end>>

docs.title: npg_task_dwarves
docs.text:
tags: task
---
Oh no! Antura is stuck at the top of the Sky Tower. #line:0a18e6c 
<<card wroclaw_sky_tower zoom>>
The dwarves locked the elevator. #line:08bcfba 
Find 10 dwarves around Wrocław. They will help us. #line:07471d4 
<<card wroklaw_map zoom>>
Explore the city. Talk to each dwarf you find. #line:09148d9 
<<task_start FIND_DWARVES task_dwarves_done>>

docs.title: task_dwarves_done
docs.text:
tags: task
---
You found all the dwarves! #line:03df148 
Now go up the elevator! #line:0364c03

docs.title: dwarf_1_origin
docs.text:
// 1) The origin of dwarves
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
<<card wroclaw_dwarf_statue zoom>>
Wrocław is the city of dwarfs. You can find them everywhere. #line:007686b 
They are small and kind. They like to play tricks. #line:0143908 
Do you want to play with me? #line:0e460fe 
yes #line:02a4fb8 
    <<activity jigsaw_dwarf_origin dwarf_1_origin_done>>
no #line:0f7786d 
    Oh, okay. Maybe later. #line:0e236f0 
    <<SetActive dwarf_1 false>>

docs.title: dwarf_1_origin_done
docs.text:
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
Good job! You solved the puzzle. #line:0a87d03 
Now I come with you. #line:0f49b50 
<<inventory wroclaw_dwarfs add>>
<<set $dwarf_1_found = true>>
<<set $found = $found + 1>>
<<SetActive dwarf_1 false>>

docs.title: dwarf_2_town_hall
docs.text:
// 2) Old Town Hall
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
<<asset wroclaw_old_town_hall>>
This is the Old Town Hall. City leaders work here. #line:02cbbf0 
Meetings happen inside. The clock is very old. #line:0ca6131 
<<activity jigsaw_town_hall dwarf_2_town_hall_done>>

docs.title: dwarf_2_town_hall_done
docs.text:
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
Well done! #line:004110a 
<<inventory wroclaw_dwarfs add>>
<<set $dwarf_2_found = true>>
<<set $found = $found + 1>>
<<SetActive dwarf_2 false>>

docs.title: dwarf_3_cathedral
docs.text:
// 3) Cathedral with quiz
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
<<card bishop_dwarf>>
This is the cathedral. It is a large and important church. #line:00f2132 
Do you know what a church is? #line:080f821 
Yes #line:07550a5 
No #line:09e7452 
 <<detour info_church>>
It has tall towers and colorful stained-glass windows. #line:08871e4 
<<jump dwarf_3_quiz>>

docs.title: info_church
docs.text:
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
<<card church>>
A church is a place where people pray. #line:0b1f4e1

docs.title: dwarf_3_quiz
docs.text:
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
What do people do in a cathedral? #line:05ea00d 
They shop for food. #line:0c891cc 
   Not here. Try again. #line:0d84e58 
   <<jump dwarf_3_quiz>>
They pray. #line:01ac8e6 
   Yes. You may collect the dwarf. #line:071c92a 
   <<jump dwarf_3_activity>>
They fly planes. #line:09d9b34 
   No. Try again. #line:06ebc0c 
   <<jump dwarf_3_quiz>>

docs.title: dwarf_3_activity
docs.text:
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
Let's play a game. #line:0c5d8d3 
<<activity jigsaw_wroclaw_cathedral dwarf_3_activity_done>>

docs.title: dwarf_3_activity_done
docs.text:
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
Great! He is another dwarf. #line:04886ba 
<<inventory wroclaw_dwarfs add>>
<<set $dwarf_3_found = true>>
<<set $found = $found + 1>>
<<SetActive dwarf_3 false>>

docs.title: dwarf_4_zoo
docs.text:
// 4) ZOO
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
Visit the Wrocław zoo. It is the biggest in Poland. #line:0198e80 
It has many animals from around the world. #line:01b020e 
<<jump dwarf_4_activity>>

docs.title: dwarf_4_activity
docs.text:
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
Let's play a game. #line:0f921e7 
<<activity jigsaw_wroclaw_zoo dwarf_4_activity_done>>

docs.text:

tags: actor=DWARF

<<inventory wroclaw_dwarfs add>>
<<set $dwarf_4_found = true>>
<<set $found = $found + 1>>
<<SetActive dwarf_4 false>>

docs.title: dwarf_5
docs.text:
// 5) Centennial Hall
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
The Centennial Hall is huge. You see shows inside. #line:0ebb952 
The roof looks like a giant dome. #line:0f4189b 
<<jump dwarf_5_activity>>

docs.title: dwarf_5_activity
docs.text:
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
Let's play a game. #line:06b4a16 
<<activity jigsawpuzzle centennial_hall dwarf_5_activity_done>>

docs.title: dwarf_5_activity_done
docs.text:
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
Great! #line:0abf458 
<<inventory wroclaw_dwarfs add>>
<<set $dwarf_5_found = true>>
<<set $found = $found + 1>>
<<SetActive dwarf_5 false>>

docs.title: dwarf_6
docs.text:
// 6) Multimedia Fountain
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
Water dances here with music and lights. #line:0daf76d 
The shows are beautiful on summer nights. #line:006ed40 
<<jump dwarf_6_activity>>

docs.title: dwarf_6_activity
docs.text:
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
Let's play a game. #line:0cdb4f5 
<<activity jigsaw_multimedia_fountain dwarf_6_activity_done>>

docs.title: dwarf_6_activity_done
docs.text:
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
Great! #line:0818eec 
<<inventory wroclaw_dwarfs add>>
<<set $dwarf_6_found = true>>
<<set $found = $found + 1>>
<<SetActive dwarf_6 false>>

docs.title: dwarf_7
docs.text:
// 7) Panorama Racławicka
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
A giant battle painting goes all around you. #line:0de7f17 
You stand inside the story. #line:0f8436b 
<<activity jigsawpuzzle panorama_raclawicka dwarf_7_activity_done>>

docs.title: dwarf_8
docs.text:
// 8) Olga Tokarczuk
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
Olga Tokarczuk is a famous writer in Wrocław. #line:0496de5 
She won the Nobel Prize in Literature. #line:00ae354 
<<activity jigsawpuzzle olga_tokarczuk dwarf_8_activity_done>>

docs.title: dwarf_9
docs.text:
// 9) Sky Tower Plaza Dwarf
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
This is the modern plaza near the Sky Tower. #line:096a9ee 
People meet here to talk and play. #line:0c899a5 
<<activity jigsawpuzzle plaza_dwarf dwarf_9_activity_done>>

docs.title: dwarf_10
docs.text:
// 9) Sky Tower Dwarf
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
The Sky Tower is very tall. #line:0ccd434 
You can see very far from the top. #line:0170463 
<<activity jigsawpuzzle sky_tower_dwarf dwarf_10_activity_done>>

docs.title: elevator_keymaster
docs.text:
// Keymaster at the elevator
group: dwarves
tags: actor=DWARF
---
I guard the elevator. #line:0dd986c 
<<if $found < $need>>
    You found {0} / {1} dwarves. Keep exploring. #line:08dfa28 
<<else>>
    Great! You found them all. I open the door with my key. #line:0fdc177 
    <<action activate_elevator>>
<<endif>>

docs.title: elevator_up
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
---
The elevator goes up. Ding! #line:0abe973 
The view is beautiful. #line:008b500

docs.title: npg_rescue_top
docs.text:
tags: actor=ANTURA
---
<<if $top_met>>
    <<jump assessment_intro>>
<<else>>
    <<set $top_met = true>>
    AHhh Antura was here. #line:0708555 
    But it just went away! #line:0f710dd 
    Maybe next time you'll make it! #line:081c124 
    But isn't the view beautiful? #line:079ea46 
    <<jump assessment_intro>>
<<endif>>

docs.title: assessment_intro
docs.text:
// Final Assessment
tags: actor=GUIDE
---
Would you like to answer two short questions? #line:07982da 
Yes #line:012a7d1 
    <<jump assessment_q1>>
No #line:0d0b965 
    Ok. Come back to me to end the game #line:0b51184

docs.title: assessment_q1
docs.text:
tags: assessment, actor=GUIDE
---
What is the symbol of Wrocław? #line:020c66a 
a dog #line:03ffcee 
    Not this. #line:07344d2 
    <<jump assessment_q1>>
a monkey #line:0760b20 
    No. #line:0868c5e 
    <<jump assessment_q1>>
a dwarf #line:0972bf0 
    Correct! #line:088b881 
    <<jump assessment_q2>>

docs.title: assessment_q2
docs.text:
tags: assessment, actor=GUIDE
---
Wrocław is the ... biggest city in Poland. #line:09d303d 
first #line:0ce9571 
    No. #line:039419a 
    <<jump assessment_q2>>
second #line:0fea2e7 
    Not this. #line:028148c 
    <<jump assessment_q2>>
third #line:0ebe219 
    Correct! Well done. #line:0802440 
    <<jump assessment_end>>

docs.title: assessment_end
docs.text:
tags: actor=GUIDE
---
Great! You finished the quest! #line:0fc1bad 
<<jump quest_end>>

docs.title: Le grand sauvetage des nains de Wrocław (pl_02)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: Poland - Wrocław

Explorez la belle ville de Wrocław, découvrez ses célèbres statues de nains cachées près des monuments.

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x9)
  • History (x5)
  • Community (x4)
  • Education (x2)
  • Animal (x1)

docs.title: Wroclaw Dwarves
docs.text:
• Nains de Wrocław De minuscules statues à travers la ville qui aiment jouer des tours.
  • Nain amoureux des animaux Une statue naine qui aime le zoo et les animaux.
  • Évêque Nain Une statue naine qui pose une question d'église.
  • Expert nain Un guide sympathique qui connaît tout sur les nains.
  • Maître des clés nain Une statue naine gardant l'ascenseur avec une grosse clé.
  • Nain polonais (gnomes de Wrocław) De petites statues de nains se cachent un peu partout à Wrocław. Les trouver est un jeu de ville amusant.
  • Statue du nain de Wrocław Une petite statue de la ville ; les nains sont le symbole de Wrocław.
  • Wrocław Une ville de Pologne avec des rivières, des ponts et de l'histoire.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Salle du Centenaire Le Centennial Hall est un immense bâtiment qui ressemble à une grande tente avec un toit. Il est très haut. À l'intérieur, vous pouvez assister à différents spectacles, écouter des concerts ou regarder des matchs.

Olga Tokarczuk Un célèbre écrivain polonais qui vit à Wrocław.

Panorama de Racławicka Un tableau géant tout autour de vous sur une bataille historique.

Sky Tower Plaza Une place moderne où les gens se rencontrent près de la tour.

Mairie Le lieu où les dirigeants de la ville travaillent et se rencontrent.

la Vistule Le plus long fleuve de Pologne ; il se jette dans la mer Baltique.

Wroclaw : Cathédrale Une grande et importante église où l'on prie. On peut monter dans la tour pour admirer la vue.

Place du marché de Wrocław La place principale de la vieille ville, pleine de vie.

Fontaine multimédia de Wrocław De l'eau qui danse avec de la musique et des lumières colorées.

Ancien hôtel de ville (Wroclaw) Un magnifique édifice gothique sur la place principale. Il possède une horloge célèbre.

Wroclaw : Sky Tower L'un des plus hauts bâtiments de Pologne. Il abrite des boutiques et un point de vue.

Leonardo da Vinci Primary School It’s a friendly place where children learn, create, and explore guided by curiosity, art, and science.

Map of Wroklaw A simple map of Wrocław showing the Odra River with its islands and many bridges

docs.title: Quest Script
docs.text: See the full script here

docs.title: Activities
docs.text:
• JigsawPuzzle
  • JigsawPuzzle

docs.title: Tasks
docs.text: • [Collect] FIND_DWARVES

docs.title: Gameplay
docs.text:
• Difficulty: Normal
  • Duration (min): 20

docs.title: Credits
docs.text:
• Jan Stasienko (Poland) (content)
  • Lorenzo Castrovilli (Italy) (design)
  • Stefano Cecere (Italy) (development)
  • Valeria Passarella (Italy) (design)
  • Vieri Toti (Italy) (design)

docs.title: Game Design Notes
docs.text:
Mission The player must explore a stylized map of Wrocław to find 10 unique dwarf statues. The quest involves simple exploration and collection, with key educational facts delivered through interactions with major landmarks like the Old Town Hall and the Cathedral. A small quiz-like interaction at the Cathedral must be completed to collect one of the dwarves. The ultimate goal is to gather all the dwarves to unlock the Sky Tower elevator.

Characters: The Dwarf Expert (Guide): A friendly guide who explains the mission and the magical nature of the dwarves. Special Dwarves: The "Bishop Dwarf" who asks questions, and the "Keymaster Dwarf" who guards the elevator.

docs.title: Knowledge Content
docs.text:
Facts about Wrocław:

  • It is the third (3) biggest city in Poland.
  • The dwarf is the official symbol of the city.

Landmark Recognition: To identify and learn about the Old Town Hall, the Cathedral, and the Sky Tower.

Basic Definitions: To understand that a Town Hall is where the city's leaders work and a Cathedral is a large, important church where people pray.

docs.title: Flow
docs.text:
Mission: We start on the campus of the Leonardo School. The player meets the "Dwarf Expert."

Dwarf Expert: "Oh no, it's terrible! Your friend Antura is stuck on the observation deck of the Sky Tower! The mischievous Wrocław dwarves locked the elevator. They love games! The only way to get them to open it is to find 10 of their friends who are hiding around the city. Will you help me find them?"

The Hunt - Part 1 (Old Town) The player must find several dwarves in fun, interactive ways (e.g., clicking on a bench to make a dwarf pop out from behind it). In the first part we hide 7 dwarfes

Dwarfs stories For each we play [Activity Jigsaw puzzle]

Dwarf 0 - The origin of Dwarfs They became the symbol of Wrocław and first appeared in that context in 2003, although they were used as a resistance movement in the 1980s against the communist regime.

"Wrocław is the city of dwarfs. You can find them everywhere: on sidewalks, in squares, and in the Wrocław Market Square. They are a big group of little city residents, like the Coach, Sleepyhead, Kind One, Firefighters, Forget-Me-Not, and many more."

Dwarf 1: The Old Town Hall The player approaches the beautiful Town Hall building. A pop-up appears: A "Councilor Dwarf" is found on the steps.

EN: "This is the magnificent Old Town Hall. It's a very old and important building where the city's leaders work."

Dwarf 2 - The Cathedral & Quiz The player reaches the Cathedral. A special "Bishop Dwarf" statue blocks the path to a collectible dwarf behind it. [Activity Puzzle with a dwarf]

Dwarf 3 - ZOO Fact Integration The player finds an "Animal Lover Dwarf" sitting next to a large, colorful poster that reads: "Visit the Wrocław ZOO - The Biggest in Poland!" (it’ll be Quest PL 04)

Dwarf 4 - Centennial Hall EN: The Centennial Hall is a huge building that looks like a big tent with a roof. It’s very tall. Inside, you can see different shows, listen to concerts, or watch sports games.

Dwarf 5 - The Wrocław Multimedia Fountain one of the largest operating fountains in Europe, is a multimedia musical fountain, that offers nightly displays of Multimedia Shows that use different coloured lights.

EN: The Wrocław multimedia fountain is a place where water dances to music and colorful lights. Every summer show is a beautiful story told with water and light.

Dwarf 6 - Panorama Racławicka a museum in Wrocław that displays the painting by Wojciech Kossak and Jan Styka, showing the events of a battle of Raclawice. Its dimentions are 1500x11400 cm.

EN: The Racławice Panorama is a giant painting that shows a big battle. It’s so big that it goes all around you, and when you stand in the middle, you feel like you’re part of the story.

Dwarf 7 - Olga Tokarczuk polish writer who was awarded with the Nobel Prize in Literature. She is living in Wrocław. EN: In Wrocław lives Olga Tokarczuk. She is the most famous Polish writer. The characters in her books often live in Lower Silesia, the region where Wrocław is the main city.

The Hunt - Part 2 (Sky Tower): ** After finding the first 7 dwarves, we can enter the Sky Tower to find the final 3** hidden in the modern plaza around its base.

Unlocking the Tower: With the Dwarf Counter showing 10/10, the player approaches the elevator doors of the Sky Tower, which are blocked by a "Keymaster Dwarf" with a giant key.

docs.title: Il grande salvataggio dei nani di Breslavia (pl_02)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: Poland - Breslavia

Esplora la splendida città di Breslavia e scopri le sue famose statue di nani nascoste vicino ai monumenti.

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x9)
  • History (x5)
  • Community (x4)
  • Education (x2)
  • Animal (x1)

docs.title: Wroclaw Dwarves
docs.text:
• Nani di Breslavia Piccole statue sparse per la città che amano fare scherzi.
  • Nano amante degli animali Una statua di un nano che ama lo zoo e gli animali.
  • Vescovo nano Una statua nana che pone una domanda in chiesa.
  • Esperto di nani Una guida amichevole che sa tutto sui nani.
  • Maestro delle Chiavi Nano Una statua nana sorveglia l'ascensore con una grande chiave.
  • Nano polacco (gnomi di Breslavia) Piccole statue di nani si nascondono in giro per Breslavia. Trovarle è un divertente gioco cittadino.
  • Statua del nano di Breslavia Una piccola statua cittadina; i nani sono il simbolo di Breslavia.
  • Breslavia Una città in Polonia con fiumi, ponti e storia.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Sala del Centenario La Centennial Hall è un enorme edificio che sembra una grande tenda con un tetto. È molto alto. Al suo interno si possono vedere diversi spettacoli, ascoltare concerti o guardare partite sportive.

Olga Tokarczuk Un famoso scrittore polacco che vive a Breslavia.

Panorama Racławicka Un dipinto gigante tutto intorno a te che racconta una battaglia storica.

Sky Tower Plaza Una piazza moderna dove le persone si incontrano vicino alla torre.

Municipio Il luogo in cui i leader della città lavorano e si incontrano.

fiume Vistola Il fiume più lungo della Polonia; sfocia nel Mar Baltico.

Breslavia: Cattedrale Una chiesa grande e importante, dove la gente prega. È possibile salire sulla torre per ammirare il panorama.

Piazza del mercato di Breslavia La piazza principale della Città Vecchia, piena di vita.

Fontana multimediale di Breslavia Acqua che danza con musica e luci colorate.

Vecchio Municipio (Breslavia) Uno splendido edificio gotico nella piazza principale. Ha un famoso orologio.

Breslavia: Sky Tower Uno degli edifici più alti della Polonia. Ospita negozi e un punto panoramico.

Leonardo da Vinci Primary School It’s a friendly place where children learn, create, and explore guided by curiosity, art, and science.

Map of Wroklaw A simple map of Wrocław showing the Odra River with its islands and many bridges

Subjects:

  • Culture (x9)
  • History (x5)
  • Community (x4)
  • Education (x2)

docs.title: Wroclaw Dwarves
docs.text:
• Wrocław Dwarfs Tiny statues across the city that love to play tricks.
  • Animal Lover Dwarf A dwarf statue that loves the zoo and animals.
  • Bishop Dwarf A dwarf statue who asks a church question.
  • Dwarf Expert A friendly guide who knows all about the dwarfs.
  • Keymaster Dwarf A dwarf statue guarding the elevator with a big key.
  • Polish Dwarf (Wrocław gnomes) Small dwarf statues hide around Wrocław. Finding them is a fun city game.
  • Wrocław Dwarf Statue A small city statue; dwarfs are Wrocław’s symbol.
  • Wrocław A city in Poland with rivers, bridges, and history.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Centennial Hall The Centennial Hall is a huge building that looks like a big tent with a roof. It’s very tall. Inside, you can see different shows, listen to concerts, or watch sports games.

Olga Tokarczuk A famous Polish writer who lives in Wrocław.

Panorama Racławicka A giant painting all around you about a historic battle.

Sky Tower Plaza A modern plaza where people meet near the tower.

Town Hall The place where city leaders work and meet.

Vistula River Poland’s longest river; it flows to the Baltic Sea.

Wroclaw: Cathedral A big, important church where people pray. You can climb the tower for a view.

Wrocław Market Square The main square of the Old Town, full of life.

Wrocław Multimedia Fountain Water that dances with music and colorful lights.

Old Town Hall (Wroclaw) A beautiful Gothic building in the main square. It has a famous clock.

Wroclaw: Sky Tower One of the tallest buildings in Poland. It has shops and a viewpoint.

Leonardo da Vinci Primary School It’s a friendly place where children learn, create, and explore guided by curiosity, art, and science.

Map of Wroklaw A simple map of Wrocław showing the Odra River with its islands and many bridges
