docs.title: Game Design Notes
docs.text:
Mission The player must explore a stylized map of Wrocław to find 10 unique dwarf statues. The quest involves simple exploration and collection, with key educational facts delivered through interactions with major landmarks like the Old Town Hall and the Cathedral. A small quiz-like interaction at the Cathedral must be completed to collect one of the dwarves. The ultimate goal is to gather all the dwarves to unlock the Sky Tower elevator.

Characters: The Dwarf Expert (Guide): A friendly guide who explains the mission and the magical nature of the dwarves. Special Dwarves: The "Bishop Dwarf" who asks questions, and the "Keymaster Dwarf" who guards the elevator.

docs.title: Knowledge Content
docs.text:
Facts about Wrocław:

  • It is the third (3) biggest city in Poland.
  • The dwarf is the official symbol of the city.

Landmark Recognition: To identify and learn about the Old Town Hall, the Cathedral, and the Sky Tower.

Basic Definitions: To understand that a Town Hall is where the city's leaders work and a Cathedral is a large, important church where people pray.

docs.title: Flow
docs.text:
Mission: We start on the campus of the Leonardo School. The player meets the "Dwarf Expert."

Dwarf Expert: "Oh no, it's terrible! Your friend Antura is stuck on the observation deck of the Sky Tower! The mischievous Wrocław dwarves locked the elevator. They love games! The only way to get them to open it is to find 10 of their friends who are hiding around the city. Will you help me find them?"

The Hunt - Part 1 (Old Town) The player must find several dwarves in fun, interactive ways (e.g., clicking on a bench to make a dwarf pop out from behind it). In the first part we hide 7 dwarfes

Dwarfs stories For each we play [Activity Jigsaw puzzle]

Dwarf 0 - The origin of Dwarfs They became the symbol of Wrocław and first appeared in that context in 2003, although they were used as a resistance movement in the 1980s against the communist regime.

"Wrocław is the city of dwarfs. You can find them everywhere: on sidewalks, in squares, and in the Wrocław Market Square. They are a big group of little city residents, like the Coach, Sleepyhead, Kind One, Firefighters, Forget-Me-Not, and many more."

Dwarf 1: The Old Town Hall The player approaches the beautiful Town Hall building. A pop-up appears: A "Councilor Dwarf" is found on the steps.

EN: "This is the magnificent Old Town Hall. It's a very old and important building where the city's leaders work."

Dwarf 2 - The Cathedral & Quiz The player reaches the Cathedral. A special "Bishop Dwarf" statue blocks the path to a collectible dwarf behind it. [Activity Puzzle with a dwarf]

Dwarf 3 - ZOO Fact Integration The player finds an "Animal Lover Dwarf" sitting next to a large, colorful poster that reads: "Visit the Wrocław ZOO - The Biggest in Poland!" (it’ll be Quest PL 04)

Dwarf 4 - Centennial Hall EN: The Centennial Hall is a huge building that looks like a big tent with a roof. It’s very tall. Inside, you can see different shows, listen to concerts, or watch sports games.

Dwarf 5 - The Wrocław Multimedia Fountain one of the largest operating fountains in Europe, is a multimedia musical fountain, that offers nightly displays of Multimedia Shows that use different coloured lights.

EN: The Wrocław multimedia fountain is a place where water dances to music and colorful lights. Every summer show is a beautiful story told with water and light.

Dwarf 6 - Panorama Racławicka a museum in Wrocław that displays the painting by Wojciech Kossak and Jan Styka, showing the events of a battle of Raclawice. Its dimentions are 1500x11400 cm.

EN: The Racławice Panorama is a giant painting that shows a big battle. It’s so big that it goes all around you, and when you stand in the middle, you feel like you’re part of the story.

Dwarf 7 - Olga Tokarczuk polish writer who was awarded with the Nobel Prize in Literature. She is living in Wrocław. EN: In Wrocław lives Olga Tokarczuk. She is the most famous Polish writer. The characters in her books often live in Lower Silesia, the region where Wrocław is the main city.

The Hunt - Part 2 (Sky Tower): ** After finding the first 7 dwarves, we can enter the Sky Tower to find the final 3** hidden in the modern plaza around its base.

Unlocking the Tower: With the Dwarf Counter showing 10/10, the player approaches the elevator doors of the Sky Tower, which are blocked by a "Keymaster Dwarf" with a giant key.

docs.title: Wielka akcja ratunkowa krasnala wrocławskiego (pl_02)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: Poland - Wroclaw

Odkryj piękno Wrocławia i znajdź słynne figurki krasnali ukryte w pobliżu zabytków.

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
Subjects:

  • Culture (x9)
  • History (x5)
  • Community (x4)
  • Education (x2)
  • Animal (x1)

docs.title: Wroclaw Dwarves
docs.text:
• Krasnale wrocławskie Malutkie figurki w całym mieście, które uwielbiają płatać figle.
  • Miłośnik zwierząt Krasnolud Figurka krasnala, który uwielbia zoo i zwierzęta.
  • Biskup Krasnolud Posąg karła zadającego pytanie kościelne.
  • Ekspert Krasnoludów Przyjazny przewodnik, który wie wszystko o krasnoludkach.
  • Krasnolud Klucznik Posąg krasnoluda pilnującego windy z dużym kluczem.
  • Polskie krasnale (wrocławskie krasnale) Małe figurki krasnali kryją się we Wrocławiu. Ich odnalezienie to fajna gra miejska.
  • Rzeźba Krasnala wrocławskiego Niewielka figurka miejska; krasnale są symbolem Wrocławia.
  • Wrocław Miasto w Polsce z rzekami, mostami i historią.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Hala Stulecia Hala Stulecia to ogromny budynek przypominający wielki namiot z dachem. Jest bardzo wysoki. Wewnątrz można oglądać różne pokazy, słuchać koncertów i oglądać mecze sportowe.

Olga Tokarczuk Znany polski pisarz mieszkający we Wrocławiu.

Panorama Racławicka Otacza Cię gigantyczny obraz przedstawiający historyczną bitwę.

Sky Tower Plaza Nowoczesny plac, na którym ludzie spotykają się w pobliżu wieży.

Ratusz Miejsce, w którym pracują i spotykają się przywódcy miasta.

Wisła Najdłuższa rzeka Polski. Uchodzi do Morza Bałtyckiego.

Wrocław: Katedra Duży, ważny kościół, w którym ludzie się modlą. Można wspiąć się na wieżę, żeby zobaczyć widok.

Rynek wrocławski Główny plac Starego Miasta, pełen życia.

Wrocławska Fontanna Multimedialna Woda tańcząca w rytm muzyki i kolorowych świateł.

Stary Ratusz (Wrocław) Piękny gotycki budynek na głównym placu. Znajduje się w nim słynny zegar.

Wrocław: Sky Tower Jeden z najwyższych budynków w Polsce. Znajdują się w nim sklepy i punkt widokowy.

Leonardo da Vinci Primary School It’s a friendly place where children learn, create, and explore guided by curiosity, art, and science.

Map of Wroklaw A simple map of Wrocław showing the Odra River with its islands and many bridges

docs.title: Fleuve Oder (pl_03) - Script
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

docs.title: quest_start
docs.text:
// pl_03 | Odra River (Wroclaw)
// PL_03 - A Voyage on the Odra River
// 
// ---------------------------------------------
// WANTED:
// cleancanvas odra_footbridge  — Clean the FOOTBRIDGE image; concept: BRIDGE for people (no CARS).
// memory odra_bridges          — Match BRIDGE types; concepts: TRAIN BRIDGE (tracks), ROAD BRIDGE (CARS).
// jigsawpuzzle odra_barge      — Rebuild BARGE image; concept: BOAT that carries GOODS.
// jigsawpuzzle odra_houseboat  — Rebuild HOUSEBOAT image; concept: BOAT for LIVING.
// order odra_couples           — Pair BRIDGES→(people/CARS/TRAIN) and BOATS→(goods/live).
// order odra_map_triplet       — Tap/sequence ODRA, WISŁA, BALTIC; concept: rivers flow to SEA.
// quiz odra_facts              — Final assessment (at least 2 Qs): ODRA→BALTIC, longest river=WISŁA.
// Words used: Odra, river, bridge, island , water, Wrocław, navigation, ecosystem
// INTRO – DOCK
group: Intro
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: odra_dock
color: red
---
Bienvenue à WROCŁAW en POLOGNE. #line:03f03fe 
<<card place_odra_river>>
C'est la RIVIÈRE ODRA. #line:053bcb9 
Prêt à explorer ? #line:06099c1

docs.title: quest_end
docs.text:
panel: panel_endgame
color: green
---
Super voyage sur l'ODRA. #line:02a257c 
Vous avez vu des PONTS et des BATEAUX. #line:0925273 
Vous avez utilisé une CARTE et un QUIZ. #line:05d21d7 
Vous voulez une tâche supplémentaire ? #line:0913f94 
<<jump post_quest_activity>>

docs.title: post_quest_activity
docs.text:
panel: panel
color: green
tags: proposal
---
Dessinez une CARTE simple. #line:0265d07 
Mark ODRA et WISŁA. #line:08d1173 
Ajoutez un PONT ROUTIER. #line:0b3ae20 
Ajoutez un PONT TRAIN. #line:055fe3a 
Dessinez une BARGE et un KAYAK. #line:0cd2507 
Montre-le à un ami. #line:0774214 
<<quest_end>>

docs.title: BRIDGES_INTRO
docs.text:
//--------------------------------------------
// PART 1 – CITY OF BRIDGES
//--------------------------------------------
group: Bridges
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: city_of_bridges
---
<<card bridge>>
WROCŁAW a de nombreux PONTS. #line:041a469 
<<card wroclaw_bridges>>
Plus d'une centaine ! #line:0522f41 
Trouvons trois types. #line:04082d6

docs.title: BRIDGE_FOOT_HINT
docs.text:
group: Bridges
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: footbridge_view
---
<<card footbridge>>
La PASSERELLE est pour les gens. #line:0d0c6ff 
Indice : pas de VOITURES dessus. #line:057b7a9 

<<activity cleancanvas odra_footbridge tutorial>>

docs.title: BRIDGE_TRAIN_HINT
docs.text:
group: Bridges
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: railway_bridge
---
<<card train_bridge>>
Le PONT TRAIN transporte des TRAINS. #line:04b8fb2 
Astuce : recherchez TRACKS. #line:03bf613 

<<activity memory odra_bridges tutorial>>
Suivant : PONT ROUTIER #line:08d07e5 
    <<jump BRIDGE_CAR_HINT>>

docs.title: BRIDGE_CAR_HINT
docs.text:
group: Bridges
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: road_bridge
---
<<card road_bridge>>
Le PONT ROUTIER est pour les VOITURES. #line:0f6e252 
Indice : voir le passage CARS. #line:03fcfdf 

<<activity memory odra_bridges tutorial>>

docs.title: BOATS_INTRO
docs.text:
//--------------------------------------------
// PART 2 – RIVER BOATS
//--------------------------------------------
group: Boats
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: odra_river_traffic
---
<<card boat>>
De nombreux BATEAUX sur l'ODRA. #line:0eb639b 
<<card barge>>
Trouvez d’abord une BARGE. #line:0d21cc3 

Montre-moi une BARGE #line:03495d2 
    <<jump BOAT_BARGE_HINT>>

docs.title: BOAT_BARGE_HINT
docs.text:
group: Boats
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: barge_photo
---
La BARGE est basse et plate. #line:028dcdf 
Il transporte des MARCHANDISES. #line:083423e 

<<activity jigsawpuzzle odra_barge tutorial>>
Trouver une péniche #line:0a09f26

docs.title: BOAT_HOUSE_HINT
docs.text:
group: Boats
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: houseboat
---
<<card houseboat>>
La péniche est faite pour vivre. #line:0d77d00 
Des fenêtres comme une petite maison. #line:0d30896 

<<activity jigsawpuzzle odra_houseboat tutorial>>

Montre-moi un KAYAK #line:046e06a 
    <<jump BOAT_KAYAK_HINT>>
Prêt à correspondre #line:0b48adf 
    <<jump BOATS_MATCH>>

docs.title: BOAT_KAYAK_HINT
docs.text:
group: Boats
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: kayak
---
<<card kayak>>
KAYAK est petit et léger #line:06a76b7 
Une seule personne peut le pagayer. #line:0b0ccde 
Déplacez-vous rapidement sur l'eau calme. #line:0e4d09c

docs.title: BOATS_MATCH
docs.text:
group: Boats
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: odra_couples
---
Associez les choses aux emplois. #line:0d62913 
PONT -> personnes/VOITURES/TRAIN. #line:094d834 
BATEAU -> marchandises/vivants. #line:0e16bac 

<<activity order odra_couples tutorial>>

docs.title: MAP_INTRO
docs.text:
//--------------------------------------------
// PART 3 – BIG MAP
//--------------------------------------------
group: Map
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: poland_river_map
---
<<card odra_river_map>>
L'ODRA est le deuxième fleuve de Pologne. #line:0ff7dfd 
<<card place_vistula_river>>
WISŁA est 1, le plus long. #line:03fe124 
Les deux se jettent dans la MER BALTIQUE. #line:0941615 

    <<jump MAP_ACTIVITY>>

docs.title: MAP_ACTIVITY
docs.text:
group: Map
tags: 
image: map_icons
---
<<card wroklaw_map>>
Appuyez sur ODRA, WISŁA, BALTIC. #line:0ddc2c8 
Suivez les RIVIÈRES jusqu'à la MER. #line:06237e3 

<<activity jigsaw_odra_map jigsaw_odra_map_done>>

docs.title: jigsaw_odra_map_done
docs.text:
group: Map
---
Excellent travail, explorateur RIVER ! #line:012f97c

docs.title: ENDING_DOCK
docs.text:
group: End
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: odra_sign
---
<<card tumski_bridge>>
Ce PANNEAU bleu signifie RIVIÈRE. #line:0b583df 
<<card redzinski_bridge>>
Vous avez appris les PONTS et les BATEAUX. #line:0a2180f 
Prêt pour un quiz ? #line:07d9d36 
<<jump FINAL_QUIZ>>

docs.title: FINAL_QUIZ
docs.text:
//--------------------------------------------
// FINAL QUIZ – ALWAYS LAST
//--------------------------------------------
group: End
tags: 
image: odra_quiz
---
Répondez à deux questions. #line:0afcdc6 
Appuyez sur le meilleur choix. #line:0c9b102 

<<activity order_odra_facts order_odra_facts_done>>

docs.title: order_odra_facts_done
docs.text:
group: End
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: quest_complete
---
Excellent travail, explorateur RIVER ! #line:0117d8b 
À bientôt pour le prochain voyage ! #line:045c7d9 

<<jump quest_end>>

docs.title: spawned_child
docs.text:
///////// NPCs SPAWNED IN THE SCENE //////////
// these npc are spawned automatically in the scene
// each time you meet them they say one random line
group: Spawned
tags: actor=Child
---
J'aime le petit KAYAK. #line:0f36b7f 
Pagayez vite sur l'eau calme. #line:07ff8c5

docs.title: spawned_tourist
docs.text:
group: Spawned
tags: actor=Tourist
---
Tant de PONTS dans cette ville. #line:0577d80 
Mon nombre de photos est énorme. #line:089ea37

docs.title: spawned_fisher
docs.text:
group: Spawned
tags: actor=Fisher
---
L’eau calme est bonne pour les poissons. #line:0207b2a 
Je regarde les bateaux glisser. #line:04d0dac

docs.title: spawned_birdwatcher
docs.text:
group: Spawned
tags: actor=Birdwatcher
---
Les oiseaux se reposent sur le vieux pont. #line:05d28c9 
Je les note dans mon livre. #line:0b1b835

Disegna una MAPPA semplice. #line:0265d07 
Mark ODRA e WISŁA. #line:08d1173 
Aggiungere un PONTE STRADALE. #line:0b3ae20 
Aggiungere un PONTE FERROVIARIO. #line:055fe3a

docs.title: BRIDGES_INTRO
docs.text:
//--------------------------------------------
// PART 1 – CITY OF BRIDGES
//--------------------------------------------
group: Bridges
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: city_of_bridges
---
<<card bridge>>
WROCŁAW ha molti PONTI. #line:041a469 
<<card wroclaw_bridges>>
Più di cento! #line:0522f41 
Troviamo tre tipi. #line:04082d6

docs.text:
group: Bridges
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: footbridge_view
---
<<card footbridge>>
FOOTBRIDGE è per le persone. #line:0d0c6ff 
Suggerimento: non ci sono AUTO. #line:057b7a9 

<<activity cleancanvas odra_footbridge tutorial>>

docs.title: BRIDGE_TRAIN_HINT
docs.text:
group: Bridges
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: railway_bridge
---
<<card train_bridge>>
Il PONTE FERROVIARIO trasporta TRENI. #line:04b8fb2 
Suggerimento: cerca le TRACCE. #line:03bf613 

<<activity memory odra_bridges tutorial>>
Successivo: PONTE STRADALE #line:08d07e5 
    <<jump BRIDGE_CAR_HINT>>

docs.title: BRIDGE_CAR_HINT
docs.text:
group: Bridges
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: road_bridge
---
<<card road_bridge>>
Il PONTE STRADALE è per le AUTO. #line:0f6e252

<<activity memory odra_bridges tutorial>>

docs.title: BOATS_INTRO
docs.text:
//--------------------------------------------

//--------------------------------------------

tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: odra_river_traffic
---
<<card boat>>
Molte BARCHE sull'ODRA. #line:0eb639b 
<<card barge>>
Trova prima una BARCA. #line:0d21cc3 

Mostrami una BARCA #line:03495d2 
    <<jump BOAT_BARGE_HINT>>

docs.title: BOAT_BARGE_HINT
docs.text:
group: Boats
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: barge_photo
---
BARGE è basso e piatto. #line:028dcdf 
Trasporta MERCI. #line:083423e 

<<activity jigsawpuzzle odra_barge tutorial>>
Trova una CASA GALLEGGIANTE #line:0a09f26

docs.title: BOAT_HOUSE_HINT
docs.text:
group: Boats
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: houseboat
---
<<card houseboat>>
HOUSEBOAT è una casa in cui vivere. #line:0d77d00 
Finestre come una piccola casa. #line:0d30896 

<<activity jigsawpuzzle odra_houseboat tutorial>>

Mostrami un KAYAK #line:046e06a 
    <<jump BOAT_KAYAK_HINT>>
Pronti per la partita #line:0b48adf 
    <<jump BOATS_MATCH>>

docs.title: BOAT_KAYAK_HINT
docs.text:
group: Boats
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: kayak
---
<<card kayak>>
KAYAK è piccolo e leggero #line:06a76b7 
Una sola persona può pagaiare. #line:0b0ccde 
Muoviti velocemente in acque calme. #line:0e4d09c

docs.title: BOATS_MATCH
docs.text:
group: Boats
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: odra_couples
---
Abbina le cose ai lavori. #line:0d62913 
PONTE -> persone/AUTOMOBILI/TRENO. #line:094d834 
BARCA -> merci/vive. #line:0e16bac 

<<activity order odra_couples tutorial>>

docs.title: MAP_INTRO
docs.text:
//--------------------------------------------
// PART 3 – BIG MAP
//--------------------------------------------
group: Map
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: poland_river_map
---
<<card odra_river_map>>
ODRA è il secondo fiume della Polonia. #line:0ff7dfd 
<<card place_vistula_river>>
WISŁA è 1, la più lunga. #line:03fe124 
Entrambi sfociano nel MAR BALTICO. #line:0941615 

    <<jump MAP_ACTIVITY>>

docs.title: MAP_ACTIVITY
docs.text:
group: Map
tags: 
image: map_icons
---
<<card wroklaw_map>>
Tocca ODRA, WISŁA, BALTIC. #line:0ddc2c8 
Segui i FIUMI fino al MARE. #line:06237e3 

<<activity jigsaw_odra_map jigsaw_odra_map_done>>

docs.text:

---
Ottimo lavoro, esploratore del FIUME! #line:012f97c

<<card tumski_bridge>>
Questo CARTELLO blu significa FIUME. #line:0b583df

docs.title: quest_start
docs.text:
// pl_03 | Odra River (Wroclaw)
// PL_03 - A Voyage on the Odra River
// 
// ---------------------------------------------
// WANTED:
// cleancanvas odra_footbridge  — Clean the FOOTBRIDGE image; concept: BRIDGE for people (no CARS).
// memory odra_bridges          — Match BRIDGE types; concepts: TRAIN BRIDGE (tracks), ROAD BRIDGE (CARS).
// jigsawpuzzle odra_barge      — Rebuild BARGE image; concept: BOAT that carries GOODS.
// jigsawpuzzle odra_houseboat  — Rebuild HOUSEBOAT image; concept: BOAT for LIVING.
// order odra_couples           — Pair BRIDGES→(people/CARS/TRAIN) and BOATS→(goods/live).
// order odra_map_triplet       — Tap/sequence ODRA, WISŁA, BALTIC; concept: rivers flow to SEA.
// quiz odra_facts              — Final assessment (at least 2 Qs): ODRA→BALTIC, longest river=WISŁA.
// Words used: Odra, river, bridge, island , water, Wrocław, navigation, ecosystem
// INTRO – DOCK
group: Intro
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: odra_dock
color: red
---
Welcome to WROCŁAW in POLAND. #line:03f03fe 
<<card place_odra_river>>
This is the ODRA RIVER. #line:053bcb9 
Ready to explore? #line:06099c1

docs.title: quest_end
docs.text:
panel: panel_endgame
color: green
---
Great trip on the ODRA. #line:02a257c 
You saw BRIDGES and BOATS. #line:0925273 
You used a MAP and a QUIZ. #line:05d21d7 
Want an extra task? #line:0913f94 
<<jump post_quest_activity>>

docs.title: post_quest_activity
docs.text:
panel: panel
color: green
tags: proposal
---
Draw a simple MAP. #line:0265d07 
Mark ODRA and WISŁA. #line:08d1173 
Add one ROAD BRIDGE. #line:0b3ae20 
Add one TRAIN BRIDGE. #line:055fe3a 
Sketch a BARGE and a KAYAK. #line:0cd2507 
Show it to a friend. #line:0774214 
<<quest_end>>

docs.title: BRIDGES_INTRO
docs.text:
//--------------------------------------------
// PART 1 – CITY OF BRIDGES
//--------------------------------------------
group: Bridges
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: city_of_bridges
---
<<card bridge>>
WROCŁAW has many BRIDGES. #line:041a469 
<<card wroclaw_bridges>>
More than one hundred! #line:0522f41 
Let’s find three types. #line:04082d6

docs.title: BRIDGE_FOOT_HINT
docs.text:
group: Bridges
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: footbridge_view
---
<<card footbridge>>
FOOTBRIDGE is for people. #line:0d0c6ff 
Hint: no CARS on it. #line:057b7a9 

<<activity cleancanvas odra_footbridge tutorial>>

docs.title: BRIDGE_TRAIN_HINT
docs.text:
group: Bridges
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: railway_bridge
---
<<card train_bridge>>
TRAIN BRIDGE carries TRAINS. #line:04b8fb2 
Hint: look for TRACKS. #line:03bf613 

<<activity memory odra_bridges tutorial>>
Next: ROAD BRIDGE #line:08d07e5 
    <<jump BRIDGE_CAR_HINT>>

docs.title: BRIDGE_CAR_HINT
docs.text:
group: Bridges
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: road_bridge
---
<<card road_bridge>>
ROAD BRIDGE is for CARS. #line:0f6e252 
Hint: see CARS crossing. #line:03fcfdf 

<<activity memory odra_bridges tutorial>>

docs.title: BOATS_INTRO
docs.text:
//--------------------------------------------
// PART 2 – RIVER BOATS
//--------------------------------------------
group: Boats
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: odra_river_traffic
---
<<card boat>>
Many BOATS on the ODRA. #line:0eb639b 
<<card barge>>
Find a BARGE first. #line:0d21cc3 

Show me a BARGE #line:03495d2 
    <<jump BOAT_BARGE_HINT>>

docs.title: BOAT_BARGE_HINT
docs.text:
group: Boats
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: barge_photo
---
BARGE is low and flat. #line:028dcdf 
It carries GOODS. #line:083423e 

<<activity jigsawpuzzle odra_barge tutorial>>
Find a HOUSEBOAT #line:0a09f26

docs.title: BOAT_HOUSE_HINT
docs.text:
group: Boats
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: houseboat
---
<<card houseboat>>
HOUSEBOAT is for living. #line:0d77d00 
Windows like a small home. #line:0d30896 

<<activity jigsawpuzzle odra_houseboat tutorial>>

Show me a KAYAK #line:046e06a 
    <<jump BOAT_KAYAK_HINT>>
Ready to match #line:0b48adf 
    <<jump BOATS_MATCH>>

docs.title: BOAT_KAYAK_HINT
docs.text:
group: Boats
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: kayak
---
<<card kayak>>
KAYAK is small and light #line:06a76b7 
One person can paddle it. #line:0b0ccde 
Move fast on calm water. #line:0e4d09c

docs.title: BOATS_MATCH
docs.text:
group: Boats
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: odra_couples
---
Match things to jobs. #line:0d62913 
BRIDGE -> people/CARS/TRAIN. #line:094d834 
BOAT -> goods/live. #line:0e16bac 

<<activity order odra_couples tutorial>>

docs.title: MAP_INTRO
docs.text:
//--------------------------------------------
// PART 3 – BIG MAP
//--------------------------------------------
group: Map
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: poland_river_map
---
<<card odra_river_map>>
ODRA is Poland’s 2 RIVER. #line:0ff7dfd 
<<card place_vistula_river>>
WISŁA is 1, the longest. #line:03fe124 
Both flow to the BALTIC SEA. #line:0941615 

    <<jump MAP_ACTIVITY>>

docs.title: MAP_ACTIVITY
docs.text:
group: Map
tags: 
image: map_icons
---
<<card wroklaw_map>>
Tap ODRA, WISŁA, BALTIC. #line:0ddc2c8 
Follow RIVERS to the SEA. #line:06237e3 

<<activity jigsaw_odra_map jigsaw_odra_map_done>>

docs.title: jigsaw_odra_map_done
docs.text:
group: Map
---
Great work, RIVER explorer! #line:012f97c

docs.title: ENDING_DOCK
docs.text:
group: End
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: odra_sign
---
<<card tumski_bridge>>
This blue SIGN means RIVER. #line:0b583df 
<<card redzinski_bridge>>
You learned BRIDGES and BOATS. #line:0a2180f 
Ready for a quiz? #line:07d9d36 
<<jump FINAL_QUIZ>>

docs.title: FINAL_QUIZ
docs.text:
//--------------------------------------------
// FINAL QUIZ – ALWAYS LAST
//--------------------------------------------
group: End
tags: 
image: odra_quiz
---
Answer two questions. #line:0afcdc6 
Tap the best choice. #line:0c9b102 

<<activity order_odra_facts order_odra_facts_done>>

docs.title: order_odra_facts_done
docs.text:
group: End
tags: actor=BoatCaptain
image: quest_complete
---
Great work, RIVER explorer! #line:0117d8b 
See you on the next trip! #line:045c7d9 

<<jump quest_end>>

docs.title: spawned_child
docs.text:
///////// NPCs SPAWNED IN THE SCENE //////////
// these npc are spawned automatically in the scene
// each time you meet them they say one random line
group: Spawned
tags: actor=Child
---
I like the small KAYAK. #line:0f36b7f 
Paddle fast on calm water. #line:07ff8c5

docs.title: spawned_tourist
docs.text:
group: Spawned
tags: actor=Tourist
---
So many BRIDGES in this city. #line:0577d80 
My photo count is huge. #line:089ea37

docs.title: spawned_fisher
docs.text:
group: Spawned
tags: actor=Fisher
---
Quiet water is good for fish. #line:0207b2a 
I watch boats glide past. #line:04d0dac

docs.title: spawned_birdwatcher
docs.text:
group: Spawned
tags: actor=Birdwatcher
---
Birds rest on the old bridge. #line:05d28c9 
I note them in my book. #line:0b1b835

// memory odra_bridges          — Match BRIDGE types; concepts: TRAIN BRIDGE (tracks), ROAD BRIDGE (CARS).
// jigsawpuzzle odra_barge      — Rebuild BARGE image; concept: BOAT that carries GOODS.
// jigsawpuzzle odra_houseboat  — Rebuild HOUSEBOAT image; concept: BOAT for LIVING.
// order odra_couples           — Pair BRIDGES→(people/CARS/TRAIN) and BOATS→(goods/live).
// order odra_map_triplet       — Tap/sequence ODRA, WISŁA, BALTIC; concept: rivers flow to SEA.
// quiz odra_facts              — Final assessment (at least 2 Qs): ODRA→BALTIC, longest river=WISŁA.

Witamy we Wrocławiu w Polsce. #line:03f03fe

To jest RZEKA ODRA. #line:053bcb9

docs.text:

color: green

Świetna wycieczka ODRA. #line:02a257c 
Widziałeś MOSTY i ŁODZIE. #line:0925273 
Użyłeś MAPY i QUIZU. #line:05d21d7

Narysuj prostą MAPĘ. #line:0265d07

Dodaj jeden MOST DROGOWY. #line:0b3ae20

<<quest_end>>

Dalej: MOST DROGOWY #line:08d07e5

Znajdź łódź mieszkalną #line:0a09f26

<<jump FINAL_QUIZ>>

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: Poland - Wrocław

Découvrez la célèbre rivière Odra à Wrocław et les différents types de ponts et de bateaux qui font de cette rivière une artère animée de la ville.

docs.title: Content
docs.text: Subjects:

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Barge Un bateau long et plat qui transporte des marchandises sur les rivières.

Bateau Un véhicule qui se déplace sur l'eau.

Pont Une structure qui permet aux personnes ou aux véhicules de traverser l’eau.

Passerelle Un pont piétonnier. Interdit aux voitures.

Péniche Un bateau fait pour vivre.

Kayak Un petit bateau sur lequel on pagaie.

Rivière Odra Un grand fleuve de l'ouest de la Pologne. Il facilite la navigation et le commerce.

Pont Rędziński Le plus long pont à haubans de Pologne.

Pont routier Un pont pour voitures et bus.

Pont ferroviaire Un pont avec des voies pour les trains.

Pont de Tumski Un pont célèbre avec des cadenas d'amour et des lanternes à gaz.

La Vistule (Wisła) Le plus long fleuve de Pologne s'appelle Wisła ou Vistule. Il traverse Cracovie et Varsovie.

Ponts de Wrocław De nombreux ponts traversent la rivière Odra à Wrocław.

Map of Wroklaw A simple map of Wrocław showing the Odra River with its islands and many bridges

Odra river map A simple map that shows the Odra River in Poland and the way it flows to the Baltic Sea

docs.title: Game Design Notes
docs.text: Discover the famous Odra River in Wrocław and the different types of bridges and boats that make this river a bustling artery of the city.

docs.title: Knowledge Content
docs.text:
River Geography:

  • The Odra is the second biggest river in Poland (after the Wisła).
  • The Odra flows into the Baltic Sea.
  • Learn to recognize a standard European sign indicating a river

Urban Geography (Wrocław):

  • Wrocław has over 100 bridges.
  • Bridges have different functions: for cars, pedestrians (footbridges), and trains.
  • Rivers are used by different boats: for tourists, for living (houseboats), and for transporting goods (barges).

docs.title: Resources
docs.text:
Rędziński Bridge: Rędziński Bridge is the longest cable-stayed bridge in Poland, stretching across the Oder. It plays an important role in the city’s ring road system. Its modern design makes it a landmark of contemporary Wrocław.

Tumski Bridge: Tumski Bridge is famous for love padlocks and connects Ostrów Tumski with the city center. It’s a romantic spot for couples. In the evenings, it’s lit with gas lanterns.

Cargo Barage: A cargo barge is a flat-bottomed boat used to transport goods along rivers. These barges are still seen on the Oder today. They are essential for inland water transport.

Kayaks: Kayaks are popular for exploring Wrocław’s waterways and getting close to nature. Many people rent them for relaxing weekend trips. Paddling offers a peaceful view of the city from the water.

Tourist Boats: A tourist boat cruises the Oder River, offering scenic views of the city’s landmarks. It’s a great way to learn about Wrocław’s history. Guided tours are available in several languages.

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: Poland - Breslavia

Scoprite il famoso fiume Odra a Breslavia e i diversi tipi di ponti e imbarcazioni che rendono questo fiume un'arteria trafficata della città.

docs.title: Content
docs.text: Subjects:

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Chiatta Una lunga imbarcazione piatta che trasporta merci sui fiumi.

Barca Un veicolo che si muove sull'acqua.

Ponte Una struttura che consente alle persone o ai veicoli di attraversare l'acqua.

Passerella Un ponte su cui le persone possono camminare. Niente auto.

Casa galleggiante Una barca fatta per vivere.

Kayak Una piccola barca su cui si pagaia.

fiume Odra Un grande fiume nella Polonia occidentale. Aiuta le navi a viaggiare e commerciare.

Ponte Rędziński Il ponte strallato più lungo della Polonia.

Ponte stradale Un ponte per auto e autobus.

Ponte ferroviario Un ponte con binari per treni.

Ponte Tumski Un famoso ponte con lucchetti dell'amore e lanterne a gas.

fiume Vistola (Wisła) Il fiume più lungo della Polonia si chiama Wisła o Vistola. Scorre attraverso Cracovia e Varsavia.

Ponti di Breslavia A Breslavia ci sono molti ponti che attraversano il fiume Odra.

Map of Wroklaw A simple map of Wrocław showing the Odra River with its islands and many bridges

Odra river map A simple map that shows the Odra River in Poland and the way it flows to the Baltic Sea

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: Poland - Wroclaw

Discover the famous Odra River in Wrocław and the different types of bridges and boats that make this river a bustling artery of the city.

docs.title: Content
docs.text: Subjects:

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Barge A long, flat boat that carries goods on rivers.

Boat A vehicle that moves on water.

Bridge A structure that lets people or vehicles cross water.

Footbridge A bridge for people to walk on. No cars.

Houseboat A boat made to live on.

Kayak A small boat you paddle.

Odra River A big river in western Poland. It helps ships travel and trade.

Rędziński Bridge The longest cable‑stayed bridge in Poland.

Road Bridge A bridge for cars and buses.

Train Bridge A bridge with tracks for trains.

Tumski Bridge A famous bridge with love locks and gas lanterns.

Vistula River (Wisła) The longest river in Poland is called Wisła or Vistula. It flows through Kraków and Warsaw.

Wrocław Bridges Many bridges cross the Odra River in Wrocław.

Map of Wroklaw A simple map of Wrocław showing the Odra River with its islands and many bridges

Odra river map A simple map that shows the Odra River in Poland and the way it flows to the Baltic Sea

docs.title: Rzeka Odra (pl_03)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: Poland - Wroclaw

Odkryj słynną Odrę we Wrocławiu oraz różne rodzaje mostów i łodzi, które sprawiają, że rzeka ta jest tętniącą życiem arterią miasta.

docs.title: Content
docs.text: Subjects:

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Barka Długa, płaska łódź przeznaczona do transportu towarów po rzekach.

Łódź Pojazd poruszający się po wodzie.

Most Konstrukcja umożliwiająca ludziom lub pojazdom przekraczanie wody.

Kładka Most, po którym ludzie mogą chodzić. Bez samochodów.

Dom na wodzie Łódź stworzona do życia na niej.

Kajak Mała łódka, którą wiosłujesz.

Rzeka Odra Duża rzeka w zachodniej Polsce. Umożliwia statkom podróżowanie i handel.

Most Rędziński Najdłuższy most wantowy w Polsce.

Most drogowy Most dla samochodów i autobusów.

Most kolejowy Most z torami kolejowymi.

Most Tumski Słynny most z kłódkami symbolizującymi miłość i latarniami gazowymi.

Wisła (Wisła) Najdłuższa rzeka w Polsce nazywa się Wisła. Przepływa przez Kraków i Warszawę.

Mosty Wrocławskie We Wrocławiu nad Odrą przebiega wiele mostów.

Map of Wroklaw A simple map of Wrocław showing the Odra River with its islands and many bridges

Odra river map A simple map that shows the Odra River in Poland and the way it flows to the Baltic Sea

docs.title: Le zoo (pl_04) - Script
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

docs.title: quest_start
docs.text:
// pl_04 | Zoo (Wroclaw)
// 
type: panel
group: Intro
tags: actor=Man, 
image: centennial_hall_empty_flag
color: red
---
<<declare $talked_animals = false>>
Bienvenue au ZOO de WROCŁAW. #line:0fe55d1 
Il y a beaucoup d'ANIMAUX ici ! #line:005dd46

docs.title: quest_end
docs.text:
panel: panel_endgame
color: green
---
Cette quête est terminée. #line:0bcc257 
Vous avez appris des choses sur les ANIMAUX DU ZOO. #line:054cc37 
<<jump post_quest_activity>>

docs.title: post_quest_activity
docs.text:
panel: panel
color: green
tags: proposal
---
Dessine ton ANIMAL préféré. #line:0809ac5 
<<quest_end>>

docs.title: director_talk
docs.text:
group: Intro
tags: actor=Man, type:Panel
image: centennial_hall_empty_flag
---
<<if $talked_animals == true>>
    <<jump director_task_done>>
<<else>>
    <<jump director_task>>
<<endif>>

docs.title: director_task
docs.text:
group: Intro
tags: actor=Man, type:Panel
image: centennial_hall_empty_flag
color: green
---
Oh non ! Le DRAPEAU a disparu ! #line:09c6bf7 
<<camera_focus FlagPole>>
<<card iglica>>
C'était sur l'IGLICA au CENTENNIAL HALL. #line:02f35e4 
<<camera_reset>>
S'il vous plaît, aidez-moi à le trouver ! #line:0fd5d1a 
Parlez aux ANIMAUX. L'un d'eux pourrait l'avoir. #line:012b933 
<<task_start TASK_ANIMALS task_animals_done>>

docs.title: task_animals_desc
docs.text:
type: task
---
Trouvez le DRAPEAU ! #line:0da284c 
Parlez à tous les animaux. Peut-être savent-ils où se trouve le drapeau. #line:010adc5

docs.title: animal_peacock
docs.text:
//--------------------------------------------
// ENTRANCE – AMBIENCE
//--------------------------------------------
group: ZOO
tags: actor=Peacock
image: zoo_gate
---
Je n'ai pas besoin d'un DRAPEAU. #line:0085a8a 
Ma queue est un DRAPEAU ! #line:04fff6b

docs.title: animal_parrot
docs.text:
group: ZOO
tags: actor=Parrot
image: zoo_gate
---
Crac ! Rouge et jaune sont passés en courant ! #line:0e84545

docs.title: elephant_talk
docs.text:
// PART 1 – ELEPHANT
group: ELEPHANT
tags: actor=Keeper
image: elephant_keeper
color: blue
---
Je suis le plus grand ANIMAL terrestre. #line:027b51f 
<<card animal_elephant>>
J'ai une bonne MÉMOIRE. #line:03a150c 
Avez-vous une bonne MÉMOIRE ? #line:0f98478 
<<activity memory_elephant_settings elephant_activity_done>>

docs.title: elephant_activity_done
docs.text:
group: ELEPHANT
tags: actor=Keeper
image: elephant_keeper

---
<<inventory animal_elephant add>>
Un drapeau ? Je n'en ai pas. #line:0b79d01 
Si je le prenais, je m'en souviendrais ! #line:0f124bf

docs.title: ELEPHANT_SIGN
docs.text:
group: ELEPHANT
tags: actor=tutor
image: elephant_sign
---
ÉLÉPHANT. Peau épaisse. Grandes OREILLES. #line:048e8a1 
Le plus grand animal terrestre. #line:0b1cca2

docs.title: ELEPHANT_KID
docs.text:
group: ELEPHANT
tags: actor=KID
image: kid_elephant
---
Ses OREILLES sont plus grandes que moi ! #line:0fc78ad 
Est-ce que ça peut me ventiler en été ? #line:004abc7

docs.title: giraffe_talk
docs.text:
// PART 2 – GIRAFFE
group: GIRAFFE
tags: actor=Keeper
image: giraffe_keeper
color: blue
---
Je suis l'ANIMAL le plus grand. #line:0d5c607 
Mon long COU m'aide à atteindre les feuilles. #line:0a4d24e 
Je mange des feuilles d'ACAILLON ! #line:04b42f2 
<<activity canvas_giraffe_settings giraffe_activity_done>>

docs.title: giraffe_activity_done
docs.text:
group: GIRAFFE
tags: actor=Keeper
image: giraffe_keeper
---
<<inventory animal_elephant add>>
Je n'ai pas pris le DRAPEAU. #line:0877d6f 
C'est trop haut pour moi ! #line:02d00e2

docs.title: GIRAFFE_SIGN
docs.text:
group: GIRAFFE
tags: actor=Sign
image: giraffe_sign
---
GIRAFE. Grande. Long COU. #line:0a8a73f 
CILS longs. #line:0291317

docs.title: GIRAFFE_KID
docs.text:
group: GIRAFFE
tags: actor=KID
image: kid_giraffe
---
Avec un COU comme ça ! #line:068daeb 
Je pouvais voir ma maison d'ici. #line:0bee484

docs.title: lion_talk
docs.text:
// PART 3 – LION
group: LION
tags: actor=Keeper
image: lion_keeper
color: blue
---
Je suis un LION en AFRIQUE. #line:07f2e15 
<<card  animal_lion>>
Je vis dans un PRIDE. #line:042266c 
Regardez ce petit ourson ! #line:0124e1c 
<<card  animal_lion_cub>>
[MISSING TRANSLATION: I grow up small, then medium, then old...] #line:0774b92 
<<activity order_lion_settings lion_activity_done>>

docs.title: lion_activity_done
docs.text:
group: LION
tags: actor=Keeper
image: lion_keeper
---
<<inventory animal_lion add>>
Vous devez trouver le DRAPEAU ! #line:05da6d7 
J'aime le regarder dans le vent. #line:01b3593

docs.title: LION_SIGN
docs.text:
group: LION
tags: actor=Sign
image: lion_sign
---
LION. ORGUEIL = famille de lions. #line:0ac6cc0 
Les mâles ont des CRINIÈRES. #line:0d2883b

docs.title: LION_KID
docs.text:
group: LION
tags: actor=KID
image: kid_lion
---
Quel rugissement ! #line:079f4e0

docs.title: monkey_talk
docs.text:
// PART 4 – MONKEY
group: MONKEY
tags: actor=Keeper
image: monkey_keeper
color: blue
---
Je suis un SINGE. Je grimpe aux ARBRES. #line:0867233 
Nous sommes proches des HUMAINS ! #line:0eaefd6 
Où ai-je trouvé ces FRUITS ? #line:079451b 
<<activity match_monkey_settings monkey_activity_done>>

docs.title: monkey_activity_done
docs.text:
group: MONKEY
tags: actor=Keeper
image: monkey_keeper

---
<<inventory animal_monkey add>>
Je n'ai pas pris le DRAPEAU. #line:0c53945 
Ce serait amusant de grimper sur ce poteau. #line:0a43c85

docs.title: MONKEY_SIGN
docs.text:
group: MONKEY
tags: actor=Sign
image: monkey_sign
---
SINGE. Grand GRIMPEUR. #line:0900219 
Aime les FRUITS. #line:021b299

docs.title: MONKEY_KID
docs.text:
group: MONKEY
tags: actor=KID
image: kid_monkey
---
Il a copié ma danse ! #line:0bf2346 
Les SINGES font-ils des clins d’œil ? #line:0eecdf9

docs.title: penguin_talk
docs.text:
// PART 5 – PENGUIN
group: PENGUIN
tags: actor=Keeper
image: penguin_keeper
color: blue
---
Je suis un PINGOUIN, un OISEAU étrange. #line:08c70e8 
Je ne sais pas voler, mais je nage bien ! #line:0540c5a 
Pouvez-vous trouver le chemin dans ICE ? #line:0a3420c 
<<activity jigsaw_penguin_settings penguin_activity_done>>

docs.title: penguin_activity_done
docs.text:
group: PENGUIN
tags: actor=Keeper
image: penguin_keeper
---
<<inventory animal_penguin add>>
Non, je n'ai pas pris le DRAPEAU. #line:078190f 
Je ne peux pas voler, tu te souviens ? #line:08568f5

docs.title: PENGUIN_SIGN
docs.text:
group: PENGUIN
tags: actor=Tutor
image: penguin_sign
---
PINGOUIN. Oiseau. Nageur. #line:0877d95 
Vit près des OCÉANS. #line:0eac350

docs.title: PENGUIN_KID
docs.text:
group: PENGUIN
tags: actor=KID
image: kid_penguin
---
Comme c'est mignon ! #line:0ae73f3 
Ça a l'air soigné. #line:05ac327

docs.title: task_animals_done
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR
---
TÂCHE ACCOMPLIE ! Retournez voir le DIRECTEUR. #line:0a93d9b 
<<set $talked_animals = true>>

docs.title: director_task_done
docs.text:
group: Intro
tags: actor=Man
image: centennial_hall_empty_flag
color: purple
---
Bien. Tu as parlé à tous les ANIMAUX. #line:032811f 
Passons maintenant en revue les faits. #line:0364f30 
Aidez-moi à assembler les pièces. #line:08de86f 
<<activity jigsaw_zoo_settings director_activity_done>>

docs.title: RECAP_CARDS
docs.text:
group: Icebox
tags: actor=Narrator
image: zoo_cards
---
Associez maintenant les CARTES. #line:0f6f882 
<<activity memory zoo_animal_cards tutorial>>

docs.title: director_activity_done
docs.text:
tags: actor=Narrator
image: zoo_recap
---
Tous les ANIMAUX sont innocents. #line:0bc2b46 
Qui a pris le DRAPEAU ? #line:0fc0ab7 
<<SetActive Antura with Flag>>
<<jump RETURN_DIRECTOR>>

docs.title: RETURN_DIRECTOR
docs.text:
// TWIST – FLAG RETURN
group: End
tags: actor=ZooDirector
image: centennial_hall_antura_flag
---
Attends, regarde ! #line:0b3d05f 
<<camera_focus Antura with Flag>>
ANTURA a le DRAPEAU ! #line:0e24973 
<<camera_reset>>
<<jump CEREMONY_END>>

docs.title: CEREMONY_END
docs.text:
group: End
tags: actor=ZooDirector
image: flag_on_iglica
---
Le DRAPEAU est chez nous. #line:0d91701 
Merci, aide. #line:08c71db 
<<jump quest_end>>

docs.text:
group: Intro
tags: actor=Man, type:Panel
image: centennial_hall_empty_flag
color: green
---
Oh no! Manca la BANDIERA! #line:09c6bf7 
<<camera_focus FlagPole>>
<<card iglica>>
Era sull'IGLICA al CENTENNIAL HALL. #line:02f35e4 
<<camera_reset>>
Per favore aiutatemi a trovarlo! #line:0fd5d1a

<<task_start TASK_ANIMALS task_animals_done>>

docs.title: task_animals_desc
docs.text:
type: task
---
Trova la BANDIERA! #line:0da284c 
Parla con tutti gli animali. Forse sanno dov'è la bandiera. #line:010adc5

docs.title: animal_peacock
docs.text:
//--------------------------------------------
// ENTRANCE – AMBIENCE
//--------------------------------------------
group: ZOO
tags: actor=Peacock
image: zoo_gate
---
Non ho bisogno di una BANDIERA. #line:0085a8a 
La mia coda è una BANDIERA! #line:04fff6b

docs.title: animal_parrot
docs.text:
group: ZOO
tags: actor=Parrot
image: zoo_gate
---
Squawk! Rosso e giallo corrono via! #line:0e84545

docs.title: elephant_talk
docs.text:
// PART 1 – ELEPHANT
group: ELEPHANT
tags: actor=Keeper
image: elephant_keeper
color: blue
---
Sono il più grande ANIMALE terrestre. #line:027b51f 
<<card animal_elephant>>
Ho una buona MEMORIA. #line:03a150c 
Hai una buona MEMORIA? #line:0f98478 
<<activity memory_elephant_settings elephant_activity_done>>

docs.title: elephant_activity_done
docs.text:
group: ELEPHANT
tags: actor=Keeper
image: elephant_keeper

---
<<inventory animal_elephant add>>
UNA BANDIERA? Non ce l'ho. #line:0b79d01 
Se lo prendessi me lo ricorderei! #line:0f124bf

docs.title: ELEPHANT_SIGN
docs.text:
group: ELEPHANT
tags: actor=tutor
image: elephant_sign
---
ELEFANTE. Pelle spessa. ORECCHIE grandi. #line:048e8a1 
Il più grande ANIMALE terrestre. #line:0b1cca2

docs.title: ELEPHANT_KID
docs.text:
group: ELEPHANT
tags: actor=KID
image: kid_elephant
---
Le sue ORECCHIE sono più grandi di me! #line:0fc78ad 
Può ventilarmi d'estate? #line:004abc7

docs.title: giraffe_talk
docs.text:
// PART 2 – GIRAFFE
group: GIRAFFE
tags: actor=Keeper
image: giraffe_keeper
color: blue
---
Sono l'ANIMALE più alto. #line:0d5c607 
Il mio lungo COLLO mi aiuta a raggiungere le foglie. #line:0a4d24e 
Io mangio le foglie di AMICA! #line:04b42f2 
<<activity canvas_giraffe_settings giraffe_activity_done>>

docs.title: giraffe_activity_done
docs.text:
group: GIRAFFE
tags: actor=Keeper
image: giraffe_keeper
---
<<inventory animal_elephant add>>
Non ho preso la BANDIERA. #line:0877d6f 
Per me è troppo alto! #line:02d00e2

docs.title: GIRAFFE_SIGN
docs.text:
group: GIRAFFE
tags: actor=Sign
image: giraffe_sign
---
GIRAFFA. Alta. Collo lungo. #line:0a8a73f 
CIGLIA lunghe. #line:0291317

docs.title: GIRAFFE_KID
docs.text:
group: GIRAFFE
tags: actor=KID
image: kid_giraffe
---
Con un COLLO così! #line:068daeb 
Da qui potevo vedere la mia casa. #line:0bee484

docs.title: lion_talk
docs.text:
// PART 3 – LION
group: LION
tags: actor=Keeper
image: lion_keeper
color: blue
---
Sono un LEONE in AFRICA. #line:07f2e15 
<<card  animal_lion>>
Vivo in un PRIDE. #line:042266c 
Guarda questo piccolo CUB! #line:0124e1c 
<<card  animal_lion_cub>>
[MISSING TRANSLATION: I grow up small, then medium, then old...] #line:0774b92 
<<activity order_lion_settings lion_activity_done>>

docs.title: lion_activity_done
docs.text:
group: LION
tags: actor=Keeper
image: lion_keeper
---
<<inventory animal_lion add>>
Devi trovare la BANDIERA! #line:05da6d7 
Mi piace guardarlo nel vento. #line:01b3593

docs.title: LION_SIGN
docs.text:
group: LION
tags: actor=Sign
image: lion_sign
---
LEONE. ORGOGLIO = famiglia di leoni. #line:0ac6cc0 
I maschi hanno le CRINE. #line:0d2883b

docs.title: LION_KID
docs.text:
group: LION
tags: actor=KID
image: kid_lion
---
Che boato! #line:079f4e0

docs.title: monkey_talk
docs.text:
// PART 4 – MONKEY
group: MONKEY
tags: actor=Keeper
image: monkey_keeper
color: blue
---
Sono una SCIMMIA. Mi arrampico sugli ALBERI. #line:0867233 
Siamo vicini agli UMANI! #line:0eaefd6 
Dove ho preso questa FRUTTA? #line:079451b 
<<activity match_monkey_settings monkey_activity_done>>

docs.title: monkey_activity_done
docs.text:
group: MONKEY
tags: actor=Keeper
image: monkey_keeper

---
<<inventory animal_monkey add>>
Non ho preso la BANDIERA. #line:0c53945 
Sarebbe divertente arrampicarsi su quel palo. #line:0a43c85

docs.title: MONKEY_SIGN
docs.text:
group: MONKEY
tags: actor=Sign
image: monkey_sign
---
SCIMMIA. Grande ARRAMPICATORE. #line:0900219 
Ama la FRUTTA. #line:021b299

docs.title: MONKEY_KID
docs.text:
group: MONKEY
tags: actor=KID
image: kid_monkey
---
Ha copiato la mia danza! #line:0bf2346 
Le SCIMMIE fanno l'occhiolino? #line:0eecdf9

docs.title: penguin_talk
docs.text:
// PART 5 – PENGUIN
group: PENGUIN
tags: actor=Keeper
image: penguin_keeper
color: blue
---
Sono un PINGUINO, uno strano UCCELLO. #line:08c70e8 
Non so volare, ma nuoto bene! #line:0540c5a 
Riesci a trovare il percorso in ICE? #line:0a3420c 
<<activity jigsaw_penguin_settings penguin_activity_done>>

docs.title: penguin_activity_done
docs.text:
group: PENGUIN
tags: actor=Keeper
image: penguin_keeper
---
<<inventory animal_penguin add>>
No, non ho preso la BANDIERA. #line:078190f 
Non so volare, ricordi? #line:08568f5

docs.title: PENGUIN_SIGN
docs.text:
group: PENGUIN
tags: actor=Tutor
image: penguin_sign
---
PINGUINO. Uccello. Nuotatore. #line:0877d95 
Vive vicino agli OCEANI. #line:0eac350

docs.title: PENGUIN_KID
docs.text:
group: PENGUIN
tags: actor=KID
image: kid_penguin
---
Che carino! #line:0ae73f3 
Sembra ordinato. #line:05ac327

docs.title: task_animals_done
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR
---
COMPITO COMPIUTO! Torna dal REGISTA. #line:0a93d9b 
<<set $talked_animals = true>>

docs.title: director_task_done
docs.text:
group: Intro
tags: actor=Man
image: centennial_hall_empty_flag
color: purple
---
Bene. Hai parlato con tutti gli ANIMALI. #line:032811f 
Ora passiamo in rassegna i fatti. #line:0364f30 
Aiutami a mettere insieme i pezzi. #line:08de86f 
<<activity jigsaw_zoo_settings director_activity_done>>

docs.title: RECAP_CARDS
docs.text:
group: Icebox
tags: actor=Narrator
image: zoo_cards
---
Ora abbina le CARTE. #line:0f6f882 
<<activity memory zoo_animal_cards tutorial>>

docs.title: director_activity_done
docs.text:
tags: actor=Narrator
image: zoo_recap
---
Tutti gli ANIMALI sono innocenti. #line:0bc2b46 
Chi ha preso la BANDIERA? #line:0fc0ab7 
<<SetActive Antura with Flag>>
<<jump RETURN_DIRECTOR>>

docs.title: RETURN_DIRECTOR
docs.text:
// TWIST – FLAG RETURN
group: End
tags: actor=ZooDirector
image: centennial_hall_antura_flag
---
Aspetta, guarda! #line:0b3d05f 
<<camera_focus Antura with Flag>>
ANTURA ha la BANDIERA! #line:0e24973 
<<camera_reset>>
<<jump CEREMONY_END>>

docs.title: CEREMONY_END
docs.text:
group: End
tags: actor=ZooDirector
image: flag_on_iglica
---
La FLAG è casa. #line:0d91701 
Grazie, aiutante. #line:08c71db 
<<jump quest_end>>

group: Intro
tags: actor=Man, type:Panel
image: centennial_hall_empty_flag
color: green
---
Oh no! The FLAG is missing! #line:09c6bf7 
<<camera_focus FlagPole>>
<<card iglica>>
It was on the IGLICA at CENTENNIAL HALL. #line:02f35e4 
<<camera_reset>>
Please help me find it! #line:0fd5d1a 
Talk to ANIMALS. One may have it. #line:012b933

docs.title: task_animals_desc
docs.text:
type: task
---
Find the FLAG! #line:0da284c 
Talk to all the animals. Maybe they know where the flag is. #line:010adc5

docs.title: animal_peacock
docs.text:
//--------------------------------------------
// ENTRANCE – AMBIENCE
//--------------------------------------------
group: ZOO
tags: actor=Peacock
image: zoo_gate
---
I do not need a FLAG. #line:0085a8a 
My tail is a FLAG! #line:04fff6b

docs.title: animal_parrot
docs.text:
group: ZOO
tags: actor=Parrot
image: zoo_gate
---
Squawk! Red and yellow ran by! #line:0e84545

docs.title: elephant_talk
docs.text:
// PART 1 – ELEPHANT
group: ELEPHANT
tags: actor=Keeper
image: elephant_keeper
color: blue
---
I am the biggest land ANIMAL. #line:027b51f 
<<card animal_elephant>>
I have good MEMORY. #line:03a150c 
Do you have good MEMORY? #line:0f98478 
<<activity memory_elephant_settings elephant_activity_done>>

docs.title: elephant_activity_done
docs.text:
group: ELEPHANT
tags: actor=Keeper
image: elephant_keeper

---
<<inventory animal_elephant add>>
A FLAG? I do not have it. #line:0b79d01 
If I took it I would remember! #line:0f124bf

docs.title: ELEPHANT_SIGN
docs.text:
group: ELEPHANT
tags: actor=tutor
image: elephant_sign
---
ELEPHANT. Thick skin. Big EARS. #line:048e8a1 
Largest land ANIMAL. #line:0b1cca2

docs.title: ELEPHANT_KID
docs.text:
group: ELEPHANT
tags: actor=KID
image: kid_elephant
---
Its EARS are bigger than me! #line:0fc78ad 
Can it fan me in summer? #line:004abc7

docs.title: giraffe_talk
docs.text:
// PART 2 – GIRAFFE
group: GIRAFFE
tags: actor=Keeper
image: giraffe_keeper
color: blue
---
I am the tallest ANIMAL. #line:0d5c607 
My long NECK helps me reach leaves. #line:0a4d24e 
I eat WATTLE leaves! #line:04b42f2 
<<activity canvas_giraffe_settings giraffe_activity_done>>

docs.title: giraffe_activity_done
docs.text:
group: GIRAFFE
tags: actor=Keeper
image: giraffe_keeper
---
<<inventory animal_elephant add>>
I did not take the FLAG. #line:0877d6f 
It is too high for me! #line:02d00e2

docs.title: GIRAFFE_SIGN
docs.text:
group: GIRAFFE
tags: actor=Sign
image: giraffe_sign
---
GIRAFFE. Tall. Long NECK. #line:0a8a73f 
Long EYELASHES. #line:0291317

docs.title: GIRAFFE_KID
docs.text:
group: GIRAFFE
tags: actor=KID
image: kid_giraffe
---
With a NECK like that! #line:068daeb 
I could see my house from here. #line:0bee484

docs.title: lion_talk
docs.text:
// PART 3 – LION
group: LION
tags: actor=Keeper
image: lion_keeper
color: blue
---
I am a LION in AFRICA. #line:07f2e15 
<<card  animal_lion>>
I live in a PRIDE. #line:042266c 
Look at this small CUB! #line:0124e1c 
<<card  animal_lion_cub>>
I grow up small, then medium, then old... #line:0774b92 
<<activity order_lion_settings lion_activity_done>>

docs.title: lion_activity_done
docs.text:
group: LION
tags: actor=Keeper
image: lion_keeper
---
<<inventory animal_lion add>>
You must find the FLAG! #line:05da6d7 
I like watching it in wind. #line:01b3593

docs.title: LION_SIGN
docs.text:
group: LION
tags: actor=Sign
image: lion_sign
---
LION. PRIDE = family of lions. #line:0ac6cc0 
Males have MANES. #line:0d2883b

docs.title: LION_KID
docs.text:
group: LION
tags: actor=KID
image: kid_lion
---
What a roar! #line:079f4e0

docs.title: monkey_talk
docs.text:
// PART 4 – MONKEY
group: MONKEY
tags: actor=Keeper
image: monkey_keeper
color: blue
---
I am a MONKEY. I climb TREES. #line:0867233 
We are close to HUMANS! #line:0eaefd6 
Where did I get these FRUITS? #line:079451b 
<<activity match_monkey_settings monkey_activity_done>>

docs.title: monkey_activity_done
docs.text:
group: MONKEY
tags: actor=Keeper
image: monkey_keeper

---
<<inventory animal_monkey add>>
I did not take the FLAG. #line:0c53945 
It would be fun to climb that pole. #line:0a43c85

docs.title: MONKEY_SIGN
docs.text:
group: MONKEY
tags: actor=Sign
image: monkey_sign
---
MONKEY. Great CLIMBER. #line:0900219 
Loves FRUIT. #line:021b299

docs.title: MONKEY_KID
docs.text:
group: MONKEY
tags: actor=KID
image: kid_monkey
---
He copied my dance! #line:0bf2346 
Do MONKEYS wink? #line:0eecdf9

docs.title: penguin_talk
docs.text:
// PART 5 – PENGUIN
group: PENGUIN
tags: actor=Keeper
image: penguin_keeper
color: blue
---
I am a PENGUIN, a strange BIRD. #line:08c70e8 
I can't fly, but I swim well! #line:0540c5a 
Can you find the path in ICE? #line:0a3420c 
<<activity jigsaw_penguin_settings penguin_activity_done>>

docs.title: penguin_activity_done
docs.text:

tags: actor=Keeper
image: penguin_keeper
---
<<inventory animal_penguin add>>
No, I did not take the FLAG. #line:078190f 
I can't fly, remember? #line:08568f5

docs.title: PENGUIN_SIGN
docs.text:
group: PENGUIN
tags: actor=Tutor
image: penguin_sign
---
PENGUIN. Bird. Swimmer. #line:0877d95 
Lives near OCEANS. #line:0eac350

docs.title: PENGUIN_KID
docs.text:
group: PENGUIN
tags: actor=KID
image: kid_penguin
---
How cute! #line:0ae73f3 
It looks neat. #line:05ac327

docs.title: task_animals_done
docs.text:

---
TASK DONE! Go back to the DIRECTOR. #line:0a93d9b 
<<set $talked_animals = true>>

tags: actor=Man
image: centennial_hall_empty_flag
color: purple

<<activity jigsaw_zoo_settings director_activity_done>>

docs.text:
tags: actor=Narrator
image: zoo_recap
---
All ANIMALS are innocent. #line:0bc2b46 
Who took the FLAG? #line:0fc0ab7 
<<SetActive Antura with Flag>>
<<jump RETURN_DIRECTOR>>

docs.title: RETURN_DIRECTOR
docs.text:
// TWIST – FLAG RETURN
group: End
tags: actor=ZooDirector
image: centennial_hall_antura_flag
---
Wait, look! #line:0b3d05f 
<<camera_focus Antura with Flag>>
ANTURA has the FLAG! #line:0e24973 
<<camera_reset>>
<<jump CEREMONY_END>>

docs.title: CEREMONY_END
docs.text:
group: End
tags: actor=ZooDirector
image: flag_on_iglica
---
The FLAG is home. #line:0d91701 
Thank you, helper. #line:08c71db 
<<jump quest_end>>

---
Jestem najwyższym ZWIERZĘCIEM. #line:0d5c607 
Moja długa SZYJA pomaga mi dosięgnąć liści. #line:0a4d24e 
Jem liście akacji! #line:04b42f2 
<<activity canvas_giraffe_settings giraffe_activity_done>>

docs.title: giraffe_activity_done
docs.text:
group: GIRAFFE
tags: actor=Keeper
image: giraffe_keeper
---
<<inventory animal_elephant add>>
Nie wziąłem FLAG-a. #line:0877d6f 
To jest dla mnie za wysoko! #line:02d00e2

docs.title: GIRAFFE_SIGN
docs.text:
group: GIRAFFE
tags: actor=Sign
image: giraffe_sign
---
ŻYRAFA. Wysoka. Długa szyja. #line:0a8a73f 
Długie RZĘSY. #line:0291317

docs.title: GIRAFFE_KID
docs.text:
group: GIRAFFE
tags: actor=KID
image: kid_giraffe
---
Z taką SZYJĄ! #line:068daeb 
Stąd mogłem widzieć swój dom. #line:0bee484

docs.title: lion_talk
docs.text:
// PART 3 – LION
group: LION
tags: actor=Keeper
image: lion_keeper
color: blue
---
Jestem LWEM w AFRYCE. #line:07f2e15 
<<card  animal_lion>>
Żyję w DUMIE. #line:042266c 
Spójrz na to małe CUB! #line:0124e1c 
<<card  animal_lion_cub>>
[MISSING TRANSLATION: I grow up small, then medium, then old...] #line:0774b92 
<<activity order_lion_settings lion_activity_done>>

docs.title: lion_activity_done
docs.text:
group: LION
tags: actor=Keeper
image: lion_keeper
---
<<inventory animal_lion add>>
Musisz znaleźć FLAGĘ! #line:05da6d7 
Lubię patrzeć na niego na wietrze. #line:01b3593

docs.title: LION_SIGN
docs.text:
group: LION
tags: actor=Sign
image: lion_sign
---
LEW. DUMA = rodzina lwów. #line:0ac6cc0 
Samce mają GRZYWY. #line:0d2883b

docs.title: LION_KID
docs.text:
group: LION
tags: actor=KID
image: kid_lion
---
Cóż za ryk! #line:079f4e0

docs.title: monkey_talk
docs.text:
// PART 4 – MONKEY
group: MONKEY
tags: actor=Keeper
image: monkey_keeper
color: blue
---
Jestem MAŁPĄ. Wspinam się na drzewa. #line:0867233 
Jesteśmy blisko LUDZI! #line:0eaefd6 
Gdzie dostałem te OWOCE? #line:079451b 
<<activity match_monkey_settings monkey_activity_done>>

docs.title: monkey_activity_done
docs.text:
group: MONKEY
tags: actor=Keeper
image: monkey_keeper

---
<<inventory animal_monkey add>>
Nie wziąłem FLAG-a. #line:0c53945 
Byłoby fajnie wspiąć się na ten słup. #line:0a43c85

docs.title: MONKEY_SIGN
docs.text:
group: MONKEY
tags: actor=Sign
image: monkey_sign
---
MAŁPA. Świetny WSPINACZ. #line:0900219 
Uwielbia OWOCE. #line:021b299

docs.title: MONKEY_KID
docs.text:
group: MONKEY
tags: actor=KID
image: kid_monkey
---
Skopiował mój taniec! #line:0bf2346 
Czy MAŁPY mrugają? #line:0eecdf9

docs.title: penguin_talk
docs.text:
// PART 5 – PENGUIN
group: PENGUIN
tags: actor=Keeper
image: penguin_keeper
color: blue
---
Jestem PINGWINEM, dziwnym PTAKEM. #line:08c70e8 
Nie umiem latać, ale dobrze pływam! #line:0540c5a 
Czy potrafisz znaleźć ścieżkę w ICE? #line:0a3420c 
<<activity jigsaw_penguin_settings penguin_activity_done>>

docs.title: penguin_activity_done
docs.text:
group: PENGUIN
tags: actor=Keeper
image: penguin_keeper
---
<<inventory animal_penguin add>>
Nie, nie wziąłem FLAG-a. #line:078190f 
Nie potrafię latać, pamiętasz? #line:08568f5

docs.title: PENGUIN_SIGN
docs.text:
group: PENGUIN
tags: actor=Tutor
image: penguin_sign
---
PINGWIN. Ptak. Pływak. #line:0877d95 
Mieszka w pobliżu OCEANÓW. #line:0eac350

docs.title: PENGUIN_KID
docs.text:
group: PENGUIN
tags: actor=KID
image: kid_penguin
---
Jakie słodkie! #line:0ae73f3 
Wygląda fajnie. #line:05ac327

docs.title: task_animals_done
docs.text:
tags: actor=TUTOR
---
ZADANIE WYKONANE! Wróć do DYREKTORA. #line:0a93d9b 
<<set $talked_animals = true>>

docs.title: director_task_done
docs.text:
group: Intro
tags: actor=Man
image: centennial_hall_empty_flag
color: purple
---
Dobrze. Rozmawiałeś ze WSZYSTKIMI ZWIERZĘTAMI. #line:032811f 
Teraz przyjrzyjmy się faktom. #line:0364f30 
Pomóż mi złożyć wszystko w całość. #line:08de86f 
<<activity jigsaw_zoo_settings director_activity_done>>

docs.title: RECAP_CARDS
docs.text:
group: Icebox
tags: actor=Narrator
image: zoo_cards
---
Teraz dopasuj KARTY. #line:0f6f882 
<<activity memory zoo_animal_cards tutorial>>

docs.title: director_activity_done
docs.text:
tags: actor=Narrator
image: zoo_recap
---
Wszystkie ZWIERZĘTA są niewinne. #line:0bc2b46 
Kto wziął FLAGĘ? #line:0fc0ab7 
<<SetActive Antura with Flag>>
<<jump RETURN_DIRECTOR>>

docs.title: RETURN_DIRECTOR
docs.text:
// TWIST – FLAG RETURN
group: End
tags: actor=ZooDirector
image: centennial_hall_antura_flag
---
Poczekaj, spójrz! #line:0b3d05f 
<<camera_focus Antura with Flag>>
ANTURA ma FLAGĘ! #line:0e24973 
<<camera_reset>>
<<jump CEREMONY_END>>

docs.title: CEREMONY_END
docs.text:
group: End
tags: actor=ZooDirector
image: flag_on_iglica
---
FLAG jest domem. #line:0d91701 
Dziękuję, pomocniku. #line:08c71db 
<<jump quest_end>>

Explorez le célèbre zoo de Wrocław

docs.title: Content
docs.text: Subjects:

docs.title: Zoo Animals
docs.text:
• Zoo Animals Auto-created card for topic 'Zoo Animals'.
  • Girafe Un animal très grand avec un long cou. Les girafes sont plus hautes que les arbres ! Elles mangent des feuilles inaccessibles aux autres animaux.
  • Lion Un grand félin surnommé le roi des animaux. Il vit en groupes appelés troupes.
  • Singe Un animal intelligent qui peut grimper et jouer. Certains singes vivent en grandes familles.
  • Manchot Un oiseau qui ne peut pas voler mais qui nage très bien. Il vit dans les régions froides.
  • Éléphant Un gros animal avec une trompe. Les éléphants sont les plus grands animaux terrestres. Ils ont de grandes oreilles et adorent arroser !

docs.title: wroclaw zoo
docs.text:
• Zoo de Wrocław Un grand zoo à Wrocław avec de nombreux animaux à découvrir.
  • Gardien de zoo Une personne qui s'occupe des animaux au zoo.
  • Enclos pour animaux Un espace sûr conçu pour que les animaux puissent vivre au zoo.
  • Directeur du zoo La personne qui dirige le zoo et aide les visiteurs.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Louveteau Un bébé lion.

Église Une grande sculpture en métal à côté du Centennial Hall.

Perroquet Un oiseau brillant qui peut copier des sons.

Paon Un oiseau coloré avec une grande queue de plumes.

Signe Un tableau avec des faits simples pour vous aider à apprendre.

Wrocław Une ville de Pologne avec des rivières, des ponts et de l'histoire.

Drapeau de Wrocław Le drapeau de la ville qu'il faut retrouver et restituer.

docs.title: Game Design Notes
docs.text:
Mission The player must act as a detective to find the missing flag of Wrocław. The core gameplay involves visiting five different animal enclosures at the ZOO. To clear each animal as a suspect, the player must complete a unique, themed mini-game. After eliminating all animal suspects, the true culprit is revealed, and the player must retrieve the flag and return it to its rightful place.

Character

The ZOO Director: The character who gives the mission and provides information. The Animals: An Elephant, a Giraffe, a Lion, a Monkey, and a Penguin, each with their own personality and mini-game.

docs.title: Knowledge content
docs.text:
Famous Landmarks:

  • To recognize the Centennial Hall (a UNESCO World Heritage site),
  • the Iglica sculpture
  • the Wrocław ZOO

Animal Vocabulary & Facts: To learn the names of five animals and a fun fact about each, such as:

  • Elephants have excellent memories, Pachyderm = thick Skin, Largest land animal
  • Giraffes are the world's tallest mammals.
  • Lions are close relatives of cats that live in groups called prides.
  • Monkeys are excellent climbers.
  • Penguins are birds that do not fly, but they are expert swimmers.

docs.title: Zoo Animals

• Zoo Animals Auto-created card for topic 'Zoo Animals'.
  • Giraffa Un animale molto alto con un collo lungo. Le giraffe sono più alte degli alberi! Mangiano foglie che altri animali non possono raggiungere.
  • Leone Un grosso felino chiamato il re degli animali. Vive in gruppi chiamati branchi.
  • Scimmia Un animale intelligente che sa arrampicarsi e giocare. Alcune scimmie vivono in famiglie numerose.
  • Pinguino Un uccello che non sa volare ma nuota molto bene. Vive in luoghi freddi.
  • Elefante Un grosso animale con una proboscide. Gli elefanti sono gli animali più grandi che camminano sulla terraferma. Hanno grandi orecchie e amano spruzzare acqua!

  • Direttore dello zoo La persona che gestisce lo zoo e aiuta i visitatori.

docs.title: Content
docs.text: Subjects:

docs.title: Zoo Animals
docs.text:
• Zoo Animals Auto-created card for topic 'Zoo Animals'.
  • Giraffe A very tall animal with a long neck. Giraffes are taller than trees! They eat leaves that other animals cannot reach.
  • Lion A big cat called the king of animals. It lives in groups called prides.
  • Monkey A smart animal that can climb and play. Some monkeys live in big families.
  • Penguin A bird that cannot fly but swims very well. It lives in cold places.
  • Elephant A big animal with a trunk. Elephants are the biggest animals that walk on land. They have big ears and love to spray water!

docs.title: wroclaw zoo
docs.text:
• Wrocław Zoo A big zoo in Wrocław with many animals to learn about.
  • Zoo Keeper A person who cares for animals at the zoo.
  • Animal Enclosure A safe space made for animals to live at the zoo.
  • Zoo Director The person who runs the zoo and helps visitors.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Cub A baby lion.

Iglica A tall metal sculpture next to Centennial Hall.

Parrot A bright bird that can copy sounds.

Peacock A colorful bird with a big tail of feathers.

Sign A board with simple facts to help you learn.

Wrocław A city in Poland with rivers, bridges, and history.

Wrocław Flag The city flag that must be found and returned.

docs.title: Content
docs.text: Subjects:

docs.title: Zoo Animals
docs.text:
• Zoo Animals Auto-created card for topic 'Zoo Animals'.
  • Żyrafa Bardzo wysokie zwierzę z długą szyją. Żyrafy są wyższe niż drzewa! Zjadają liście, do których inne zwierzęta nie mogą dosięgnąć.
  • Lew Duży kot zwany królem zwierząt. Żyje w grupach zwanych stadami.
  • Małpa Inteligentne zwierzę, które potrafi się wspinać i bawić. Niektóre małpy żyją w dużych rodzinach.
  • Pingwin Ptak, który nie lata, ale świetnie pływa. Żyje w zimnych miejscach.
  • Słoń Duże zwierzę z trąbą. Słonie to największe zwierzęta chodzące po lądzie. Mają duże uszy i uwielbiają pryskać wodą!

docs.title: wroclaw zoo
docs.text:
• Ogród Zoologiczny we Wrocławiu Duży ogród zoologiczny we Wrocławiu, w którym można poznać wiele zwierząt.
  • Opiekun zoo Osoba opiekująca się zwierzętami w zoo.
  • Wybieg dla zwierząt Bezpieczna przestrzeń w zoo, w której mogą żyć zwierzęta.
  • Dyrektor zoo Osoba zarządzająca zoo i pomagająca zwiedzającym.

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Młode Mały lew.

Iglica Wysoka metalowa rzeźba obok Centennial Hall.

Papuga Jasny ptak, który potrafi naśladować dźwięki.

Paw Kolorowy ptak z dużym ogonem z piór.

Podpisać Tablica z prostymi faktami, które pomogą Ci się uczyć.

Wrocław Miasto w Polsce z rzekami, mostami i historią.

Flaga Wrocławia Flaga miasta, którą należy znaleźć i zwrócić.

docs.title: Le collier d'ambre de Gdańsk (pl_05) - Script
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

docs.title: quest_start
docs.text:
// pl_05 | The Amber Necklace of Gdańsk
// 
// WANTED:
// Cards:
// - baltic_sea_coast ( coastal geography)
// - BalticSea (water body)
// - amber (regional treasure)
// - baltic_lighthouse (maritime navigation)
// Activities:
// cleancanvas beach_shells        - Beachcombing: reveal 5 SHELL piles. (BEACH, SAND, SHELL)
// cleancanvas beach_amber         - Beachcombing: reveal 5 AMBER piles. (AMBER, BALTIC SEA)
// jigsawpuzzle gdansk_lighthouse  - Rebuild LIGHTHOUSE image; role of a LIGHTHOUSE.
// order necklace_sequence         - Craft NECKLACE: pattern of AMBER + SHELL.
// memory sea_vocab                - Memory cards: FISHERMAN, CUTTER, NET, SEAL, BEACH, AMBER

// order necklace_sequence         - Craft NECKLACE: pattern of AMBER + SHELL.

docs.title: Le collier d'ambre de Gdańsk (pl_05)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: Poland - Gdańsk

Protégez la faune locale dans cette aventure en mer Baltique

docs.title: Content
docs.text: Subjects:

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Ambre Résine d'arbre fossile brillante appelée « Or de la Baltique ».

Chambre d'ambre Une célèbre pièce en ambre avec une histoire mystérieuse.

mer Baltique Une grande mer du nord de l'Europe, où se rencontrent la Pologne, l'Allemagne et d'autres pays. Elle possède de magnifiques plages et est célèbre pour ses trésors d'ambre !

Côte de la mer Baltique La côte sablonneuse le long de la mer Baltique.

Coupeur Un petit bateau de pêche utilisé en mer.

Écosystème Les êtres vivants et leur habitat dans la nature, travaillant ensemble.

Pêcheur Une personne qui attrape du poisson en mer.

Filet de pêche Un filet utilisé pour attraper du poisson.

Gdańsk Une ville portuaire en Pologne sur la mer Baltique.

Phare de Gdańsk Un phare historique qui aide les navires à trouver le port.

Hôtel de ville principal Un grand hôtel de ville avec une tour et un musée.

Rivière Motława La rivière qui traverse Gdańsk jusqu'à la mer.

Navigation Trouver son chemin en mer à l'aide de lumières, de cartes et d'outils.

Collier Un collier de perles ou de coquillages que vous portez autour du cou.

La fontaine de Neptune Une célèbre fontaine de Gdańsk avec la statue du dieu de la mer.

Port Un endroit où les navires chargent et déchargent.

Mouette Un oiseau marin qui vit près de la côte.

Joint Un animal marin sauvage qui se repose sur les plages.

Coquillage Une coquille dure provenant d'un animal marin ; idéale pour l'artisanat.

Bateau Un grand bateau qui transporte des personnes ou des marchandises.

Flots Eau en mouvement sur la mer.

Grue Żuraw Une ancienne grue portuaire et une porte de ville sur la rivière.

docs.title: Quest Script
docs.text: See the full script here

docs.title: Activities
docs.text: • (none)

docs.title: Tasks
docs.text: • (none)

docs.title: Gameplay
docs.text:
• Difficulty: Normal
  • Duration (min): 10

docs.title: Credits
docs.text:
• Jan Stasienko (Poland) (content)
  • Lorenzo Castrovilli (Italy) (design)
  • Stefano Cecere (Italy) (development)
  • Valeria Passarella (Italy) (design)
  • Vieri Toti (Italy) (design)

docs.title: Game Design Notes
docs.text:
Mission The player must gather materials from a Baltic beach by playing a "beachcombing" mini-game. They will then use these materials in a simple crafting interface to create a necklace. This offering is used to solve the main problem of relighting the lighthouse.

GamePlay: Seek, Crafting, Mini-Games, Journey

Characters The Fisherman: A friendly character who provides information about his job, the local geography, and wildlife. Neptune: The statue at Neptune's Fountain, who comes to life to accept the offering.

docs.title: Knowledge Content
docs.text:
Baltic Sea Characteristics:

  • The Baltic coast has beautiful sandy beaches.
  • It is a world-famous source of amber.
  • Wild seals live in and around the Baltic Sea.

Vocabulary: Learn words related to the sea: fisherman, cutter, fishing net, shell, fish, seal, beach, sand.

History & Culture:

  • Learn about the historic Gdańsk Lighthouse and its role.
  • Get a brief introduction to the legend of the Amber Room.

docs.title: Flow
docs.text:
The quest begins in Gdańsk near the Lighthouse, which is turned off. A message explains: "Antura has played a prank and turned off the lighthouse! The legend says only an offering to Neptune, king of the sea, can relight it. He desires a necklace made from the treasures of the Baltic: 5 pieces of amber and 5 beautiful seashells."

**The Beach: ** The player heads to the sandy beach. Mini-Game Shells: To find the items, the player plays a "beachcombing" game, dragging a rake tool across the sand to uncover the hidden amber and shells. 5 sand piles 1 for each piece of shell

Meet the Fisherman: meets a fisherman mending his fishing net next to his cutter. Mini-Game Amber 5 special piles 1 for each piece of amber Fisherman: "Witaj! I am a fisherman. I use this cutter to go out on the Baltic Sea and this net to catch fish.

The Crafting: Once all 10 items are collected, a simple crafting UI appears. The player drags the amber and shells onto a string in a pattern to create the necklace. (sequence activity) Use Activity Order. The order of the piles can be around the fountain

The Offering to Neptune: The player returns to Neptune's Fountain and places the finished necklace on the statue. The statue of Neptune glows and speaks with a deep voice. Neptune: "A fine offering! This beautiful amber reminds me of the lost Amber Room! (A pop-up explains the Amber Room mystery). You have shown respect for the sea. I will grant your wish!" With a flash of light from Neptune's trident, the Lighthouse beam turns on in the distance.

Conclusion - The Final Lesson: The player wins the race, reaching the seals just in time to block Antura, who then scampers away. The fisherman walks over. Fisherman: "Well done! These are wild seals. We must always keep our distance to keep them safe and happy in their natural home. Look there is Antura! Go there Walk to antura (pay attention to seals -1) Antura: The quest is complete.

Final Assessment Question: 4 questions on pictures (2 answers each) (An image of amber) -> Amber (An image of a fish) -> Fish (An image of a seal) -> Seal (An image of a beach) -> Beach

docs.title: Resources
docs.text:
Gdańsk Nowy Port Lighthouse: historic 19th century structure, built in 1894, that used to guide ships into Gdansk’s harbor and was among the first lighthouses on the Baltic Sea coast to use electric light. It’s currently open to visitors as a museum and offers a panoramic view of the Baltic Sea and port area.

Baltic Sea – shore in Gdańsk (photo of Brzeźno Beach): it is known for sandy beaches, brisk sea breeze, and scenic coast. It’s a popular spot for both locals and tourists, especially during summer.

Amber: also known as Baltic Gold, is fossilized tree resin that can be found along the shores of the Baltic Sea. It can often contain ancient inclusions like insects or plant matter. It is prized for its warm hues and used to be traded along the famous Amber Road connecting northern Europe to the Mediterranean.

The Amber Room: world famous chamber decorated in amber panels, originally created in the 18th century by German and Gdansk-based artisans. A replica now resides in Catherine Palace near St. Petersburg, but its mysterious wartime disappearance links it forever to Gdansk’s amber trade.

Żuraw: medieval port crane and one of Gdansk’s most iconic landmarks. Built in the 15th century, it served both as a loading crane and a city gate along the Motława River.

Neptun’s fountain: historic fountain in Gdansk located in Gdansk’s Long Market and in front of the Main Town Hall, symbolizes the city’s connection to the sea. The statue of the sea god has stood there since the 17th century and is a popular meeting point for visitors.

Town Hall: the Main Town Hall is an example of Gothic – Renaissance architecture with a soaring tower and richly decorated interiors. It now houses the city’s historical museum and offers panoramic views from the tower.

docs.title: La collana d'ambra di Danzica (pl_05)
docs.text:
Quest Index - Language: english - french - polish - italian

Educators & Designers: help improving this quest!

Comments and feedback: discuss in the Forum Improve translations: comment the Google Sheet Improve the script: propose an edit here

Version: 1.00 Status: NeedsReview Location: Poland - Danzica

Proteggi la fauna selvatica locale in questa avventura nel Mar Baltico

docs.title: Content
docs.text: Subjects:

docs.title: Additional Cards
docs.text:
Ambra Resina fossile lucida di albero chiamata "oro baltico".

Camera d'Ambra Una famosa stanza fatta di ambra con una storia misteriosa.

Mar Baltico Un grande mare nel nord Europa, dove si incontrano Polonia, Germania e altri paesi. Ha spiagge bellissime ed è famoso per i tesori d'ambra!

Costa del Mar Baltico La costa sabbiosa lungo il Mar Baltico.

Taglierina Una piccola barca da pesca usata in mare.

Ecosistema Gli esseri viventi e la loro casa nella natura, che lavorano insieme.

Pescatore Persona che pesca in mare.

Rete da pesca Una rete usata per catturare i pesci.

Danzica Città portuale in Polonia sul Mar Baltico.

Faro di Danzica Un faro storico che aiuta le navi a trovare il porto.

Municipio principale Un alto municipio con torre e museo.

Fiume Motława Il fiume che attraversa Danzica fino al mare.

Navigazione Orientarsi in mare utilizzando luci, mappe e strumenti.

Collana Una collana di perline o conchiglie da indossare intorno al collo.

Fontana di Nettuno Una famosa fontana di Danzica con la statua del dio del mare.

Porta Un luogo dove le navi caricano e scaricano.

Gabbiano Un uccello marino che vive vicino alla costa.

Foca Un animale marino selvatico che riposa sulle spiagge.

Conchiglia Un guscio duro di un animale marino, ottimo per i lavoretti.

Nave Una grande imbarcazione che trasporta persone o merci.

Onde Acqua in movimento sul mare.

Żuraw Crane Una vecchia gru portuale e una porta della città sul fiume.
